In order to continue to grow he’s asked for a new loan to pay his final fees for his course of studies.  Nestor will reach his goals with much effort and work and Edaprospo loans will help him.

loans.use: to pay his final fees for his DJ course.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es: Leticia, tiene la edad  de 42   años, está casada y vive con su esposo y seis hijos. Ella pretende con el crédito realizar la asistencia de su finca, la cual cuenta con una parte de café y la otra de pasto en la que tiene unas vaca. Ella  pretende invertir en insumos como abonos, mano de obra y fungicidas para obtener una mejor cosecha del café y sembrar una mejor calidad de pasto para sus vacas. Ella quiere obtener una buena producción del café y con mejores pastos poder obtener mejores resultados con el ganado y poder mantener mas vacas. Ella quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y así tener una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Leticia is 42 years of age, married, living with her husband and six children.  She intends to use the loan for her farm which part of it is planted with coffee and the other with grass where she keeps some cows.  

She intends to use the loan to buy manure, fungicide and to pay labor costs to obtain a better coffee harvest and to plant a better quality of grass for her cows.  She wants to obtain a good coffee production and with better grasses obtain better results with the cattle to be able to raise more cows.  She wants to generate higher profits for her and her family’s wellbeing and thus to have better economic stability.

This is the first loan she’s received from Fudecosur.  She’s had no previous loans with state banks but Fudecosur gave the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies like chemicals, herbicides and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Zelimkhan

texts.en:
Zelimkhan is 52 years old and lives in a small village of mountainous Kakheti. He is married and lives with his family: his wife, Lamara, and three children, Yusuf, Ibragim and Adam. The family lives in poverty. Their only source of income is small scale agricultural activities – they have a vineyard and grow maize (corn) on a small family-owned plot. Their total average monthly income is 100 Laris. 

Zelimkhan has requested a loan to start up two businesses – a grocery store and a canteen in the village. The necessary furniture and equipment were purchased by Zelimkhan couple of years ago with funds he collected abroad from his hard work, but he doesn't have funds to start operating these businesses. With this loan, he will buy grocery products to sell in the store. He will work as the salesman himself. Another part of the loan will be used to buy products for his canteen. There will be three persons employed by the canteen – a cook, one waiter and one dishwasher/cleaner. According to Zelimkhan’s estimations, both businesses will be profitable and will expand in the future. 

Zelimkhan’s loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages helping start-ups and re-startups with credits to rural poor who do not have access to credit and are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income. 

The living conditions of the family will significantly improve and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on country’s capital market.

loans.use: to buy products for a grocery store and canteen.

loans.name: Armen

texts.ru:
Армен занимается ремонтом и покраской автомобилей на протяжении 20 лет. Он арендует помещение, которое он переоборудовал в автомастерскую. Армен покупает старые автомобили, чинит их, красит и продает. Также он принимает индивидуальные заказы на ремонт и покраску автомобилей. 
Армен в течении несколько лет жил в Росси и занимался там тем же бизнесом. Он привез из России все необходимое оборудования для своего бизнеса и сейчас продолжает свой бизнес в Армении. Благодаря прибыли от бизнеса Армен приобрел грузовой автомобиль с помощью которого он перевозит необходимые запчасти для своего бизнеса. 
Армену 42 года, он проживает в городе Капан. Армен женат и у него есть две дочери, которые учаться в школе. Также вместе с Арменом живут его родители. 
Благодаря своему бизнесу Армен содержит семью. Он уже получал кредит от Нор Оризон, и сейчас ему необходимо 1.000.000 драм для покупки небольшого старого грузового автомобиля. Он собирается отремонтироваться и покрасить данный автомобиль, а потом перепродать его.
texts.en: Armen has been involved in repairing and painting cars for 20 years.  He leases a space, which he remodeled to serve as an auto repair shop.  Armen buys old cars, fixes and paints them and then sells them.  He also accepts individual orders for auto repairs and painting.  Armen lived in Russia for several years and was involved in the same business there.  He brought all of the necessary equipment for his business from Russia and currently continues his business in Armenia.  Thanks to the profits from the business, Armen purchased a truck, with the help of which he transports essential spare parts for his business.  Armen is 42 years old.  He lives in the city of Kapan.  He is married and has two daughters, who attend school.  Armen's parents also live with him.  Thanks to his business, Armen provides for his family.  He had previously obtained a loan from Nor Horizon and currently needs 1,000,000 dram to purchase a small used truck.  He plans to repair and paint this vehicle and then resell it.

loans.use: to buy a used truck in order to repair, paint and sell it

loans.name: Mavlida

texts.ru: Мавлида вдова и на воспитании имеет одного сына. Она очень трудолюбивая женщина, которая более семь лет занимается купле- продажей мелкого и крупного рогатого скота. Её муж занимался этим бизнесом, и после его смерти она продолжала данный бизнес сама. Её единственный сын иногда помогает ей по бизнесу. Мавлида запрашивает займ для покупки крупного рогатого скота с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Mavlida is a widow and is raising a son. She is a very hard-working woman, who for over seven years has been raising cattle and smaller livestock for sale. This used to ber her husband's business, and after his death Mavlida continues it on her own, with occasional help from her son. Mavlida is requesting a loan to purchase cattle in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Матлуба проживает в городе Худжанд. Возраст, 47 лет. Замужем. Имеет троих детей. Она занимается продажей бензина. Этим видом деятельности занимается 15 лет. Кредит берет для закупа топлива.
texts.en: Matluba lives in the city of Khujand. She is 47 years old, married, and has three children. Matluba sells gasoline and has been in this business for 15 years. She is taking this loan to purchase more fuel.

loans.use: to purchase fuel

loans.name: Oimhol

texts.ru: Оимхол жительница района Вахш. Ей 45 лет. У нее семеро детей. Ее сын работает в России. Сама она имеет среднее образование. Она уже 18 лет занимается животноводством. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Oimhol is a resident of the Vakhsh district.  She is 45 years old and has seven children.  Her son works in Russia.  Oimhol has a secondary education.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for 18 years.  She is requesting this loan to buy calves.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Hikmat

texts.ru: Хикмат замужем и любящая мать двоих детей. Она очень трудолюбивая, добрая и целеустремленная женщина. Более 17 лет она занимается торговлей, начала свой бизнес с продажей женских тканей, детской и женской одежды. Уже более 8 лет занимается купле- продажей мужской обуви. Иногда старший сын помогает по бизнесу. Хикмат запрашивает займ для покупки летней обуви с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Hikmat is married and a loving mother of two children. She is very kind, hard-working and driven woman. She has been in sales for over 17 years, having started her business by selling women's fabrics as well as women's and children's clothing. For the past 8 years, she has also been selling men's footwear, with occasional help from her oldest son. Hikmat is requesting this loan to purchase summer shoes in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy summer footwear

loans.name: Emergente Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Emergente” está conformado por 18 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran venta de ropa, venta de enseres, negocios con semillas, preparación de alimentos, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Talca.
Myrtha presidenta del grupo del Banco comunal quien en la foto se encuentra en la segunda fila, en el lugar de en medio, vistiendo una polera color negro y jeans. Su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y usa una melena corta. Como referencia se encuentra al lado de una emprendedora que usa una polera color verde.
Myrtha se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente vendiendo ropa nueva de dama. Trabaja en éste negocio desde hace 4 años. Su mercadería la vende en un local que está ubicado en una feria persa. Ahí trabaja en horario continuado de 10ºº de la mañana hasta las 20ºº horas.
Sus productos los compra en el “Barrio patronato” sector comercial de ropa.
Con el crédito comprará ropa para dama.
Una de las motivaciones de Myrtha de continuar con el negocio, se deben a que le permite costear los estudios superiores de sus hijas, quienes asisten a la Universidad.
Myrtha es viuda y tiene tres hijas. Sus sueños es que tengan acceso a estudiar y sean profesionales.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la ayuda brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. 
Respecto a las capacitaciones, estas le han servido para conocer nuevas estrategias de negocio, en cuanto a la administración y contabilidad. Por otro lado se siente muy cómoda y contenta con el grupo del Banco comunal dl cual forma parte, ya que las reuniones son muy amenas y el grupo también es muy unido. 
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Emergente” (Emergent) and it’s formed by 18 entrepreneurs who carry out a variety of lines of work among which are found clothing sales, appliance sales, seed business and food preparation, among others.  All are from the city of Talca.

Myrtha, communal bank president, appears in the photo in the middle of the second row wearing a black shirt and jeans.  Her hair is dark brown and in a short bob.  As a reference, she appears next to an entrepreneur wearing a green shirt.

Myrtha is a merchant, specifically selling new women’s clothing.  She’s been working in this business for four years.  She sells her merchandise in a locale located in a street market.  She works non-stop from 10am until 8pm.  She buys her products in “Barrio Patronato,” the commercial area for clothes.  She will use the loan to buy women’s clothes.

One of the motivating factors for Myrtha to continue with the business is that it allows her to cover her daughters’ higher education costs; they are attending University. Myrtha is a widow and has three daughters.  Her dream is that they can access education and that they become professionals.
She is very happy and grateful for the help provided by Fondo Esperanza because it will make it possible for her to invest in her business.

With respect to the training, it’s helped her learn new business strategies in accounting and administration.  On the other hand, she feels very comfortable and happy with her group in the communal bank that she’s part of because the meetings are very pleasant and the group is also very united.

Talca belongs to the Maule region located in the center of the country.  It’s the administrative, economic and cultural center of the region being the most important city in the Chilean Central Valley.  

There is a curious phrase in Chile about Talca: “Talca, París y Londres” (Talca, Paris and London). Among the myths concerning it some say that it’s a derivation originally made by an Englishman: “Talca parece Londres” (Talca seems like London) because of the abundant fog that frequently blankets the city in winter very much like in the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora Magdalena ya ha tenido cuatro créditos con KIVA los cuales ha pagado puntual mente. Esta solicitando un crédito para la compra un carro, que le esta haciendo falta para poder mover su mercancía, ya que se dedica a la venta de accesorio y aparatos eléctricos en diferentes partes de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. 
Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia, ya que es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad. 
Doña Magdalena espera contar con su cooperación en este préstamo, para que pueda compra el carro que necesita y así tener más ganancia en su negocio.
texts.en:
Magdalena has already had four Kiva loans that she has paid promptly. She is requesting a loan to buy a car, which she needs to be able to transport her merchandise. She sells accessories and electrical goods in different sections of the city of Nuevo Laredo. This business is the source of income for her family, as she is a single mother with two children under her care.
 
Magdalena looks forward to the partnership in this loan, so that she will be able to buy the car she needs to increase the profits from her business.

loans.use: to buy a car for her business selling small goods.

loans.name: Adjeniya Group

texts.fr: ADJENIYA est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans la même zone. La représentante du groupe, Faïssatou (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 44 ans et est mariée à un vitrier du nom de Deen. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés mais seulement deux restent à leur charge. Faïssatou a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Faïssatou vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de dix sept ans, Faïssatou  vend des produits vivriers (maïs, haricot, riz, farine de manioc) dans un marché du Benin. Faïssatou s’approvisionne dans une région du Benin. C’est la quatrième fois que Faïssatou et les autres membres du groupe ADJENIYA sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leurs activités et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The ADJENIYA group is made up of three members who live in the same area.  The leader of the group, Faïssatou (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 44 years old and married to a glazier named Deen.  The couple has four children.  All of them attend school but only two of them are still in their care.   Faïssatou left school at the primary level.  She lives with her children and husband and together they are able to meet the different household needs.  For more than 17 years, Faïssatou has been selling produce (corn, beans, rice, manioc flour) in a market in Benin.  Faïssatou gets her supplies in a region of Benin.  This is the fourth time that Faïssatou and the other members of the ADJENIYA group have requested financial help through ALIDé in order to increase their working capital and their business, and to be better able to meet the demands of their customers.  The previous loans have all been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn, beans, rice, and manioc flour.

loans.name: Farogatniso

texts.ru: Фарогатнисо замужем и любящая мать двоих детей. Она очень трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина. Она всегда старается улучшить свои жилищные условия и расширить свой бизнес. Более 10 лет она занимается купле- продажей продовольственных товаров. Данный бизнес является семейным бизнесом, муж и дети также помогают ей. Раньше торговала дома, в своем гараже открыла магазин, а теперь имеет магазин в многолюдном месте в своей махалле. Фарогатнисо запрашивает займ для покупки напитков, колбасных и молочных изделий с целью пополнения оборотного капитала.
texts.en: Farogatniso is married and a loving mother of two children.  She is a very hardworking and goal-oriented woman.  She always tries to improve her living conditions and expand her business.  Farogatniso has been involved in buying and selling food products for over ten years.  This is the family business, where her husband and children also help her.  She previously sold at home by opening a store in her garage, and now has a store in a well-traveled area in her mahalla.  Farogatniso is requesting this loan to purchase beverages, sausage and milk goods in order to refill her working capital.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Abdurashit

texts.ru: Абдурашит женат и любящий отец двоих детей. Более 8 лет Абдурашит занимается выпечкой национальных лепёшек с орехом и кунжутом. Лепешки продает на рынке, продавцы закупают оптом. Также принимает заказы на мероприятия. Раньше был учеником, а теперь сам является собственником бизнеса. Жена помогает по бизнесу, а также имеет двух работников. Абдурашит запрашивает займ для покупки угля и муки для изготовления лепешек. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Abdurashit is married and a loving father of two children.  He has been involved in baking national flatbread with nuts and sesame seeds for over eight years.  He sells the flatbread at a market, where sellers buy wholesale.  He also accepts orders for events.  Abdurashit was previously an apprentice and is now a business owner.  His wife helps with the business, and he also has two employees.  Abdurashit is requesting this loan to purchase coal and flour in order to make flatbread.  He relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy coal and flour

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru: Сухроб добросовестный и трудолюбивый человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Супруга занимается домохозяйством. Более одного года Сухроб занимается купле- продажей мужской одежды и обуви. Начал свой бизнес на арендованную торговую точку, а теперь имеет свой магазин. Сухроб запрашивает займ в размере 5000 Сомони для покупки летней одежды с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Suhrob is a conscientious and hardworking person.  He is married and raising two children.  His wife is involved in household work.  Suhrob has been involved in buying and selling men's clothing and shoes for over a year.  He started his business at a leased retail outlet and now has his own store.  Suhrob is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 Somoni to purchase summer clothing in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase summer clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials in larger amounts, a fryer and Eternit [fiber cement] panels.

loans.name: Damian Jasir

texts.es: Damian de 30 años vive al sur de la ciudad con su cónyuhe y tiene dos hijos en las edades de 2 y 5 años. él es propietario de una cerrajería. Oficio al que se dedicó su padre y como  a él como le gustó, hace 5 años se dedica a ella, con el fin de generar ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Su negocio consiste en elaborar duplicados de llaves de viviendas, vehículos y arreglo de candados. Su meta es continuar el crecimiento de su negocio para  generar ingresos superiores que los actuales, con el propósito de sacar adelante a sus hijos, ofreciéndoles posibilidades de obtener una buena educación. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, también primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará,  insumos de cerrajería en mayor volumen con el fin de tener un inventario y responder de manera más efectiva a su clientela.
texts.en:
Damian is 30, and lives south of the city with his partner. He has two children, ages 2 ad 5.  He owns a locksmith's shop, a trade his father worked in. As he liked this work too, he has been doing it for five years, in order to generate income to support his household. 

His business involves making duplicates of house and vehicle keys, and fixing locks. His goal is to keep his business growing, so that it generates higher income than it does now. His aim is to help his children get ahead in life, offering them the opportunity to get a good education. 

Currently, he is applying for his first credikiva loan, which is also his first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use it to buy locksmith's supplies in greater volume, with the goal of having an inventory of supplies and dealing with his customers more effectively.

loans.use: To buy locksmith's supplies in greater volume.

loans.name: Tunica

texts.en: Tunica is 22 years old and lives in Sinkor. She is single and has two children, ages 1 and 3. For the past few years she has been selling charcoal and chicken in the market. Her number of customers fluctuates. She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal and chicken for her business. She hopes to live a better life in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and chicken for her business.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: Maria compró insumos de piñatería como papelería, silicona, telas, cartulinas, moldes y compró también una batidora. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará insumos de alta gama, fuentes de chocolate, cocteleras, moldes para muffins, un horno micorondas, para fundir chocolate e inversiones varias. El éxito de su inversión radica en que todas estas herramientas le ayudaran a diversificar su oferta y ha hacer mas efectivo el trabajo de Maria.  Su mensaje a los financiadores es el siguiente: “Les agradezco a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y a Kiva por haberme permitido agrandar y prosperar el negocio ya que me facilita el trabajo y cualifica mis productos haciendo a muchas personas felices con el servicio recibido. “
texts.en:
María bought supplies to make piñatas like paper, silicone, fabric, construction paper and patterns and also bought a blender.  She is currently applying for a new Kiva loan to buy high quality ingredients, chocolate fountains, cocktail shakers, muffin pans, a microwave oven to melt chocolate and various investments.  The success of her investment rests in that all these tools will help her diversify her offer and make María’s work more efficient.

Her message to lenders is the following: “I am grateful to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and to Kiva for having allowed me to grow and prosper in the business since it makes my work easier and improves the quality of my products making many people happy with the services rendered.”

loans.use: to buy high quality ingredients, chocolate fountains, cocktail shakers, muffin pans, a microwave oven to melt chocolate and various investments.

loans.name: Yackelin

texts.es:
Yackelin es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Mensajeras”  ubicado en el distrito Juliaca, provincia San Román  y departamento de Puno, tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, actualmente se encuentra estudiando.

Viene trabajando  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años,  nos cuenta que su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio venta de prendas deportivas.

La señorita solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de  S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar materiales, como un rollo de dril, cinta reflectiva, cierres, bolsas, etc. para la confección de chalecos y mamelucos, trabaja con sus padres.
	
Su sueño para el futuro  es terminar sus estudios y exportar la mercadería otros lugares..

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la puntualidad, responsabilidad  y las charlas
texts.en:
Yackelin is a member of the “Las Mensajeras” communal bank located in Juliaca District, San Román Province and Puno Department.  She’s 22 years old, single and has no children.  She’s currently attending school.

She’s been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for two years.  She tells us that her first loan was for 500 new soles that she used to increase her sportswear selling business’ working capital.

She will now request a new loan in the amount of 2500 new soles to buy supplies like a bolt of denim, reflective strips, clasps, pockets, etc. to make vests and overalls; she works with her parents.

Her dream for the future is to complete her studies and to export the merchandise to other places.  What she likes best about her communal bank is the punctuality, the responsibility and the talks.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is a widow with two children. She sells salted fish, cooking oil, and other food items at Kwahinkrom. She has done this for 30 years. She is responsible for paying her children's school fees. She will use her loan to purchase more salted fish and other food items for sale.  With the new profit she earns, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase more salted fish and other food items for sale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua lives together with the husband and three children at Kwahinkrom, near Elmina. Her husband is a farmer. Efua fries plantains for sale and serves them with bean stew. Efua uses her income to assist her husband with their utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase plantains and beans to prepare for sale. With the new profit, Efua will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase plantains and beans to prepare her food for sale.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is married with five dependents. Her husband is a farmer. Aba cooks wakye (rice and beans cooked together) for sale, which she serves with gari, macaroni, meat, and fish stew at Kwahinkrom, near Elmina. She has done this for the past seven years now. Aba assists her husband by paying their children’s school fees with her income. Aba will use her loan to buy bags of rice, beans, and other ingredients to use in preparing her wakye for sale. Aba will use her new profit to expand her business.

loans.use: buy bags of rice, beans, and other ingredients to prepare her food for sale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 46 years old, married, and has six children.  She lives in Sinkor. She runs a table at the market where she sells rice, pepper, bitter ball, vita, and others items.  She started this business with the help from her father and learned this way of selling from him.

Esther is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more pepper, bitter ball, rice, vita, and others items for her business.  She likes her business because she earns more profits, which she will use to to build a house on her piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more pepper, bitter ball, rice, and vita,

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth sells clothes, bags, and footwear. She has done this for ten years now. Elizabeth is married and has three children. Her husband is a businessman. Elizabeth uses her income to assist her husband in feeding and clothing their children. Elizabeth needs this loan to purchase more cloth, bags, and footwear to sell. With the additional profit, she will acquire a shop to enable her sell her clothes and bags.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, bags, and footwear to sell.

loans.name: Guldasta

texts.ru:
Гулдаста 23 года, воспитывает годовалого сына.  Гулдаста занимается перепродажей сельхозпродукции, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS).  Благодаря упорному труду Гулдаста в закупе, чистке и перепродаже грецких орехов, на сегодняшний день ее ежемесячная выручка составляет около 15,000 сом.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулдаста обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на увеличение товарооборота.  Доходы от кредита Гулдаста планирует вложить в расширение своей бизнес – деятельности за счет закупа и откорма скота.
texts.en: Guldasta is 23 years old and raising a year-old son.  She is involved in selling agricultural products, having started this business with an amount of 5,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her hard work in buying, cleaning and reselling walnuts, today her monthly profit is about 15,000 som.  In order to further develop her business, Guldasta requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to increase product turnover.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into expanding her business by purchasing and fattening up livestock.

loans.use: to increase product turnover

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy sells soup and maize at Kwahinkrom, Elmina. She has been selling this since 10 years ago. Lucy is married to a farmer and has 7 dependents. Lucy assists her husband to provide for their family.

Her loan will be used to purchase boxes of soup and maize. She plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of soup and maize

loans.name: Las Perlas Group

texts.es:
Las Perlas se denomina el grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, el cual se formo gracias a una de las miembros que unió a sus amigas y vecinas de barrio para formar el grupo. Las Perlas trabaja con la fundación desde el año 2008 y se destaca por su trabajo en equipo y su solidaridad.
Elena es una de estas mujeres, ella nos cuenta que es modista, a lo cual se dedica hace un buen tiempo y por lo que ya tiene una buena clientela. Ella trabaja todos los días arduamente y de esa forma tiene los ingresos para poder dar a su familia lo que necesitan para una buena vida.
Ella solicita la ayuda de kiva para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas y demás insumos para hacer las prendas en su taller
texts.en:
This group composed of women from the city of Itá is called “Las Perlas” (The Pearls).  It formed thanks to one of the members who gathered friends and neighbors from the neighborhood together to form the group.  Las Perlas has worked with the Fundación since 2008 and stands out for its team work and solidarity.

Elena is one of these women.  She tells us that she’s a dressmaker.  She’s been doing this for quite some time so she has a good clientele already.  She works hard every day to earn income to give her family everything they need for a good life.

She is asking for Kiva help to buy fabric, thread, glue and other supplies to make clothes in her workshop.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Gricelda

texts.es:
Gricelda es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Mensajeras”  ubicado en el distrito Juliaca, provincia San Román  y departamento de Puno, tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente  y tiene 04 hijos, estudió educación secundaria (incompleto).

Viene trabajando  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 05 años,  nos cuenta que su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio  de venta de abarrotes.  Actualmente se dedica a la venta de materiales para construcción.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de  S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará para el pago del alquiler del volquete y/o maquinarias, también se dedica a la venta de productos Herbalife, esto lo hace en sus ratos libres.  En el negocio de venta de materiales trabaja junto con su esposo.
	
Su sueño para el futuro  es tener una buena casa, tener un carro para su uso personal.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es el ahorro y sus utilidades.
texts.en:
Griselda’s a member of the “Las Mensajeras” communal bank located in Juliaca District, San Román Province and Puno Department.  She’s 35 years old, has a spouse and four children and attended secondary school (incomplete).

She’s been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for five years.  She tells us that her first loan was for 300 new soles that she used to increase capital in her grocery selling business.  She currently works selling building supplies.

She will request a new loan in the amount of 500 new soles that she’ll use to pay the lease on a dump truck and/or machinery.  She also sells Herbalife products in her free time.  She works with her husband in the building supply sales.

Her dream for the future is to have a good house and a car for her personal use.  What she most likes about her communal bank is the savings and the earnings on them.

loans.use: to pay to lease the dump truck and/or machinery.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia sells shoes, ladies wear and children's wear at Hwahinkrom near Elmina, which she has done for 5 years now. She is married with 4 children and her husband is a farmer. She uses her income to support her husband to pay their accomodation and utility bills.

Cecilia will use her loan to purchase shoes, ladies wear and clothes to sell. With the new profit, she wishes to acquire a shop for the sale of her goods.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, ladies wear and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort lives together with her husband, who is a farmer, and 4 children at Kwahinkrom. Comfort sells shoes and slippers, which she has done for 5 years now. She uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of their family.

Comfort will use her loan to purchase more shoes and slippers to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes and slippers to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 56 years old and lives in Sinkor. She is married and has two children aged 22 and 35 years old.

For the past eight years she has been selling bread in her community. She enjoys her business because she has a lot of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bread for her business. Her plan is to build her children a house.

loans.use: to purchase more bread for her business

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena has been selling secondhand ladies wear and children’s wear for four years. She has four children and is married to a mason.  She uses her to income to help her husband to pay their accomodations and utility bills. Abena needs this loan to purchase more secondhand ladies wear and children’s wear to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Abena will acquire a shop for the sale of her secondhand clothes.

loans.use: purchase more secondhand clothing to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia sells clothing and bags. She is married to a farmer and has two children. They live together at Kwahinkrom near Elmina. She has been selling clothes for five years now and uses her income to support her husband to pay their children’s school fees. Cecilia will use her loan to purchase clothes and bags to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and bags to sell

loans.name: Juntos Podemos Confluencia Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Juntos Podemos Confluencia” está conformado por 17 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran servicios de música para eventos, venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos por catalogo, almacenes de abarrotes y preparación de comida rápida entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillán.
Margarita integrante del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en el primer lugar de izquierda a derecha, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa recogido. Viste una polera color negro y usa pantalones color beige. Además su mano derecha la tiene alzada para saludar. 
Ella se dedica a atender una fuente de soda desde hace 4 años, éste local lo construyó su marido, quien se dedica a la construcción como oficio. Ella atiende solo los fines de semana desde las 11º de la mañana hasta las 11ºº de la noche en horario continuado, ya que generalmente los sábados y domingos son días de alta demanda, sobre todo los fines de mes (fechas de pago de sus clientes).
Su mercadería la compra usualmente en distribuidoras y supermercados mayoristas en la ciudad de Chillán, una o dos veces a la semana.
Con el crédito comprará churrascos, vienesas, hamburguesas, bebidas, pan, tomate, palta, mayonesa, kétchup y un galón de gas. 
Una de sus metas es convertir su fuente de soda en un restaurante o cocinería, donde pueda ofrecer una mayor variedad de platos preparados.
Además comenta que necesita comprar una freidora de papas.
Margarita vive junto a su marido y sus hijas de 6 y 2 años de edad, la mayor de sus hijas asiste al colegio.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo esperanza, ya que con ésta inversión que realizará le permitirá vender mucho más.
Respecto al grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte, ella comenta que se siente muy cómoda y contenta.
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
This communal bank called “Juntos Podemos Confluencia” [Together We Can Find Common Ground], comprises 17 entrepreneurs who do different types of activities, among which are providing music for events, selling clothing, selling cosmetics from catalogs, running grocery stores, and preparing fast foods. All of them live in the city of Chillán.

Margarita, a member of the communal bank, is the first person on the left in the photo. Her hair is dark brown, and she wears it up. She is wearing a black shirt and beige pants. She is also waving her right hand. 

For 4 years she has managed a soda fountain, which her husband built. He works in construction. She is only there on the weekends from 11 am until 11 pm continuously, since usually Saturdays and Sundays are the busiest days, especially at the end of the month (paydays for her customers).
She normally buys her merchandise once or twice a week from distributors and wholesale supermarkets in Chillán. With this loan, she will buy steaks, hot dogs, hamburgers, beverages, bread, tomatoes, avocados, mayonnaise, ketchup and a gallon of gas. One of her goals is to convert her soda fountain into a restaurant or eatery, where she could offer a wider variety of prepared foods. She also says she needs a potato fryer.

Margarita lives with her husband and two girls, who are 6 and 2 years old. Her oldest daughter attends high school. She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza. This investment would allow her to sell much more. With respect to her communal bank, she says she feels very comfortable and pleased to be a member.

Chillán is a town in south-central Chile. Its name means “seat of the sun” in mapudungun, the language of our indigenous mapuches. Chillán is known as “Cradle of the Homeland” or “Land of Artists” because it has been the birthplace of distinguished people like, for example, the well-known pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: to buy steaks, hot dogs, hamburgers, beverages, bread, tomatoes, avocados, mayonnaise, ketchup and a gallon of gas.

loans.name: Marangatu Rape Group

texts.es:
El presente comité es de la ciudad de Asunción, se encuentra en su 2º ciclo. Podemos decir que todas las integrantes tienen actividades independientes, pero también realizan trabajos en conjunto para que de esa forma puedan fomentar su compañerismo y unión.
Podemos hablar de la señora María que se dedica al reciclado de artículos, ya sea de plástico, cobre., metal, etc. Ella vive en una casa sencilla con sus seis hijos de los cuales tres son pequeños todavía. Junto a su marido se sacrifican  para que algún día sus hijos no pasen por las mismas necesidades por las que ella tuvo que pasar. Nos comenta que está muy orgullosa de lo que hace, pues es un trabajo digno y por sobre todo honesto.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de plásticos, cartones y demás artículos, para después revenderlos con un margen de ganancia, ya que esto le ayudara a tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
This committee is from the city of Asunción and is in its second cycle.  We can say that all the members have independent activities but also carry out joint projects to foster companionship and unity.

We can speak about María who works recycling articles be they plastic, copper, metal, etc.  She lives in a simple house with her six children three of which are still little.  Together with her husband they sacrifice so that one day their children will not go through the same needs she had to go through.  She comments that she’s very proud of what she does because it’s a proper job that’s above all honest.

She requested the loan to buy plastics, cardboard and other articles to later resell with a profit margin which will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to buy plastics, cardbord, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is a petty trader who sells jewelry such as earrings and necklaces and cosmetics at Kwahinkrom near Elmina, which she has been doing for eight years now. She is a widow and has four children. As a single parent, she uses her income to feed, clothe, and pay her children’s school fees.  Esi will use her loan to purchase more jewelry and cosmetics to sell.  With the new profit, she will expand her business

loans.use: to purchase more jewelry and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Mame

texts.en: Mame is a seamstress who also sells slippers. She is divorced and has two children. Mame has been in this business for 10 years now.  As a single parent, she uses her income to feed, clothe and pay her children’s school fees.  Mame makes dresses to sell. She needs a loan to purchase fabrics for the dresses she makes and to buy slippers to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and sippers

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena extracts palm oil to sell. She is married with five children and her husband is a farmer. Abena has been extracting oil for some years now. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their accommodations and utility bills. Abena will use this loan to purchase palm fruit and palm kennel to extract for oil to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Abena will purchase a machine for her business

loans.use: to purchase palm fruit and palm kennel

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es: La socia Florentina; la socia continua con su negocio del restaurante con especialidad en picanteria resulta que las picanterias son tradicionales y son establecimientos mas rusticos y con comida casera tradicional llamadas extras, platos mas grandes y mas elaborados, con el acompañamiento de la frutillada una bebida a base de maiz y de frutillas. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de carne, arroz, maíz amarillo, aceite, vasos para el establecimiento entre otros menores productos.
texts.en: Florentina continues with her restaurant business specializing in snacks.  It turns out that “picanterías” [traditional restaurants that specialize in a particular dish] are traditional, rustic establishments with traditional, home-style dishes called “extras,” and larger more elaborate dishes accompanied by “frutillada,” a beverage made from corn and strawberries.  She is asking for a loan to buy meat, rice, yellow corn, oil and [drinking] glasses, among other minor products, for the establishment.

loans.use: to buy meat, rice, yellow corn, oil and [drinking] glasses.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marina; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales, la socia cría pollos y cuyes, ella los hace engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pollos y cuyes y también alimentos para los animales.

  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Reyna de los Ángeles de Urquillos” communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Cusco Province.

Marina, 40, is married and has five children.  She alternates her daily chores with a business raising animals.  She raises chicks and guinea pigs.  She fattens them up and then sells them in various street markets and through this business supports her children.  Her dream is to have a locale where she can sell her animals.  

She’s asking for the loan to buy chicks, guinea pigs and feed for the animals.  She is happy because of the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy chicks, guinea pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena lives together with her husband at Frami near Abura. She extracts palm oil for sale. She has done this for ten years now. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their utility bills.

Abena will use her loan to purchase palm fruit so she can extract oil to sell. With the new profit, she wishes to purchase a machine for her business.

loans.use: to purchase palm fruit so she can extract oil to sell.

loans.name: Goodness Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Goodness” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each group member in order to invest in their businesses. 

Yei is the leader of this group. Yei, 50, is married and has six children, two of whom are attending secondary school. The rest are no longer attending school. 

Yei sells palm-oil, onions, salt, pepper, dried fish, etc. and has been doing this business for 27 years now. With the help of this loan, Yei will invest in her business by buying the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her current stock. 

Also included in the photo is Edmond A. Ndoinjeh (in the white shirt), handing over the loan to the borrowers.

loans.use: to buy palm-oil, onions, salt, pepper, dried fish, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells cooked rice and serves it with macaroni, meat and fish stew at Frami near Abura.  Ama has been selling cooked rice for the past 15 years now. She is married to a teacher and has eight dependants.  Ama uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees.  Her loan will be used to purchase bags of rice, meat and fish to prepare her food to sell. Ama will use her new profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, meat and fish to prepare her food to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary produces local soap for sale at Frami near Abura. She is married with children and her husband is a businessman. She uses her income to assist her husband for the general upkeep of their family. Mary will use her loan to buy the ingredients she uses in preparing her soap for sale. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy the ingredient she uses in producing her soap

loans.name: Leydi

texts.es: Leydi de 18 años de edad vive en Puerto Colombia, un municipio a la orilla del mar Caribe, muy cerca a la ciudad de Barranquilla; Leydi es bachiller y no pudo seguir estudiando por eso decidió poner en marcha su idea empresarial vendiendo productos, mediante guías especializadas a través de las cuales los promociona. Desde hace un año que inició su negocio ha tenido un buen funcionamiento, ella vende a vecinos, familiares y amigos que le refieren a otros clientes mas y con ello ha logrado consolidar su negocio. Ella es una persona muy exigente en la puntualidad de los pagos de sus clientes, por eso no goza de una abundante clientela pero si de la mejor, porque trabaja mucho en hacer una buena selección de ellos especialmente en lo que se refiere a venderle a crédito. Adicionalmente a la venta de mercancía,  tiene un punto de telecomunicaciones donde ofrece servicios de llamadas y vende pasabocas y frutas. El sueño de Leydi, es lograr terminar una carrera técnica y por eso está ahorrando para poder lograrlo. Su meta en el negocio es incrementar sus ventas, pues con ella maneja un margen de contribución no menor a un 35%, mientras que sus inventarios de productos rotan cada 7 días.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará futas de la temporada y ropa que trae su catalogo en descuentos, con estos productos se dispone encontrar una clientela ajustada a sus exigencia de recuperación de cartera, para lograr la sostenibilidad permanente de su negocio.
texts.en:
Leydi is 18 years old and lives in Puerto Colombia, a municipality on the shore of the Caribbean ocean and very close to the city of Barranquilla.  Leydi is a high school graduate, but could not continue her education.  For this reason, she decided to embark on her entrepreneurial idea of selling products by means of specialized guides by which she promotes them.  She started her business one year ago, and it has been working well.  She sells to neighbors, relatives and friends who refer more customers to her and she has been able to strengthen her business this way.

She is a person who is very demanding that her customers pay her on time, which is why she doesn’t have an abundance of them, but has only the best.  She works hard to be selective, especially when it comes to selling on credit.  Additionally to selling the merchandise, she has a telecommunications business where she offers phone services and sells snacks and fruits.

Leydi’s dream is to manage to finish a technical degree, and she’s saving to make this a reality.  Her business goal is to increase sales in order to manage a profit margin of no less than 35%, while her inventory turnover is every 7 days.

Currently, she’s applying to Kiva for her first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which she will purchase seasonal fruits and clothing that her catalog carries at a discount.  With these products, she will find satisfy her customer base’s demand for price value and permanently sustain her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and clothing that her catalog carries at a discount.

loans.name: Merys

texts.es: Merys de 54 años,  vive con su esposo en el municipio de Malambo y tienen 3 hijos en las edades de 19 a 30 años; allí  en este municipio tiene un negocio de confecciones,  que empezó en la ciudad de Barranquilla, cuando hizo un curso técnico en este oficio, mediante el cual aprendió. Posteriormente  durante 3 años,  trabajó confeccionando a sus familiares y amigas, sobre medidas  y desde hace 17 años,  cuando se mudó a este municipio,  inició ya organizada   su idea emprendedora, logrando contactar varios colegios. Desde hace 4 años forma parte de los programas de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la cual  ha recibido 3 financiamientos, con los cuales ha logrado tener el capital de trabajo suficiente para  responder a su clientela y mejorar sus ingresos,  porque con este dinero logró financiar los pedidos de sus clientes y con sus ingresos ha educado a sus hijos. Su meta mas adelante es tener una máquina plana,  para mejorar los tiempos productivos y la calidad de la prenda. Su mayor desafío, ocurrió cuando se enfermó hace 2 años y esto afectó la productividad de su negocio, pero como Merys no se rinde fácilmente, ha logrado salir adelante. Por eso hoy acude a su credikiva, cuarto financiamiento que hace a la Fundación, con el comprará materias primas e insumos por volumen,  para responder a pedidos de uniformes de colegios, con los cuales ha contratado. Su inversión será exitosa porque la hace sobre convenios escolares y su experiencia  y tenacidad es parte de su personalidad exitosa que potencializa el logro esperado.
texts.en:
Merys, 54, lives with her husband in the town of Malambo; they have three children whose ages range from 19 to 30 years.  She has a sewing business in this town that started in the city of Barranquilla when she took a technical course in this field through which she learned.  Later during three years she worked sewing on order for her family and friends and for the last 17 years when she moved to this town she started her enterprising idea in an organized fashion getting in contact with several schools.  

She’s been part of the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo programs for the last four years, an organization from which she’s received three loans that have provided enough working capital for her to meet customer demand.  She’s been able to use her income to provide schooling for her children.  Her goal for later on is to have a straight stitch sewing machine to improve production times and quality of items.  Her greatest challenge occurred two years ago when she became ill and this affected her business’ productivity but since Merys is not easily defeated she’s managed to get ahead.

This is why she’s today calling on a Kiva loan, her fourth financing from the Fundación that she’ll use to buy raw materials and supplies in volume to fill orders for school uniforms she’s been contracted to do.  Her investment will be successful because she works based on contractual agreements with schools and her experience and tenacity are parts of her successful personality which makes her expected accomplishment possible.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies in volume.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Mensajeras”  ubicado en el distrito Juliaca, provincia San Román  y departamento de Puno, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y tiene 04 hijos (1 independiente), la señora tiene estudios de educación secundaria (incompleto).

Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 04 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  le permitió  incrementar el capital de  su negocio de venta de polos.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de  S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar 2 rollos de tela para su mercadería de su negocio confección de polos, en el negocio cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo a la vez trabaja de albañil.
	
Su sueño para el futuro  es tener su casa, tener carro para transportar su mercadería 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la facilidad de pago en periodos cortos.
texts.en:
Eugenia’s a member of the “Las Mensajeras” communal bank located in Juliaca District, San Román Province and Puno Department.  She’s 49 years old, married and has four children (one independent).  She attended secondary school (incomplete).

She’s been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for four years.  Her initial loan was for 300 new soles that allowed her to increase capital in her business selling shirts.

She will request a new loan in the amount of 800 new soles to buy two bolts of fabric for her business making shirts.  Her husband helps her with the business and also works as a bricklayer.

Her dream for the future is to own a house and to have a car to transport her merchandise.  What she likes best about the communal bank is the ease of repaying in short periods.

loans.use: to buy two bolts of fabric.

loans.name: Wilda

texts.es: La socia Wilda; continua con su negocio de la pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio. En esta oportunidad Wilda requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otros productos de primera necesidad. La socia requiere el prestamo para invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad y vasos.
texts.en: Wilda continues with her small, home-based grocery store.  On this occasion Wilda needs the loan to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, noodles and other basic staple items for example.  She needs the loan to buy basic staple items and [drinking] glasses.

loans.use: to buy basic staple items and [drinking] glasses.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lidia; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agricultura, ella tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra zanahorias, maíz, papa y maíz, la socia también se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes, chanchos y gallinas, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de crianza de animales y negocio de agricultura. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pollos y cuyes y también para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This borrower belongs to the Reyna de Los Angeles de Urquillos (Queen of The Angels of Uquillos) Community Bank in the district and province of Cuzco.  Her name is Lidia. She his 40 years old, married, and has four children. In addition to her daily activities she works in agriculture. She has some land where she grows carrots, corn, and potatoes. She also works raising animals like guinea pigs, pigs, and chickens. This work helps her get ahead. Her dream is to expand her animal and agriculture businesses. She is asking for a loan to buy chickens and guinea pigs and also to buy seeds and fertilizers. She is happy about the loan and committed to repaying it on time.

loans.use: buy chickens, guinea pigs, seeds, and fertilizer

loans.name: Andal Group

texts.fr:
Mme Kadiata Binguiel est la responsable du groupe ANDAL. Elle est célibataire  sans  enfant et  elle a 02 personnes à sa charge.

Mme vend des bouteilles de gaz et des pagnes  depuis 03ans. Elle s’approvisionne à SODIGAZ pour le gaz et au grand marché pour les pagnes en ville. Ses clients sont ses amis et voisins.

Mme veut  s’acheter  20 pièces de pagne et 25 foyers à gaz.

Elle  épargne ses bénéfices  et aide à la scolarisation des 02 enfants dont elle a la charge. Mme ambitionne  accroitre son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. KADIATA BINGUEL is the head of the group ANDAL. She is single without children but she does have two dependents.

Mrs. Kadiata has been selling bottled gas and pagnes (colorful West-African cloth) for the past three years. She buys the gas from SODIGAZ and buys the pagnes at the big market in the city. Her customers are friends and neighbors. 

Mrs. Kadiata wants to buy 20 pagnes and 25 bottles of gas.

She saves her profits and provides for the education of the two children she cares for. Her goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy 20 pagnes and 25 bottles of gas.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Since she received her previous loan, Hoa's store now sells a variety of goods and brings in a stable income source to cover all her family expenses and children's school fees.

Hoa plans to use her next loan (17,000,000 VND from CEP) to buy a larger variety of goods such as rice, salted fish and spices to stock in her store. She is confident that in the future she can save more money to improve her family's living conditions and reinvest in her store.

loans.use: to buy a larger variety of goods for her store.

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
El  comité Sagrada Familia se inicio gracias a la Sra. Etelvina, quien organizo a sus amigas y vecinas para poder formar un grupo.  Actualmente ellas se hallan trabajando muy a gusto dentro del programa y su meta es poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa y de esa forma ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las miembros es la Sra. Maria de 62años de edad, ella tiene una despensa, con la cual surte a las personas de su barrio. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora y demuestra que con mucho trabajo se puede salir adelante. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de artículos de primera necesitad, y de esa forma poder tener variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Sagrada Familia” (Holy Family) committee started thanks to Etelvina who organized her friends and neighbors to form a group.  They are currently working very comfortably within the program and their goal is to reach the maximum level in the program in order to help their families.

One of the group members is María, 62, who has a grocery store that she stocks her people in her neighborhood with.  She is a very hardworking, enterprising person who proves that with much work one can get ahead.  Her goal is to be able to continue growing to continue helping her family this way.

She asks for the loan to buy basic staple items in order to have a variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Ciriaca Paulina

texts.es:
Ciriaca es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Mensajeras”  ubicado en el distrito Juliaca, provincia San Román  y departamento de Puno, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y  tiene 04 hijos, cuenta con educación  primaria.

Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 07 años,  nos cuenta que su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de  S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará para para la confección de pantalones  de lana, la mercadería lo vende en la plaza de san José y sus hijos le ayudan en el negocio, su esposo trabaja como chofer (transportista).
	
Su sueño para el futuro  es mejorar el negocio y tener una tienda por el centro. 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es el ahorro y su ganancia
texts.en:
Ciriaca is a member of Las Mensajeras (The Messengers) Community Bank, located in the district of Juliaca, province of San Román, department of Puno. She is 44 years old, married, and has four children. She has studied through primary school.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for seven years. She shares that her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, and the money helped her increase her business capital. She is asking for a new loan in the amount of 500 nuevos soles. She will use the money to make wool pants. She sells her merchandise in the plaza of San José and her children help her with the business. Her husband works in transportation as a driver.

Her dream for the future is to improve her business and have a store downtown. What she most likes about her community bank are the savings and her earnings.

loans.use: buy 10 kilos of different colored wool

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is divorced and has two children. As a single parent, she must feed and clothe her children and pay their school fees .

Ama sells maize and plantains at Frami near Elmina and Kakum National Park, which she has done for five years. Ama will use her loan of 800 GHS fron CRAN to buy more bags of maize and plantains to sell. With increased profits, Ama will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bags of maize and plantains to sell.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is a baker. She bakes meat pies for sale and has done this for two years now. 

Nana lives together with her husband and four children at Frami. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. 

Nana will use her loan to purchase flour, sugar, and meat for her bakery. With the new profit, Nana will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, and meat for her bakery.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
María Mercedes tiene 51 años de edad es soltera tiene un hijo vive en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC Emmanuel está conformada por 12 socios esta ventanilla queda a 40 minutos de la oficina ubicada en el recinto San Juan de Llullundongo perteneciente a Guaranda.

María se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de papas, maíz, además tiene animales, pollos y ganado.

Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, semillas insumos, fertilizantes, líquidos. con el crèdito podrá salvar los cultivos de papas y maíz. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda semanalmente. 

Con la ayuda del crédito anterior le ha ayudado mucho para sobresalir y tener nuevos ingresos para el bienestar de la familia.

El sueño es poder tener un vehículo que sea propio. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es el transporte y las plagas en los cultivos.

En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar, jugar con los sobrinos el carnaval.
texts.en:
María Mercedes, 51, is single and has a son; she lives in Guaranda Province in Bolívar.

The “Emmanuel” communal bank has 12 members.  This communal bank is 40 minutes from the office located in Recinto San Juan de Llullundongo belonging to Guaranda.

María is a farmer growing potatoes and corn; she also has animals, chickens and cattle.

She requests the loan to buy manure, seeds, supplies, fertilizer and liquids.  With the loan she will be able to save her potato and corn crops.  Her purchases and sales take place weekly in Guaranda.

The previous loan helped her quite a bit to get ahead and earn new income for her family’s wellbeing.

Her dream is to be able to have a vehicle of her own.  The challenges she faces are transportation and crop infestations.  In her free time she likes to rest, play with her nephews and carnival.

loans.use: to buy manur, seed, supplies, fertilizer and liquids.

loans.name: San Arnoldo Group

texts.es:
El comité San Arnoldo está en el tercer ciclo del Programa Comité de Mujeres de la Fundación Paraguaya, tiene 12 integrantes, donde todas ellas trabajan dentro de un ambiente de cooperación y ayuda mutua.
María es una mujer muy trabajadora, nos comenta que todos los días empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas del día, y que siempre termina ya muy noche. Ella tiene una despensa bien surtida, la cual le ayuda a mantener a su familia y a cubrir los gastos del día a día.
Ella se ha acercado a la fundación paraguaya para solicitar un préstamo, el cual desea invertir en la compra de insumos de primera necesidad, con lo cual quiere surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
The San Arnoldo Committee is in its 3rd loan cycle. The Comité de Mujeres de la Fundación Paraguaya (Women’s Committee of the Paraguayan Foundation) has 12 members who work in a mutually supportive and cooperative environment.

Maria is a hard-working individual who tells us that she works very early in the morning until very late at night. She has a well-stocked store that helps her support her family and cover the day-to-day costs.

She became a member of the Paraguayan Foundation to request a loan, which she will use to buy basic, everyday supplies to further stock up her store.

loans.use: buy supplies to further stock up her store.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 59 years old and lives in Palayan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines.  She is married with seven children. 

Pacita has a longanisa (sausage) and dried fish business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work.  She has a requested a loan of 7,000 to purchase more longanisa and dried fish.  Pacita has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase more food to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 43 years old and lives in Lobogon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines.  She is married with three children. 

Gemma works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living.  She has been doing this for 20 years.  She has requested a loan to be used as additional capital for her fish vending business.  Gemma has been a member of PMPC for eight years.  In the future, Gemma hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Amen Group

texts.en:
John is 42 years old. He is married and has four children. He owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, etc.  He also drives a taxi.  

John deems it a big opportunity to expand his business by including other items frequently demanded by customers. He wants to use this loan to purchase more stock to increase his inventory. He hopes to improve sales to enable him to save more for his children’s education, open a supermarket and also buy a new taxi. 

John belongs to the community group called Amen Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to the loan and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: to restock his grocery store

loans.name: Soda Yahda Group

texts.en:
Ayeshetu is thirty years old. She lives in a rented apartment with her husband, who is a welder, and her child who is currently in school. She trades in maize and soya beans in the local market of Takoradi.  Her major difficulty has to do with funds to support the business. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of maize and soya beans to grow her business and scale up sales. She hopes to increase her savings to support her child’s education. 

Ayeshetu belongs to the community group called Soda Yahda Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy maize and soya beans

loans.name: Creciendo Para El Futuro 1, 2 &3 Group

texts.en:
Adriana is the coordinator of her group, Creciendo Para el Futuro 1, 2 & 3 (Growing for the Future). Her group is located in Samana, a lush and rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. She is a single young mother with a child who is working hard to pay her university fees and become a  professional -- this is her most important challenge.  She also wants to establish her business by building a local shop on a plot of land next to her house.

Having repaid her previous loans and grown her business, Adriana is excited to be taking her 8th loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for around five years, cooking food and delivering it to people. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying a freezer and more goods like rice and beans. She will use the additional profits to save and supply some of the needs for her only child and for her home. In the near future, she wants to build her own house.

Adriana is dreaming to become professional and to have a successful business. This Esperanza associate began with us to access loans for her business. She thanks you all for your support!!

loans.use: to buy a freezer and food ingredients

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 56 years old and lives in Upper Lamac, Oroquieta City. She is married and has three children. 

Evelyn has an Avon and personal collection dealer business and earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase additional Avon and personal collection products to sell.

Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, she hopes to earn money for her future and for her children.

loans.use: buy Avon and personal products

loans.name: Diego

texts.en:
Diego is 44 years old and lives in Palayan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. He is married and has six children. 

Diego has a fish vending business and earns approximately PHP 8,000 each month doing this type of work. He has requested loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase more fish to sell.
 
Diego has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.  In the future, he hopes to have a fishing boat and earn money for his children and for their future.  Diego is a hardworking, honest and business-minded person.

loans.use: buy fish

loans.name: Romer

texts.en:
Romer is 37 years old and lives in Lawa-an, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. He is single. 

Romer has a hog fattening business and earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase feeds for hog fattening. 

Romer has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: buy pig feed

loans.name: Cindy

texts.es: Cindy de 21 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y tiene un hijo de 2 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada, actividad que realizaba desde cuando estudiaba en su bachillerato y vendía revistas, dulce y todo lo que sus compañeras de colegio le podían comprar. Gradualmente cuando pasó a otra edad y entendió como posibilidad de generar ingresos el comercio,  se dedicó a el agregando muchas mas mercancías a su oferta, mediante guías especializadas, así  inició su tarea de captar clientes. Hoy es un negocio con el cual ayuda al desempeño de su hogar, porque vendiendo productos de belleza y ropa, ha logrado estudiar y a responder  a sus gastos personales desde hace 6 años. En la actualidad su mayor desafío es lograr  ingresos suficientes, para atender a su clientela, especialmente cuando las revistas o catálogos traen descuentos especiales, Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará ropa y calzado que es una línea que en la actualidad no vende y que aumentará su clientela. Esta es justamente la razón de que su inversión terminará siendo muy exitosa.
texts.en:
Cindy is 21 years old. She lives with her partner and has a two-year-old son. She sells a variety of merchandise. and has been doing this work since the the time she was studying for her high school diploma, and was selling magazines, candy, and everything her fellow students were able to buy from her. 

Gradually, as she moved forward in life, she realized she could generate income through business, and worked to add many more products to the merchandise she sold, by using specialized guides. This is how she began her work of attracting customers. 

Today it is a business through which she helps supports the functioning of her household. Because by selling beauty products and clothing, she has managed to go to school and deal with her personal expenses for six years. 

Currently, her greatest challenge is to achieve enough income to serve her customers, especially when the magazines or catalogs offer special discounts. 

This is the reason why she is applying for her credikiva loan, her first from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy clothing and footwear: a line of products she currently doesn't sell, and that will increase her clientele. This is exactly why her investment will end up being very successful.

loans.use: To buy clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Irene; ella tiene 56 años de edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende arroz, azúcar, leche, galletas y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas al por mayor para implementar la tienda de abarrotes.

  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This associate is a member of the Communal Bank “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS”. It’s located in the district of Cusco, which is in the province of Cusco in the department of Cusco.

Irene is a 56-year-old married mother of 5 children. This member alternates her daily activities with her grocery store business. Maria sells rice, sugar, milk, cookies and oil. She works from 6am to 10pm. With this business, she is able to get ahead with her children. Her dream is to expand her grocery store business. Maria is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies at wholesale prices to stock her store.

She is happy for the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies at wholesale prices to stock her store.

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
María Francisca tiene 27 años de edad es divorciada tiene 3 hijos, vive con el hijo menor en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
La VRC Emmanuel está conformada por 12 socios esta ventanilla queda a 40 minutos de la oficina ubicada en el recinto San Juan de Llullundongo perteneciente a Guaranda.
María se dedica a ala agricultura a la siembra de papas, hortalizas y legumbres, cebolla, acelga, además cría animales como los pollos y cerdos.
Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, fertilizantes, urea, líquidos, urea, abonos orgánicos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá fumigar a tiempo los cultivos. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en  Guaranda cada 15 días y tiempo de cosecha.
El sueño es poder tener una casa que sea propia. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es el transporte y los intermediarios.
En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar y disfrutar de las festividades del carnaval.
texts.en:
Maria Francisca is a 27-year-old, divorced, mother of 3 children. She lives with her youngest child in Guaranda, a canton in the province of Bolivar.

The village bank, VRC Grupo Emmanuel, has 12 members and is located 40 minutes from the office located in the district of San Juan de Llullundongo, a precint of Guaranda.

Maria is an agricultural and livestock farmer and grows potatoes, vegetables and legumes, onions, chard and also breeds pigs and chickens.

She is requesting this loan to buy manure, fertilizer, urea and organic manure. With the help of this loan, she’ll be able to fumigate the crops on time. She buys and sells in Guaranda every 15 days and during the harvest.

She dreams of owning a house. The obstacles she faces include transportation and middle men.

On her time off, she enjoys relaxing and enjoying the festivities at the carnival.

loans.use: buy manure, fertilizer, urea and organic manure.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane, a 36-year-old married mother of two children, lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental where she is engaged in motor vehicle repair, earning approximately PHP 5,200.00 each month.

A member of PMPC for three years, Mary Jane is requesting a loan of PHP 8000 to purchase equipment for her motor vehicle repair business. In the future, she hopes to buy additional units of motorcycles.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her motor vehicle repair business.

loans.name: Tynarkul

texts.ru:
Тынаркул 54 года. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Тынаркул занимается животноводством и полеводством.  Начатое еще в период Советского Союза с 23,000 сом хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 11,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. На данный момент в хозяйстве Тынаркул две дойные коровы, две головы бычков и три лошади, а также 1,40 га земли с зерновыми культурами.
