It is for 10.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase construction supplies fin order to build her house (bricks, cement, sand, rocks, iron, etc). The previous loans were for 10.000mt, 10.000mt and 10.000mt, for housing expenses.
She pledges to make her repayments as scheduled. In the future she intends to finish building and furnishing her home, and for that purpose she plans to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies to build her home (bricks, cement, sand, rocks, iron, etc).

loans.name: Sia

texts.en:
Sia is approximately 35 years old. She was born in Bayana-Tonkoro, in Eastern Sierra Leone. Sia is a wife and a mother of two children. Her husband is a diamond miner and her children attend primary and secondary schools. Sia has been a businesswoman for 20 years. She sells plastic bowls, buckets, etc. 

Sia has requested a loan of 5,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) from Kiva's field partner, Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), in order to expand her business. She will use the loan to buy plastic bowls, buckets, etc. at wholesale to increase her inventory. In this way, her business will grow, attracting many customers.

loans.use: to buy plastic bowls, buckets, etc. at wholesale to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Kumba Nyama

texts.en:
Kumba is approximately thirty five years old. She was born in Koidu, where she currently lives with her husband and two children. Her husband is a private diamond miner and her children attend secondary school. Kumba has been a businesswoman for six years. She sells both soft and hard drinks. 

Kumba has requested a loan of 5,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) from Kiva's field partner, Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), in order to expand her business (both in terms of size and quality). She will use the loan to buy Star Beer (a local brand), Stout, etc. in larger quantities to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy Star Beer, Stout, etc. in larger quantities to add to her business.

loans.name: Adelaide

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província de mesmo nome, Sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 4 filhos todos frequentam a Escola. Fez a 5ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta mais um sobrinho, uma nora, e uma neta. 


É negociante há mais de 12 anos dedica-se a compra e revenda de produtos diversos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 6.000.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BCI).

Já teve empréstimo na ECCOM e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 8.000.00mt, com qual pretende produtos (feijão, farinha, óleo, arroz, refrescos, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. O empréstimo anterior foi de 5.500.00mt, aplicado no negócio.  

Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende ampliar o seu negócio, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the town of Maputo, province of the same name, southern Mozambique. She's single and has four children, all of which attend school. She completed 5th grade and stopped because her parents lacked financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and also supports a nephew, a daughter-in-law and a granddaughter.
She has been a businesswoman for over 12 years. She buys and sells various products and earns an income of about 6.000mt. She uses it to pay for home expenses and also saves part of it in her bank account.
She has had a loan with ECCOM and has managed to repay it without difficulties. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her second loan with Hluvuku. It is for 8.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase goods (beans, flour, oil, rice, refreshments, etc.) in order to increase the quantity of her merchandise. The previous loan was for 5.500mt and it was used for her business.
She pledges to make her repayments as scheduled. In the future she intends to expand her business, and for that purpose she plans to request other loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase goods for selling (beans, flour, oil, rice, refreshments, etc.).

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Chibuto, Província de Gaza, Sul de Moçambique, viúva e mãe de 6 filhos dos quais 2 frequentam a Escola e os outros já formaram suas famílias. Nunca teve oportunidade de Frequentar a Escola por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 


É negociante há mais de 15 anos dedica-se a compra e revenda de produtos alimentares e tem um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).

Nunca teve empréstimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para obra da sua casa (ferro, pedra, cimento, areia, blocos, e outros). O empréstimo anterior foi de 5.000.00mt, aplicado na habitação.  

Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in Chibuto, province of Gaza, southern Mozambique. She's a widow and has six children - two of them attend school, the others already have their own families. She never had the opportunity to go to school because her parents lacked financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and does not support anyone else.
She has been a businesswoman for over 15 years. She buys and sells foodstuffs and earns an income of about 3.000mt. She uses it to pay for home expenses and also saves part of it in her bank account.
She has never had loans in other banks. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her second loan with Hluvuku. It is for 10.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase construction supplies in order to build her house (iron, rocks, cement, sand, bricks, etc). The previous loan was for 5.000mt, for housing expenses.
She pledges to make her repayments as scheduled. In the future she intends to finish building her home, and for that purpose she plans to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies to build her home (iron, rocks, cement, sand, bricks, etc.).

loans.name: Shahrabonu

texts.ru: Шахрабону уже 7 лет занимается купле - продажей топлива. Ей 47 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Она берет кредит для закупа топлива.
texts.en: Shahrabonu has been buying and reselling fuel for seven years now. She is 47 years old, married and has three children. She is taking out the loan to buy fuel.

loans.use: to buy fuel.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: El socio Jaime continua con su agencia de viajes el socio invertira en la compra de algunos muebles para implementar su agencia de viajes. El socio invertira en la compra de armarios, televisor.
texts.en: The member, Jaime, is continuing with his travel agency.  He will use the money to buy some new furniture for the agency.  He will purchase cabinets and a television set.

loans.use: to buy some cabinets and a television set

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a 49-year-old married woman with five children.  She has run a sari-sari store (general store) business for three years.  Angelina sells items like coffee, sugar, vinegar, cooking oil and canned goods.  Angelina also sells gasoline to the members of her community.  She earns about 5,000 PHP per month with her business.

Angelina is in need of additional capital for her business.  She has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, instant noodles, snacks and gasoline.  This loan will help increase the profitability of Angelina's business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, instant noodles, snacks and gasoline.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a married woman with six children between the ages of 10 and 27.  Four of her children still attend school.  Carmelita's husband works as a carpenter.

Carmelita is in the business of raising pigs.  She says that she hopes to expand her backyard piggery and build a better shelter for the pigs that she raises.  She plans to use her loan to buy piglets, feed and vitamins.  Carmelita hopes for her business to grow.  She also hopes to be able to continue to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Wilson Gilberto

texts.es:
Wilson Gilberto tiene 42 años de edad es casado tiene 6 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en Guaranda provincia de bolívar.
La VRC Emmanuel está conformada por 12 socios esta ventanilla queda a 40 minutos de la oficina ubicada en el recinto San Juan de Llullundongo perteneciente a Guaranda.
Wilson se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de papas, maíz, leche, además tiene ganado, pollos y cerdos.
Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, fertilizantes, abono orgánico, urea. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá adquirir los fertilizantes para trabajar en los cultivos.
Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda cada 15 días.El sueño es poder tener un vehículo que sea propio. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son los intermediarios, transporte y el mal clima. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar boly y disfrutar de las fechas del carnaval.

"esta muy agradecido por el CREDITO ANTERIOR y por confiar en ellos porque han cumplido con los pagos establecidos del crèdito."
texts.en:
Wilson Gilberto is 42 years old, married and has 6 children. He lives with his wife and children in Guaranda,  province of Bolívar. The 
Emmanuel communal bank is made up of 12 members. This bank is 40 minutes from the office located in the community of San Juan de Llullundongo, which is in Guaranda.

Wilson is a farmer who grows potatoes and corn. He also produces milk and has cattle, chicken and pigs. He is asking for the loan to buy fertilizer and manure for his crops. He does his buying and selling in Guaranda every two weeks. His dream is to be able to have a vehicle of his own. The challenges he faces are the intermediaries, transportation and bad weather. In his free time he likes to play volleyball and enjoy the carnival season.  

"he is very grateful for the PREVIOUS LOAN and for the trust put in him because he has made his payments on time."

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, and urea.

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is a 45-year-old married man who has six children, four of whom are adults who live together in Taiz, Yemen. He decided to establish a spices (Bharat) shop which is a source of income to live on. He would sell the basics (beans, rice, flour, eggs, coffee, dairy products, meat, sausages, canned goods, bread, and soup packets, etc.). 

He started it through his own efforts, and he has managed to gradually stock the store. He devotes the whole day to this business in order to help his family. 

He requested a loan of 150,000 Yemeni Rial (YER) from AMB to stock his store with basic needs products like beans, rice, flour, sugar, lentils, eggs, coffee, raisins, etc. He will do this in order to continue selling and to give his customers better service. 

In the future, Adnan hopes to work with his own capital in order to stock his business, have a better quality of life, and expand his business to open another spices shop.

loans.use: to buy basic needs products like beans, rice, flour,sugar, lentils, eggs, coffee and raisins for his business.

loans.name: Eileen

texts.en:
Eileen is a 48-year-old married woman with five children aged 22, 20, 19, 17 and 11. Her husband works as a driver.

Eileen is a food vendor.  She sells grilled hotdogs, tempura and fried chicken to the members of her community.  She has been in this business for two years.  Eileen earns about 6,000 PHP per month with this business.  She plans to use her loan to buy hotdogs, tempura, chicken, oil, sugar and sticks. 

Eileen hopes that this loan will help her grow her business.

loans.use: to buy hotdogs, tempura, chicken, oil, sugar and sticks.

loans.name: Abdulhafiz

texts.en:
Abdulhafiz is a 38-year-old married who has five children. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. 

He studied up to a bachelor's degree. He has worked very hard for many years to get his family ahead and give them everything they deserve. 

He has a grocery store and it is his main source of income. 

He started his business three years ago. His business was initially started with limited capital and didn't run well enough to get much profit.

His business is located in a very strategic area. Many people prefer his store because he always has the basic staples at accessible prices, and he provides the best possible customer service. His dream is to see his store flourish. 

Due to the current bad situation in Yemen, he has less profit from his enterprise. 

So, he took a loan of 80,000 Yemeni Rial (YER) from AMB to stock his business with more products such as eggs, cheese, soft drinks, and mineral water so that his customers will always find what they need and keep coming back. 

In the future, Abdulhafiz would like to study for a master's degree in his specialization and hopes to be able to get his family ahead and give them better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to stock more products such as eggs, cheese, soft drinks and mineral water for his business.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is a pig grower from Tagbilaran, Bohol. She is 46 years old, married, and has three children. Estrella has been raising pigs for five years. She works hard to support her family and provide for their household needs.

Estrella needs additional capital for her business. She requested a loan to buy additional feed, vitamins, and piglets to raise. Estrella hopes for her income to improve. She said she hopes for her family to continue eating three times a day and be in good health always.

loans.use: to buy additional feed, vitamins and piglets to raise

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon lives in the Coastal town of Changamwe, Kenya. He is a married father of three children and operates a taxi business. The business has been running for twenty years. He purchased the "old car" as he calls it, from the savings he had kept to start the business. 

Gideon was introduced to Milango by his friends and is applying for a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to repair his car and to repaint it to attract more customers. 

Gideon's car does not meet the standard and the taste of most of the current customers. His aim is to upgrade the type of vehicle he uses and he is ready to save the additional income from this loan towards purchasing another car in the future. The challenges he faces while doing this business are high fuel costs and competition from the other operators.

loans.use: To repair his car and to repaint it to attract more customers.

loans.name: Jonatán Ely

texts.es:
Jonatan Ely, tiene 52 años de edad, casado, tiene 3 hijos de 14,16 y 18 años de edad, vive en una aldea de Peña Blanca, Cortes.
Jonatan, es muy trabajador, el tiene establecido un negocio de pulpería, donde vende productos alimenticios como arroz, frijoles, verduras, refrescos, pan, churros, pastillas etc. En la pulpería le ayuda mucho su esposa. También genera otros ingresos, distribuye condimentos y especias a otros  negocios y compra y repara aparatos electrónicos. La pulpería la ha mantenido desde hace 7 años haciendo inversiones de sus ganancias y ofreciendo productos con mejores precios y buena atención al cliente.
Esta solicitando este préstamo de 17,000.00 Lempiras para reparar el vehículo que ocupa en su negocio, con el cual reparte condimentos y especias a los demás negocios.
Su meta es tener siempre surtido el negocio para satisfacer las necesidades del cliente y crecer más
texts.en:
Jonatan Ely, age 52, is married and has three children, ages 14, 16, and 18.  He lives in the village of Peña Blanca, Cortes.

Jonatan is a very hard-worker.  He has established a grocery store business where he sells food products like rice, beans, vegetables, soft drinks, bread, churros, and bouillon cubes, etc.  His wife helps him a lot in the store.

He also generates other income by distributing condiments and spices to other businesses.  He also buys and repairs electronic apparatus.  He has had the grocery store for seven years.  He invests his earnings in his business, he offers products for the best prices, and he takes good care of his customers.

He is requesting a loan for 17,000 lempiras to repair the vehicle that he uses in his business.  He uses it to distribute condiments and spices to the other businesses.

His goal is to always have the business well stocked in order to satisfy his customers needs and to grow more.

loans.use: to repair the vehicle he uses for work in order to distribute his products.

loans.name: Carmen Isaura

texts.es:
Carmen Isaura tiene 37 años de edad es casada tiene 4 hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos, vive en GUARANDA provincia de Bolívar .
La VRC Emmanuel está conformada por 12 socios esta ventanilla queda a 40 minutos de la oficina ubicada en el recinto San Juan de Llullundongo perteneciente a Guaranda.
Carmen se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de papas, maíz, además cría cerdos y pollos.
Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, fertilizantes, abono, urea, líquidos mata plagas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá salvar los cultivos de las plasgas.
Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda semanalmente.
El sueño es poder tener una camioneta para transportar los productos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son los intermediarios y el transporte.
 En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar y ver televisión.

Carmen esta muy agradecida por el CREDITO ANTERIOR porque ha sido de mucha ayuda para trabajar y comprar los insumos para los cultivos y obtener màs ingresos Para el beneficio de la familia.
texts.en:
Carmen Isaura is 37 years old.  She is married with four children and they live in Guaranda, in the province of Bolívar.  The Emmanuel Communal Bank is comprised of twelve members and is located 40 minutes from the office in San Juan de Llullundongo precinct, Guaranda.

Carmen works in agriculture planting potatoes and corn.  She also raises pigs and chickens.  She is requesting the loan to purchase compost, fertilizer, urea, and liquid pesticides. With the help of this loan, she will be able to protect her crops frominsect infestations. She makes weekly purchases and sales in Guaranda.  Her dream is to own a truck to transport her products.  She faces challenges dealing with the middle-men and transporting her products.  During her free time, she rests and watches television.  

Carmen is very grateful for the previous loan because it helped her to carry on her work and buy supplies for the crops, and in this way, earn more income for the benefit of her family.

loans.use: to purchase compost, fertilizer, urea, and liquid pesticides.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Элмире 47 лет, замужем. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Элмира занимается животноводством.  Начатое в 2008 году с покупки крупного рогатого скота хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с продажи молока и молочной продукции. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Элмира обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота на откорм и перепродажу. Доходы Элмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, а ближе к лету – сделать ремонт в жилом доме.
texts.en: Elmira is 47 years old, married. As a source of income for the family Elmira does animal husbandry. She started the business in 2008 buying large horned cattle which now brings around 5,000 som (KGS) a month from the sale of milk and dairy products. Elmira has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 80,000 KGS to buy livestock for fattening and resale with the purpose to further grow her business. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further increase of the number of livestock and to do repairs at her home closer to the summer.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: La socia Yolanda; continua con su negocio de cafetín en el mismo colegio la socia ahora que comenzaran las labores en los colegios en general ella desea poder implementar el cafetin y comprar todo lo referente a golosinas, gaseosas, galletas, productos en general para implementar su negocio y vender, la socia desea comprar todo tipo de productos para la venta de sanwich, tes, mates, jugos entre otros.
texts.en: The member, Yolanda continues managing her small café at the same school and now is beginning to work in other schools.  She wishes to stock her café with candy, soda, cookies, and general products that she can sell.  She also wishes to purchase sandwiches, teas, bread, juice, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase soda, bread, candy, cookies, and other items.

loans.name: Iyabodè Elisabeth

texts.fr: Iyabodè Elisabeth est âgée de 43 ans et est mariée à un certain Arouna. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. La famille vit ensemble. Iyabodè Elisabeth assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges familiales. Iyabodè Elisabeth n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses différents besoins, Iyabodè Elisabeth vend depuis quinze ans des ustensiles de cuisine (glacières, casseroles, gobelets, etc.) des biscuits, des bombons et des vêtements à travers un système de distribution. Iyabodè Elisabeth s’approvisionne au Nigeria et parfois à Lomé. En vue de renforcer davantage son activité par l’augmentation du stock de ses produits, afin de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Iyabodè Elisabeth sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Iyabodè Elisabeth is 43 years old and married to a man called Arouna.  The couple has six children, all in school and all their dependents.  The whole family lives together. Iyabodè Elisabeth and her husband jointly take care of the household expenses.  
Iyabodè Elisabeth never attended school.  In order to meet her various needs, she has been selling kitchen utensils (ice-boxes, sauce-pans, cups etc.), as well as cookies, candy and clothes, through a distribution system, for the past fifteen years.  She buys her merchandise in Nigeria and sometimes in Lomé.  
Iyabodè Elisabeth is requesting financial support from ALIDé in order to increase her stock of merchandise, strengthen her activity, and in the end, better satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils (ice boxes, saucepans etc.), clothes and boxes of cookies and candy.

loans.name: Nonvignon Group

texts.fr: NONVIGNON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Blandine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 39 ans et est mariée à un certain Maximin. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés mais seulement trois restent à leur charge. Blandine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis dix sept ans, Blandine vend des sachets de pur water, des cartes de recharges téléphoniques et d’autres produits à son domicile. Blandine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. C’est la deuxième fois que  Blandine et les autres membres du groupe NONVIGNON sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
NONVIGNON is a group made up of three women who live in the same neighborhood.  

Blandine (raising her hand in the photo) is the group's representative.  She is 39 years old and married to a man named Maximin.  The couple has five children, some of whom attend school.  Only three of their children are still their dependents.  Blandine lives with her husband and children.  The couple jointly takes care of the household expenses.  

Blandine has been selling sachets of PUR (water purifier powder), rechargeable phone cards and other items, from her home, for the past seventeen years.  She stocks up at a market in Benin.  

This is the second time that Blandine and the other members of the NONVIGNON group are requesting financial support from ALIDé in order to boost their working capital and their activities, and to better meet their customers' demand.  Their first loan was well repaid.

loans.use: to buy sachets of PUR (water purifier powder), rechargeable phone cards etc...

loans.name: Ayidote Group

texts.fr: AYIDOTE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vendent dans la même zone. La représentante du groupe, Noudégodo Honorine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 43 ans et est mariée à un certain Eugène. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Noudégodo Honorine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Noudégodo Honorine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de huit ans, Noudégodo Honorine vend des divers et des pommes fruits dans une ville du Benin. Noudégodo Honorine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. C’est la deuxième fois que Noudégodo Honorine et les autres membres du groupe AYIDOTE  sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Le premier crédit reçu a été bien  remboursé.
texts.en:
Ayidote is a group of three people, who all sell in the same area. The group's representative, Noudégodo Honorine (hand raised in the photo), is 43 years old and is married to a man named Eugène. The couple has five children, all of whom go to school and are in their care. Noudégodo Honorine did not go to school. 

Noudégodo Honorine lives with her husband and children. She and her husband are both responsible for meeting the household's various expenses.  For nearly eight years,  Noudégodo Honorine has been selling miscellaneous items and apples in a town in Benin. She obtains her supplies from a market in Benin. This is the second time that Noudégodo Honorine and the other members of Ayidote have asked for fiancial support from ALIDé in order to increase their working capital and better meet customer demand. The first loan was fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy apples and miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Alejandro Rafael

texts.es: Alejandro de 30 años vive con su esposa y sus dos hijas en las edades de 5 y 8 años;  tienen una frutera, la cual inició cuando se le ocurrió vender mangos y ciruelas frente a un colegió, donde su mayor mercado eran los niños cuando salian del colegio al terminar s jornada educativa. Como en las vacaciones de los muchachos no tenia clientela, decidió irse a vender por la calle y fue así como le propuso la administradora de una empresa que se quedara a vender variedades de frutas en la puerta de la transportadora que ella dirigía, anotándole que debía mantener  un buen surtido, que respondiera a las necesidades del viajero. Y así fue como empezó  en este lugar y hoy lleva 6 años de estar ahí. Como cada le va mucho mejor, se siente satisfecho, pero su plan  de crecimiento es mayor que su capital de trabajo, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que haca a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará frutas en mayor volumen, para tener un diverso surtido en un punto en su casa donde atenderá su esposa, también mejorará el carro de frutas y comprar uniformes para mostrar su pulcritud en el manejo de los alimentos, acompañada de una excelente imagen comercial y esto es justamente lo que justifica el éxito de su inversión.
texts.en:
Alejandro, aged 30, lives with his wife and two daughters aged 5 and 8.  They have a fruit stand, which he started when he began selling mangoes and plums in front of a school.  His biggest market were the children who came out of the school at the end of the school day.

As he didn't have many customers during the kids' holidays, he decided to go sell on the street.  This was how he proposed to the administrator of a business that he sell a variety of fruit in the transportation center that she managed.  He noted to her that he would maintain a good stock which would meet the needs of the passengers.  It was in this way that he started at this location, and today he has been here for six years.

As things continue to go much better for him, he feels satisfied.  However, his plan for growth is greater than his working capital, which is the reason why he's come for a Kiva loan.  This his first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will purchase a greater volume of fruit so as to have a diverse stock at the fruit stand that his wife tends to at their home.  He will also improve his fruit cart, and purchase uniforms to show his hygienic food handling together with an excellent business image.  This is precisely what will justify the success of his investment.

loans.use: to purchase a greater volume of fruit, to improve his fruit cart, and to purchase uniforms.

loans.name: Angel Domingo

texts.es:
Angel Domingo tiene 47 años de edad es casado tiene 5 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en Guaranda Provincia de bolívar.
La VRC Emmanuel está conformada por 12 socios esta ventanilla queda a 40 minutos de la oficina ubicada en el recinto San Juan de Llullundongo perteneciente a Guaranda.
Angel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de papas, maíz, además cría pollos, cerdos.
Solicita el crédito para comprar animales y abonos, fertilizantes, urea, líquidos mata plagas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá incrementar la producción.
Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda semanalmente.
El sueño es poder tener un vehículo y una casa. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es el transporte y la competencia.
 En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar  y disfrutar de las fechas del carnaval.
 
ANGEL "ESTÀ MUY AGRADECIDO POR LA AYUDA BRINDADA EN EL CREDITO ANTERIOR Y LA CONFIANZA QUE HAN DEPOSITADO EN ESTA VENTANILLA PORQUE LES HA SERVIDO MUCHO PARA TRABAJAR EN LA AGRICULTURA".
texts.en:
Angel Domingo is 47 years old and married with 5 children. He lives with his wife and children in Guaranda province of Bolívar. 

The communal bank group 'Emmanuel' is made up of 12 members. It is 40 minutes away from the office, which is located in the precinct of San Juan de Llullundongo which is a part of Guaranda. 

Angel is a farmer who has crops of potatoes and corn, and he also raises chickens and pigs. He has requested this loan to buy animals, compost, fertilizers, urea and liquid pesticide. With the help of this loan he will be able to increase his production.  

He makes his purchases and sales in Guaranda on a weekly basis. His dream is to be able to have a car and a house. The challenges that he faces are transportation and competition. In his free time he likes to relax and enjoy the celebrations of Carnival.   

Angel is very happy for the help that the previous loan has provided him. He has trust in the communal bank because it has helped him greatly in his work in agriculture.

loans.use: to buy animals, compost, fertilizers, urea and liquid pesticide.

loans.name: Los Puntuales Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento LOS PUNTUALES  esta compuesto por  nueve integrantes, Siete mujeres y dos varones, la presidenta es la Sra. Mónica tiene 30 años y es soltera con 4 hijos, se dedica a la venta de comida su puesto de venta se encuentra en la zona 23 de diciembre, este es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Mónica utilizara este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción para un tinglado de su tienda ya que esta época de lluvias no le permite realizar un buen trabajo, y ya con el techo le protegerá de la lluvia e incluso del sol,  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es Hacer crecer el negocio. La Sra. Mónica enfrenta retos en su negocio que son  La competencia del mercado y utilizara los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: The communal bank 'Los Puntuales' is made up of 9 members, 7 women and 2 men. The president is Mónica; she is 30 years old and a single mother of four children. She makes a living selling food. Her food stall is located in zone 23 of Diciembre. This is the second loan she has taken out. She will use it to buy construction material to put a roof over her food stall. It is currently rainy season, and it is difficult to work without covering. With a roof she will be protected from rain as well as sun. Her reason for taking out this loan is to grow her business. The challenge that Mónica faces is competition in the market. She wants to use the benefits she receives from her business to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to put a roof over her food stall.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: El Sr. Roberto tiene 28 años, no es casado pero convive con su pareja con la cual tienen dos  hijos que son de las edades de 2 y 4 anos. Su actividad es  Agricultura, el siembra papa, yuca, tiene su parcela en la localidad de el Porvenir. Este préstamo es la cuarta secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr.  Roberto utilizara este préstamo para la compra de semillas para la siembra de papa, Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir con la siembra para generar mas utilidades, el Sr. Roberto enfrenta retos en su negocio que son Poder sembrar y cosechar en mayor cantidad y  va a utilizar los beneficios Para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. La sueña por su negocio es Crecer en patrimonio para el bien de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Roberto is 28 years old. He is not married but lives with his partner, with whom he has 2 children who are 2 and 4 years old. He makes a living through agriculture by planting potatoes and yucca. He has a piece of land in the town of Porvenir. 

This loan is the fourth loan cycle of the institution. Roberto will use this loan to buy seeds and plant potatoes. He is asking for the loan so he can continue planting and generate more profit. Roberto faces challenges in his business such as being able to plant and harvest in large quantities. He is going to use the profits to improve his family's quality of life. His dream for his business is to increase his wealth for his children's wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy seeds and plant potatoes

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a food vendor from Tagbilaran, Bohol. She is 44 years old, married with 6 children aged between 8 and 23 years old. 

Eva started her business a year ago. She sells chorizo, hot dogs, and lumpia (spring rolls) to her community. She also makes meatballs to sell. Eva works hard to help send her children to school. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy more chorizo, hot dogs. and lumpia to sell. This loan will help increase Eva's profitability.

loans.use: to buy more chorizo, hot dogs, and lumpia to sell

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros has been in the business of raising pigs for 5 years. She is a 46-year-old married woman with 5 children aged between 9 and 21. Milagros does her best to manage her time doing her hog-raising business and taking care of her children. She said she makes sure her family is able to eat three times a day.

Milagros has requested this loan to purchase piglets, vitamins and feeds. Any extra income she earns will go to her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, vitamins, and feeds

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. He is a single man and has been running a boutique for the last two years. Joseph learned of Milango through an advertisement. 
He is applying for a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of blouses, trousers, shoes and kids’ play items. 
Joseph plans to open another business with the extra income obtained from this loan and dreams of owning three more branches of the same business in future. His main challenges are the competition from other sellers and the high cost of transportation.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of blouses, trousers, shoes and kids’ play items.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe, a mother of three lives in Mombasa and operates a food stall which has been in operation for two years. The area has a number of casual workers who eat from such stalls over lunch hours. 
Kwekwe was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to purchase additional food stock e.g. beans, sugar and maize. The challenges facing the business are high cost of food stock and some clients not paying on time.
Her ambition is to own a medium sized restaurant in future. The additional income from this loan will help her pay for her children’s school fees and also go towards her savings for her other goal of owning a residential house.

loans.use: To purchase additional food stock e.g. beans, sugar and maize.

loans.name: Rakhima

texts.ru:
Рахиме 39 лет, замужем, воспитывает  шестерых детей.  В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Рахима занимается животноводством.  Начатое в 2004 году с суммы в 35,000 сом хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с продажи молока. На данный момент в хозяйстве Рахимы 6 дойных коров, 7 коз  и 3 лошади.
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рахима обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку жеребцов для перепродажи. Доходы Рахима планирует вложить в дальнейшее  увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Rahima is 39 years old, married and is raising six children. As a source of income for her family Rahima is doing animal husbandry. The business she started in 2004 with the sum of 35,000 som (KGS) now brings her around 5,000 som a month from the sale of milk. At this time Rahima's business has six milk cows, seven goats and three horses.

To further develop her business Rahima has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS to buy stallions for resale. Rahima plans to invest the income from the loan into further increase of the headcount of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Nerriza

texts.en:
44-year-old Nerriza is a married woman with 8 children aged between 4 and 27. Her husband works as a fisherman and carpenter.

Nerriza sells fish for a living. She sells her husband's catch and also buys more fish from other fishermen in her town. Nerriza sells fish in the morning and sells snacks in the afternoon. She makes pancakes, banana and camote (sweet potato) cue to her neighborhood. Nerriza works hard to help provide for her family's needs and to send her children to school. She requested this loan to buy an ice box, a weighing scale, a bucket and more fish to sell. Nerriza hopes that this loan will help improve her business.

loans.use: to buy an ice box, a weighing scale, a bucket and more fish to sell

loans.name: Belle Vision Group

texts.fr: Le groupe BELLE VISION est formé de six personnes qui  vivent dans le même quartier.  La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Fifamè Eliane, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Fifamè Eliane est âgée de 27 ans et a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Fifamè Eliane est célibataire sans enfant. Fifamè Eliane vit seule et assure seule ses différentes charges. Pour  subvenir à ses besoins, Fifamè Eliane mène comme activité la vente de produits cosmétiques (produits de beauté, mèches, etc.) dans une ville du Benin. Fifamè Eliane exerce cette activité depuis environs deux ans. Fifamè Eliane s’approvisionne dans une ville du Benin. Dans le souci de renforcer davantage son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Fifamè Eliane désire augmenter le stock de ses produits.  Pour ce faire, Fifamè Eliane sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe BELLE VISION, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The BELLE VISION group is made up of six members who live in the same neighborhood.

The representative of the group,  Fifamè Eliane, is the woman raising her hand in the photo.  It is the first time that this group is requesting financial support from ALIDé in order to increase its level of activity.

Fifamè Eliane is 27 years old and left school at the secondary level.  She is single and has no children.  She lives alone and takes care of her various expenses by herself.  In order to provide for herself, she has been selling cosmetic products (beauty products, hair extensions etc.) in a town in Benin for about two years.  She buys her merchandise in a town in Benin.

In order to boost her activity and to better meet her customers' demand, Fifamè Eliane would like to increase her stock of merchandise.  To this end, she and the other members of the BELLE VISION group are requesting a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and beauty products.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra es socia del Banco Comunal “las Mujeres de Santa Rosa de Arapa II”  ubicado en el distrito de Arapa, provincia  Azángaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 25 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene tres hijos en estudio.  La señora estudio hasta 2do de educación secundaria.
 
Trabaja desde hace dos años con el  Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue de  S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en la compra de ovejas.

Sandra solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles con la que comprará diez mallas para la pesca de truchas, estos lo vende en la localidad de Juliaca, en el negocio le ayuda sus hijos, su esposo trabaja en construcción civil.

Su sueño para el futuro  es tener una jaula de trucha para vender por mayor.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la reunión y las charlas respecto al negocio.
texts.en:
Sandra is a member of the “Las Mujeres de Santa Rosa de Arapa II” ("The Women of Santa Rosa de Arapa II") Communal Bank, located in the district of Arapa, Azángaro province, Puno department. She is 25 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has three school-aged children. She studied through the second level of secondary school.

Sandra has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years. Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles and she used it to invest in the purchase of sheep.
 
Sandra is requesting a new loan for the sum of 500 nuevos soles. She will use it to buy ten trout-fishing nets, which are sold in the locality of Juliaca. Her children help with her business and her husband works in civil construction.

Her dream for the future is to have a trout cage so that she can sell wholesale.

Sandra's favorite things about her communal bank are the meetings and the instructional talks about business.

loans.use: to buy ten trout-fishing nets

loans.name: Jesudogbe Group

texts.fr: JESUDOGBE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans la même maison. La représentante du groupe, Antoinette (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 46 ans et est mariée à un soudeur du nom de Boniface. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Antoinette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Antoinette vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de sept ans, Antoinette vend de la nourriture (pate de maïs accompagnée de sauce) dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Antoinette vend plastiques. Antoinette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. C’est la deuxième fois que Antoinette et les autres membres du groupe JESUDOGBE  sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Le premier crédit reçu a été bien  remboursé.
texts.en:
JESUDOGBE is a group made up of three members who live in the same house.  

Antoinette, the group's representative, is raising her hand in the photo.  She is 46 years old and married to a welder named Boniface.  The couple has three children, all in school and all their dependents.  Antoinette never attended school.  She lives with her husband and children and takes care of the various household expenses with her husband.

For almost seven years now, Antoinette has been selling food (maize paste served with sauce) in her own region.  Additionally, she also sells plastic items. She buys her supplies at a market in Benin.

It is the second time that Antoinette and the other members of the JESUDOGBE group are requesting financial support from ALIDé in order to strengthen their working capital and their activity, and to better meet their customers' demand.  Their first loan was well repaid.

loans.use: to buy condiments, maize and plastic products.

loans.name: Libis

texts.es: Libis de 27 años de edad,  tiene un negocio de panadería que inició en el año 2009 por iniciativa propia, ya que aprendió la técnica y le quedó gustando el ejercicio de ella, para generar ingresos y apoyar el bienestar de su hogar conformado por su esposo y su pequeño hijo menor de un año. Ella inició, con un pequeño capital prestado por particulares a alto costo, haciendo pudines por encargos a los cuales les adicionó los deliciosos postres, agregó galletas y por último incursionó en la producción de panes, vendiéndolos entre sus vecinos. En la medida en que su clientela se incrementó, debido a la variedad y calidad de sus productos, ha logrado sostenerse en el mercado y apoyar los gastos de su hogar. Su meta más adelante es tener una casa propia y un local de un buen tamaño, para comercializar en un punto de gran movimiento. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, también primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará en mayor volumen, materias primas como harina, vitina, huevos, arequipe, frutas cristalizadas, sal, azúcar, levadura y esencias, para aumentar su producción, debido a su creciente demanda. Su inversión tendrá éxito, porque le genera capacidad negociadora para obtener mejores precios en sus materiales de preparación y porque es muy reconocido este negocio y necesita expandirse a su potencial clientela.
texts.en: Libis is 27 years old, she owns a bakery that she started in 2009 by own initiative because she learned the technique and liked working on it, to generate income and help in the well-being of her home, formed by her husband and young son.  She started with small capital from a third party loan at high cost, she made pudding from orders and then started adding other delicious desserts, then added cookies and lastly she started producing bread, selling them amongst neighboors.  As her clientele grew because of the variety and quality of her products, she has been able to stay in the market and help with the home expenses.  Her goal is to own a house and a business location of good size so she can sell from a location with lots of traffic.  She is currently applying for her first credikiva, also the first one from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, with it she will buy at wholesale ingredients such as flour, eggs, caramel, crystallized fruit, salt, sugar, yeast and essences to increase production due to growth in demand.  Her investment will be successful, because it will enable her negotiating skills to get better prices for her ingredients and because this type of business is well known and she needs to expand her client potential.

loans.use: to buy wholesale raw materials such as flour, eggs, caramel, crystallized fruit, salt, sugar, yeast and essences.

loans.name: Rosalia Rosita

texts.es:
Rosalia es socia del Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol”  ubicado en el distrito Paucarcolla, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y tiene 7 hijos (3 independientes), la señora no cuenta con estudios.

Desde hace siete años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizo en su negocio venta de golosinas y bebidas gaseosas.

En la actualidad solicitara un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 400.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invertirá en la compra de 10 jaguas de gaseosas, galletas y golosinas, en el negocio le ayudan sus hijos y su esposo trabaja en otro lugar.
	
Su sueño para el futuro  es seguir operando en el negocio y mejorarlo.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las charlas y el compartir con las socias.
texts.en:
Rosalia is a member of Santiago Apóstol Communal Bank, located in the district of Paucarcolla in the province and department of Puno.  She is 50 years old and married, and has seven children (three of them independent).  She does not have an education.

She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for seven years.  Her first loan was for the sum of 300 nuevos soles (PEN), money she used in her business selling sweets and sodas.

Currently she is requesting 	a new loan for the sum of 400 PEN, a loan she will invest in buying ten crates of soda, cookies, and sweets.  Her children help her in the business and her husband works in another place.

Her dream for the future is to continue working on the business and to improve it.  What she likes most about her communal bank are the lectures and sharing with the members.

loans.use: to buy ten crates of soda, crackers, and sweets.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Província de Nampula, Norte de Moçambique, casada e mae de 2 filhos todos frequentam a Escola. Fez a 7ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta as suas irmãs que vivem com ela.

Saiu de Nampula para Maputo com seus familiares quando o pai foi transferido pela sua empresa. É cabeleireira há mais de 1 ano e dona do negocio, tem um rendimento de cerca de 6.000.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).
Já teve empréstimo no TCHUMA e concluiu o pagamento sem dificuldades. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos de cabelo para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa e mobilar, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Rufina was born in the province of Nampula in northern Mozambique.  She is married and is the mother of 2 children who are in school. She studied through 7th grade but stopped because of her parents' lack of financial resources.  She lives in her own home with her family and also supports her sisters, who live with her.

She left Nampula for Maputo with her family when her father was transferred by his company.  She has been a hair dresser for more than a year and owns her own business.  She makes around 6,000 meticals a month, which she puts towards her home's expenses.  She also saves some in her bank account at the BIM bank.

She has had a loan through the TCHUMA bank and made her payments without any problems.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of the institution.  This is her first loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 20,000 meticals, which she will use to buy hair products to increase the quantity of her merchandise.

She promises to make her payments on time.  In the future, she hopes to finish building her home and furnish it, for which she is planning on requesting more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: To buy products to expand the product line of her beauty salon

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah lives in the coastal town of Mombasa, Kenya. 

She owns a clothes shop, which has been running for the last three years. She started the business from a loan. She was introduced to Milango by her friends and is asking for a loan of 49,000 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stocks of clothes.

Her main challenge in the business is some customers not paying on time. Despite all this, Dinah is determined to grow the business and be able to build rental houses in future. The additional income from this loan will help her restock the shop.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of clothes.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 43 years old and married with three children aged 24, 22 and 20. Her husband works as a fisherman and also makes fishing nets to sell.

Rita sells fish for a living. She sells her husband's catch and buys more fish from other fishermen. Rita wakes up very early in the morning to sell fish. She earns 3000 PHP per month with her business. 

She requested a loan to purchase a bucket, weighing scales and more fish to sell. Rita plans to raise pigs in order to augment her income.

loans.use: to purchase a bucket, weighing scales and more fish to sell

loans.name: Felita

texts.en:
39-year-old Felita is a married woman with four children aged between five and eleven. 

She is a farmer working in San Miguel, Bohol. Felita has been growing and selling rice for three years. She works hard to help provide for her family's basic needs and send her children to school.

Felita has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farming needs. She plans to use her extra income to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farming needs

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a salon business owner. The business has been running for the last six years. She lives in Mariakani, Kenya. Judith is the mother of one child.

She was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to purchase hair products and other salon stock. 

Her future ambition is to own another salon, despite the challenge of inflation.

loans.use: To purchase hair products and other salon stock.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a 55-year-old, married woman with four children. She and her husband are both farmers.

Lourdes started farming 20 years ago. She said farming is her family's main source of income. She works with her husband in cultivating their land and growing rice crops. 

Lourdes requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farming needs. Lourdes hopes that with this loan, they will achieve an abundant harvest.

Lourdes also hopes for her family's lives to improve.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farming needs

loans.name: Kisavu

texts.en:
Kisavu is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. He owns a leatherwork shop. From this shop, Kisavu makes footballs and seat covers/upholstery in the town centre. The business has been in operation for the last 28 years. 

He is a married father of eight children; six of whom are in school. He is also a rents collection commission agent.

Kisavu is applying for a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to purchase more leather materials. The challenge in the business is completion from other operators. 

His future ambition is to open a school for leatherwork. The additional income from this loan will help Kisavu to pay for his children’s school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more leather materials.

loans.name: Hesbon

texts.en:
Hesbon lives in Kongowea, Kenya. He owns a music studio, which has been running for one year. From this shop, Hesbon sells music compact discs and audio tapes and employs one other person. 

Hesbon dreams of owning a larger music studio offering video coverage and editing services. The setbacks in this business are competition from other established players and overall inflation, which has reduced the purchasing power of most customers.

He is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to purchase a microphone condenser and improve the operations at the studio.

loans.use: To purchase a microphone condenser.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fresh fruit (apples, pineapples, maracujas, prunes, bananas, etc.)

loans.name: Hezron

texts.en:
Hezron lives in Kongowea, Kenya. He is married and has five children; four of whom are in school. 

He owns a spice shop. In this shop, Hezron sells spices; the coastal people love spices and use them often for the preparation of most meals. He sells them from a busy market, which has many clients.

He is applying for a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stocks of spices. The challenge in the business is a lack of adequate capital. This he seeks to overcome by applying for and repaying loans from Milango. This loan will improve the livelihood of his family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of spices.

loans.name: Nonilito

texts.en:
Nonilito is 47 years old and married with three children aged five, seven and ten. 

Nonilito has a "habal-habal" (motorcycle taxi) business in his town of Bien Unido, Bohol. He has had his business for four years and earns about 6,000 PHP per month. Nonilito works hard to sustain his family. 

He requested a loan to purchase spare parts and gasoline. Nonilito plans to expand his business soon. He said he hopes to be a successful businessman in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline

loans.name: Simagnikinto Group

texts.fr: SIMAGNIKINTO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier et exercent des activités génératrices de revenus. La représentante du groupe, Virginie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 29 ans et est mariée à un forgeron du nom de Basile. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Virginie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de dix ans, Virginie vend de produits vivriers à son domicile au Benin. Virginie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. C’est la quatrième fois que Virginie et les autres membres du groupe SIMAGNIKINTO sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Simagnikinto group is composed of 3 people who all live in the same district and perform revenue-generating activities.

The group's representative, Virginie (who has her hand raised in the picture), is 29 years old and married to a blacksmith called Basile. The couple have 3 dependent children who all attend school. Virginie lives with her children and husband and together they share the household responsibilities. Virginie has been selling food produce for almost 10 years from her home in Benin. She gets her supplies in one of the country's markets.

This is the 4th time that Virginie and the other members of the Simagnikinto group request ALIDé's financial support, so that they can strengthen their working capital and their businesses, and better respond to customer demand. Their previous loans have been correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy produce.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy used shoes.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Adama. She is married to a pharmacist and has two children aged 8 and 4 years old. She has no additional dependents.  

In 1982, Adama established her used bags and purse business. She began her business because she has never been to school. Since she was a small girl, her parents taught her business. Up to this point, her entire life has been business. 

Working six days a week and nine hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,500,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Adama requires a loan in order to buy two bails used bags at SLL 1, 800,000 each. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 750,000. 

In the future, Adama plans to expand her business and also wants to give a quality education to her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy two bails of used bags at SLL1,800,000 each.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Dora.  She is married and has 3 children aged 18, 16 and 12yrs. She has 2 additional dependents. In 1994, Dora established her Palm Oil and Garri* business. She began her business because she is not educated and wanted to get a source of income to help her husband provide livelihood for their family. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Dora requires a new loan in order to buy more palm oil and bags of garri to make more profit. In the future, Dora plans to expand her business, build a house and give her children a quality education. She is thanking you for your support.

*popular West African food made from cassava tubers

loans.use: To buy more palm oil and bags of garri

loans.name: Ekie M.

texts.en:
Ekie, age 36, has operated a restaurant for the past 2 years. She makes a good profit and has many customers, since she runs the only business selling delicious traditional food in her community. She is unmarried and lives in the Paynesville area. Her two children, ages 11 and 15, live in the U.S. where they attend school. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more meat, rice, oil, pepper, coal, and onions for her business. She hopes to become an international businesswoman and to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more meat, rice, oil, pepper, coal, and onions for her restaurant business

loans.name: Gloria Piedad

texts.es:
La Señora. Gloria es socia del banco comunal Siempre Amigas, vive por la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca,  parroquia que es reconocida por la belleza de su naturaleza , su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura, comercio y muchos labora en la ciudad de Cuenca en varias actividades, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.

La Señora Gloria tiene 37 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal le ha concebido 2 hijos, uno de 4 años y un bebé de 9 meses de edad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora. Gloria es de profesión Bioquímica Farmacéutica, ha trabajado hace 12 años ejerciendo esta profesión en un laboratorio, pero tuvo la oportunidad de comprar el laboratorio en donde trabajaba y ahora es de su propiedad, trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 8 a 6 de la tarde.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de productos para su laboratorio como: jeringas, tubos de ensayo, algodón, reactivos químicos, etc.
 
Su meta es crecer en su laboratorio clínico.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the Siempre Amigas communal bank. She lives in the el Valle parish in Cuenca. This parish is known for its natural beauty. Its people raise animals, farm and are merchants. Many work in the city of Cuenca in various activities and maintain the culture and traditions of their parents. 

Gloria is 37 years old. She is married and from her marriage has 2 children, one who is 4 and a 9 month old baby. She doesn't own her own home and rents.

Gloria is a pharmaceutical chemist. She has worked for 12 years in this profession in a laboratory, but she had the opportunity to buy the laboratory where she worked and now it belongs to her. She works Mondays through Saturdays fro 8 to 6 in the afternoon.
 
She is on her second loan in the communal bank and she is going to invest it in buying products for her laboratory such as: syringes, test tubes, cotton, chemical reactives, etc. 
 
Her goal is to grow her clinical laboratory.

loans.use: to buy syringes, test tubes, cotton, chemical reactives, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 28 bags (100kg) of rice at SLL 173,000. She will use the balance to transport the rice to her shop.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est constitué de 7 femmes mariées et 2 veuves ayant en moyenne 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivant  dans des familles traditionnelles à DOUGOUNINA, un des quartiers de la ville de Bougouni (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de bois de chauffe avec  MAMOU, de la  vente de tasses, de l'atieké, de la pomme de terre, des céréales, de la restauration et des chaussures.
MAMOU, la seule  assise sur la photo,  compte acheter avec son  prêt,  20 chargements de charrette en bois de chauffe. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des paysans producteurs agrées venant des villages voisins. Elle effectue sa vente à domicile à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, en détail, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000.FCFA par mois dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of 7 married woman and 2 widows, with an average age of 38 years and, on average, 4 children, who live in traditional family settings in Dougounina, one of the districts of the town of Bougouni (3rd administrative district of Mali). This is their 3rd collaboration with the microfinance institution of Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can satisfy their customer demand. This group of women, including Mamou, sells firewood, cups, atiéké (cassava-based semolina), potatoes, cereals and shoes, and some also work in the catering sector.

Mamou, the only person sitting down in the picture, plans to use her part of the loan to buy 20 cartloads of firewood. She gets her supplies from approved farmers who come from the neighbouring villages. She sells her merchandise from her home to a retail clientele composed of women and men, for cash or credit. She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 25 000 francs, part of which will be used to support her husband with the daily living expenses, and part of which will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Atong

texts.en:
Atong lives in Bor. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for three years. She is 39 years old, married, and has four children - two of them are still in school. 

Atong heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of SDG 500 in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Adut

texts.en:
Adut lives in Bor. She sells fish, and has been in business for three years. She is thirty years old, married, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Adut heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Jose Santiago

texts.es: El sr. José nacido el 25 de mayo en la localidad de Valle grande,  convive con la Sra. Aidé ella es ama de casa , tienen dos hijos mayores de edad ellos también se  dedican a la agricultura y la  ganadería, tienen una parcela de 35 hectáreas apta para la agricultura  y la ganadería, en la cual siembran yuca , papa , y maíz,  todo el maíz que ellos siembran es para la  alimentación de sus vacas ya que cuentan con 40 cabezas de ganado.  Y lo demás que  siembran es para la venta en el mercado de la localidad directamente del productor al consumidor,  el dinero del crédito lo utilizaran en la siembra de maíz  hace 6 secuencias  que vienen  trabajando con la institución, se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo que emprender le ha brindado.
texts.en: José, born on the 25th of May in the locality of Valle Grande, lives with Aidé who is a housewife. They have two older children who also make a living farming and raising livestock. They have a plot of land that is 35 hectares and suitable for farming and livestock on which they plant yucca, potato, and corn. All the corn that they plant is to feed their cows since they have 40 cattle. The rest that they plant is to sell in the locality's market directly from the producer to the consumer. They will use the money from the loan to plant corn and have been working with the institution for 6 series. He feels very thankful for the support they have given him.

loans.use: to plant corn.

loans.name: Rosa Targelia

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal Siempre Amigas, vive por la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca,  parroquia que es reconocida por la belleza de su naturaleza , su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura, comercio y  muchos labora en la ciudad de Cuenca en varias actividades, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.

La Señora. Rosa tiene 54 años, es casada en su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos, dos de sus hijos son casados uno de ellos vive independiente y otro vive en su casa compartiendo los gastos del hogar, su hija trabaja y vive independiente y sus tres últimos hijo estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña Rosa se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y también es comerciante informal, trabaja solo los días de feria vendiendo ropa de niños, actividad que la desempeña hace 22 años. En su casa también cría animales como cerdos, gallinas que son para el consumo de su hogar.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 12 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa de niños para surtir su mercadería. 

Su sueño es que todos sus hijos lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Siempre Amigas communal bank. She lives in the el Valle parish in Cuenca. This parish is known for its natural beauty. Its people raise animals, farm and are merchants. Many of them work in the city of Cuenca in various activities and maintain the culture and traditions of their parents.

Rosa is 54 years old. She is married and her marriage has produced 6 children. Two of her children are married and one of these live on his own and the other lives in her house sharing the household expenses. Her daughter works and lives independently and her three youngest children go to high school in town. Her husband is a mechanic and they own the house they live in.

Rosa does the household chores and she is also an informal merchant. She only works on market days selling children's clothes, an activity she has been doing for 22 years. At home she also raises animals such as pigs and chickens for household consumption.
 
She has been in the communal bank for 12 years and she will invest the new loan in buying children's clothes to stock up on merchandise. 

Her dream is for all of her children to have professional degrees.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi  sells slippers, shoes and sandars at Elmina. Esi is married to a driver and has 3 children. Esi has been doing this for 5 years now. She supports her husband in paying their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase slippers and sandars for sale. She hope to use the new profits from her business to build a shop for the sale of her footwear.

loans.use: to purchase slippers and sandars for sale.

loans.name: Hagar

texts.en:
Hagar is a fishmonger at Nyame Bekyere near Abura. She buys fresh fish and smokes it for sale. Hagar has been in this business for twenty years. 

She is married to a fisherman and has four children. Hagar uses her income to assist her husband with paying their utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new profit, Hagar wishes to expand her business

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to smoke for sale.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia is a petty trader. She trades in ladies’ wear, underwear, brassieres, and panties. She has done this for three years. She lives at Frami near Abura.  

Afia is a single parent and has four children.  As a single parent, she uses her income to feed and clothe her children and to pay their school fees.  

Afia will use her loan to purchase children’s wear, underwear, and ladies’ wear to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business she wishes to build a shop to enable her to sell the dresses.

loans.use: to purchase children's wear, underwear, and ladies' wear to sell.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is a petty trader who operates a grocery shop at Frami  near  Abura. She has done this for 20 years. The items in her grocery shop are milk, milo, sugar, soups, different kinds of soft  drinks, tinned tomatoes, tinned fish, biscuits, toffees, powdered milk,  etc.  She is married with five children. Her husband is a farmer. Paulina uses her income to help her husband to pay the utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of grocery items to sell. With the new profit, Paulina plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of grocery items to sell

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is a seamstress.  She is married and has one child. She has been sewing for five years now. She uses her income to support her husband to pay their accommodation bills. 

Patience makes dresses for sale. She needs the loan to purchase fabrics for the dresses she sews for sale. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics for the dresses she sews for sale.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 24 years old and is the mother of one child. She sells blouses, shirts and trousers to earn a living. She has been in the business for 2 years and describes her business environment as busy because she is visited regularly by her customers.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 16,000 Kenyan shillings to buy blouses, shirts and trousers to sell.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts and trousers to sell

loans.name: Elkanah

texts.en:
Elkanah is 34 years old, married and has one child.  He runs a retail shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for 2 years and has employed one person. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Elkanah has been able to improve his lifestyle and he hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 40,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy sugar, cooking oil, rice and maize flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil, rice and maize flour

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 29-year-old married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a motorcyclist and he has been in this line of work for over four years. He got his capital to start this business from brick making. He faces hardships of price fluctuation, high fuel costs and seasonal weather conditions. His dream is educating his children, building a permanent house, and buying land to grow crops. John needs this loan to buy a plot of land to build a house.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land so as to build a house.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking mother of four children living in Hioma, Uganda.

She owns a business of selling second-hand clothes. She has been doing this for a while, but she faces the challenge of high price fluctuations.

Her family goal is to educate her children and her business goal is to expand to new markets. 

Elizabeth intends to use the loan to buy used clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Kyanyinihuri Bananas Group

texts.en: Janet is a 60-year-old, widowed woman with nine children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She has operated a retail shop for the last six years. She started with capital worth 800,000 shillings and now it's worth 2 million shillings. Her challenges are customers not paying on time, price fluctuations and inflation. Her dreams are to educate her children, build a permanent home and expand her business into new markets. Janet needs this loan to buy sodas to sell. She is an executive member of the above mentioned as per group policy, every member guarantees the other in accessing the loan.

loans.use: to buy sodas to sell.

loans.name: Prscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla has been in farming for 10 years with her farm producing and selling milk, tea, and coffee for the local market. She currently employs one farmhand. She has four children, aged between 2 and 20 years.

Priscilla has made a request for a loan of 60,000 KES to buy a chuff cutter and build a modern dairy unit for her dairy farming business. She points out that animal diseases remain very rampant thereby necessitating modern dairy unit to ensure they are protected. She hopes to see improvement in her production capacity. 

Priscilla points at fluctuations in milk prices as the major challenge for her business.

loans.use: to buy a chuff cutter and build a modern dairy unit for her dairy farming business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 51 years old.  She does poultry farming and runs a printing shop to earn a living.  She has been in the business for 10 years and has employed two people. She also earns extra income from her rental houses. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Florence has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 40,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy chicks and chicken feed.

loans.use: buy chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is aged 51 and has been in farming for three years. She has been doing intensive maize farming along with other produce like milk, bananas, and poultry, which she sells to the local market. Her family fully relies on farming for their daily upkeep.

Christine has made a second loan request from Juhudi Kilimo amounting to 30,000 KES, which she will use to expand her poultry farming business. She adds that her focus is to also improve her milk production in the near future in order to open a milk collection center for the local chilling plants. She says that with good business in the future, the education of her children is assured.

She says high input costs and animal diseases are posing great challenges to the farming business.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is 45 years old and is married with three children.  She runs a cafeteria to earn a living.  She has been in the business for 9 years and has employed 3 people. She also relies on her husband for financial support. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Lydia has been able to improve her business  and hopes to expand her business in the future.  She has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy tea leaves, milk, rice and cooking oil.

loans.use: buy tea leaves, milk, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Scholastica

texts.en:
Scholastica is a widow and a mother of seven children, the last three of whom are still in school. She has been in farming for 30 years and produces mainly maize, passion fruits and tomatoes with the help of two farmhands. 

Scholastica has requested a loan of 100,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to help her start a poultry farming business (for 70,000 KES) and build a dairy unit (for 30,000 KES). She has a target of growing a farm of 5000 birds. She says the loan will help her buy birds and put up a housing unit for the birds. She adds the income will go into meeting her family needs.
