She laments the difficulties of animal diseases and a poor road network.

loans.use: To buy poultry and construct a dairy unit

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick has operated in the transport industry in Olkalou town for the last two years. He is 37 years old, married to Mercy, and they have four children. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend. This will be his second loan. He repaid all of his previous loan well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy a new motorcycle. 

In the future, he hopes to buy a pickup truck, which he will use to transport goods to and from the market.

loans.use: to buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is 25 years old. She is married to Julius and they have three school going children. She sells empty sacks to customer for carrying items and has been in the bussiness for the past 10 years.

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD. She was introduced to KADET by one of its clients. She will use the amount to purchase stock of empty sacks for sale and to increase her income. Her dream is to own a matatu in future.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to increase her income

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a resident of Kitale and has practiced farming for five solid years with the help of one farmhand. She produces milk, maize, and vegetables for the local market. Julia also runs a retail shop business to supplement her farming income. She is married and has four children between the ages of 16 and 2 years.

Julia has made a first loan request with Juhudi Kilimo for a second loan of 61,200KES. Her first loan was 30,000 KES. She says she will use the second loan  to buy poultry birds at 30,000 KES for a venture into poultry farming and boost her dairy by buying and insuring a dairy cow at 31,200 KES. She plans to repay the loan and acquire a higher amount to improve her farming and to be able to meet all her family’s needs, especially educating her children and improving their lives.

Julia says the seasonal changes in weather and poultry diseases remain their major challenges.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow and poultry birds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a dairy unit

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is married with seven children between 27 and nine years of age. Four of his children are still in school.

In addition to his business selling household goods in the local market, David is a farmer whose products include milk and tea. He has been farming for twenty years and now engages the services of a  farmhand. Persistent droughts and undeveloped markets limit his potential success in his farming.

David has requested a third loan of 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy two dairy cows. He is planning on buying more dairy cows in the future with subsequent loans from Juhudi Kilimo. 

David says these loans have enabled him to provide his family with basic needs. He is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for their financial services.

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 33 year old business lady.  She is a single mother of one child. She has been running a retail shop for the past three years with a monthly income of KES. 10,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD, after being introduced to the lending agency by a KADET staff member. Mary will use the loan to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, and maize meal. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her child. Her hope is to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, and maize meal.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes used her previous loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizers for use in her farm. She was able to plant and harvest and it was very profitable.

She now plans to use this loan amount to buy a cow, which will boost her milk production and support her dairy business as well.

In the future, Agnes hopes to improve her farming methods as well as invest more in dairy milk production, hence get more income and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy a cow, which will boost her milk production

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 30 years old a business lady, she is a single mother of one child. She has been running a beauty salon for the past three years with the monthly income of KES. 10,000 which she uses to support her family.


She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Mary will use the loan to buy beauty products and cosmetics. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to open a barber shop.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and cosmetics

loans.name: Tumai

texts.en:
Tumai is 33 years old retail shop owner in Voi. She is a married mother of three. She has been a shopkeeper for the past four years. Her business is doing great.

This marks her third time borrowing from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more sugar, salt, cooking oil and washing detergents. 


She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business further and to repay her loan. She hopes to have a well established business.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, salt, cooking oil and washing detergents.

loans.name: Tataine

texts.en:
Tataine is 44 years old, married to Jesica and they have three children aged 14, 10 and seven years old. 

He keeps livestock. He fattens them up and then sells them. He has been in this business for a period of about two years with an income of about 24,000 Kenyan shillings a month.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD and he wants to use it to buy more cows for fattening. He hopes to be a leading supplier of beef cattle in the area and also to sell to exporters.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock

loans.name: Rispa

texts.en:
Rispa is 54 years old fruits and vegetables seller in Majaoni, Mombasa. She is married and a mother of four children. She has been running this business for the last ten years and she is doing great. 

This is her second loan from KADET LTD, to finance her business. She plans to use the loan to purchase more cabbage, kales, onions, oranges, bananas and tomatoes for sale. 

She will use the proceeds to educate her children and expand her business further. She hopes to do well in the business and live a prosperous life.

loans.use: to purchase more cabbage, kale, onions, oranges, bananas, and tomatoes

loans.name: Zacharia

texts.en:
Zacharia is 37 years old. He has two children. He operates a quarry and has been in the business for the past six years.

This is his second term loan from KADET LTD. He paid his previous loan well and in good time. He will use the loan amount to purchase another quarry to boost his income.

He hopes to diversify his business to own a hardware shop in future.

loans.use: to purchase a quarry site.

loans.name: Seikan

texts.en:
Seikan is married to Lalaito and they are blessed with two children aged seven and 15 years. She sells cereals and has been doing this for four years. The business gives her a monthly income of KES 8,300.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She will use the funds to buy rice, beans, maize, grams (lentils) for sale. Seikan hopes to venture into farming in future.

loans.use: To buy  rice, beans, maize, grams (lentils) for sale

loans.name: Good Time Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 58-year-old Alice from Mutare. She is married with three children, one of whom is attending school. She also cares for two dependents. 

Alice runs a agriculture business of poultry and she is also into selling of clothes at a small scale.The business has been in operation for four years. She says the main challenges faced are low disposable income in the country. Alice has requested a loan of $400 to buy chemicals and day old chicks She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the welfare of her family. In the future Alice plans to own a a farm produce shop in the Central Business District.

loans.use: to buy chemicals and day old chicks.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has been in the cereals business in Nakuru town for the last two years.  He is 35 years old, married to Mary and they have 3 school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his 1st loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy more cereals and potatoes for selling in his business.

In future, John hopes to expand his business and supply cereals to other parts of Nakuru.

loans.use: To buy more cereals and potatoes for selling in his business.

loans.name: Rueben Shihundu

texts.en:
Reuben is 33 years old. He is married to Elizabeth and together they have three children. He operates a motorcycle and has been in the business for the past three years.

This is his third loan with KADET LTD. He repaid his previous loans well and in good time. He will use the loan amount to add to his savings and purchase a motorcycle.

He hopes to purchase a number of motorcycles and employ more people in his business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 27 years old. She is  from Nakuru and is married with a son who is in a baby class.

Beatrice has a business selling coconuts and has been doing it for the past three years. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to go to Mombasa to get more coconuts to add to her stock to sell. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by another client and is optimistic that her business will do well after the loan. She hopes to diversify into selling cashew nuts in the near future.

loans.use: To buy coconuts to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret from Nakuru is 35 years old. She is married to George, and they have two children who are in school.

Margaret was introduced to KADET LTD by a Credit Officer during marketing awareness that was done in the area. Her requested loan of 20,000 KES will be her first from KADET LTD . She plans to use the loan to buy more cereals to sell.

In future, Margaret’s ambition is to expand her business and supply cereals to other parts of Nakuru.

loans.use: to buy more cereals to sell.

loans.name: James Mwangi

texts.en:
James is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous one successfully. James will use this loan to buy a motorbike. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will invest back into his business. His hopes and dreams are to buy a taxi car in future.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Robertson

texts.en:
Robertson is applying for his fourth loan term with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. He will use this loan to pay school fees for his daughter.

With the anticipated profit from the grocery business, he will buy more fruits and vegetables for his business. His hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his daughter.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. He is married and has six children. He sells spare parts, mainly bicycle parts and accessories; a business he has run for the last fourteen years. 
He is applying for a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to add stock of retail items to his store. He aspires to open a hard ware/work shop in future. The rent received from this venture will help him pay school fees for his children besides the dream of building a retail house.

loans.use: To add stock of retail items e.g bicycle spare parts to his store.

loans.name: Wan Word Movement Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present the members of the “Wan Word Movement” group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 1,500,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) each in order to invest in their businesses.

Aminata is the leader of this group. She is forty years old and married with 4 children – 2  in primary school and 2 in secondary school. Aminata sells market-food - onions, salt, pepper, etc. With the help of this loan, she will invest in her business by buying onions, salt, pepper, etc. in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy onions, salt, pepper, etc. to add to her current stock

loans.name: Mathembe

texts.en:
Mathembe is a married business man and a father of four children; three of whom are in school. He lives in the town of Kongowea, Kenya. He runs a printing and stationery shop that has been in operation for ten years. The business employs three people. He often prints exam papers for schools and other institutions.
Mathembe is also a farmer. He joined Milango to access credit. 
Mathembe is applying for a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to purchase printing papers and examinations. The only challenge he faces is lack of adequate capital for operations due to high demand for printing work.
He believes that the additional income from this business will help improve the standards of living of his family. His aspiration is to have a well stocked/equipped shop able to meet the demands of his customers.

loans.use: To purchase printing papers and examinations.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food items like wheat flour, salt, tomato paste, etc

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a 32 year old married woman. She has 2 children with ages at 6 and 11 years. She describes herself to be hardworking. She operates a retail store where she sells home product such as sugar, wheat flour, cooking fat, salt, sodas etc. She has been involved in this business for 2 years and employs 2 staff members. In addition, Eunice runs an M-Pesa retail business.  Her business is located within a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more home product for selling. Eunice's dream and  business goal is to run three other retail store.

loans.use: to buy more home product.

loans.name: Karoli

texts.en:
Karoli is a 53-year-old married man. He has 9 children with ages ranging from 5 to 24 years. He describes himself as an honest and determined man.

He operates a carpentry shop where he sells furniture such as beds, chairs, tables, etc. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located in a competitive, viable area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.

He will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy wood. Busolo's business goal is to buy a vehicle to help in delivering furnitures to customers within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.en:
Rosa Maria, age 34, is a rice farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. She and her husband have four children, aged seven, 10, 12 and 14.

Rosa Maria earns about 5000 PHP per month through her farming efforts. She says that her income from farming varies and she works hard to keep her farm productive. 

She has requested a loan in order to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She is confident that through this loan, she will achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a married man. He has 2 children, both of whom are enrolled in school. Richard operates a computer service. His primary customers are the local area residents. He describes his greatest business challenge as the loss of power (electricity), and his highest monthly expense is food. He owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. Richard will use the KES 50,000 loan to purchase a new computer for his business. Richard aspires to expand his business in the future. He joined Yehu to access funds to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase a new computer for his business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Glady's is a 28-year-old married woman. Her husband's name is Klaus. Gladys operates a kindergarten school. She's worked in this business for 4 years. Her primary customers are children from the neighboring community. Glady's other source of income is a beauty salon business.  Her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. Gladys will use the Kes 30,000 loan to purchase furniture such as chairs and books. Glady's aspires to expand her school to accommodate more children in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase furniture like chairs and books.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married and has seven children between the ages of eighteen and 25, three of whom are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Victor, and he works as a businessman. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. School fees are her highest monthly expense.

For the past four years Grace has run a vegetable stall at the marketplace. Her main customers are passersby and her neighbors. Her husband also contributes his earnings to the household. Competition is her greatest business challenge. 

Grace will use a 25,000 KES loan from Yehu to buy sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, etc. to sell. She wants to be a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 27-year-old married woman. She has 6 children between the ages of 2 and 14. Four of them are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Fredrick and he works as a businessman. 

Lilian operates a scrap metal business and sells her goods at the market. She's worked in this business for 15 years. Her primary customers are passersby and neighbours. Lilian's other source of income is farming. Her highest monthly expense is school fees. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Lilian will use the loan of KES 30,000 to purchase scrap metal for resale. Lilian aspires to establish a metal workshop in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase scrap metal for resale.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man. He has three children between the ages of 1 and 3, and one of them is enrolled in school. His wife's name is Elina and she works as a businesswoman. 

David operates a retail shop and sells his goods from home. He has worked in this business for three years and was previously employed as a pool attendant. His primary customers are neighbors and passersby. David's other source of income is fish farming. He describes his greatest business challenge as market price fluctuations and his highest monthly expense is school fees. He owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. David will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase sacks of sugar and washing detergents and households consumption for resale. He aspires to establish a wholesale shop in the future. David joined Yehu to raise his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of sugar and washing detergents and households consumption for resale.

loans.name: Bora

texts.en: Bora is a married man. He has seven children and four are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. Bora operates a goat meat business and sells his goods at the market. He has worked in this business for five years and was previously doing a farming only. His primary customers are customers for slaughter. Bora's other source of income includes farming. He describes his greatest business challenge to be stock shortage in the market and his highest monthly expense is food. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Bora will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more cattle and goats to sell. Bora aspires to expand the business in the future. He joined Yehu because of the fast loan processing.

loans.use: to buy more cattle and goats to sell

loans.name: Baasan-Ochir

texts.en:
Baasan-Ochir, age 30, lives with his 24-year-old wife and two sons who are four and two years old. They live on his father’s property in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since 2003, he has been running a taxi service with a car he bought from a taxi company. Depending on the season, his earnings are good. It is the main source of income for this young family. 
 
Lately his car has become unpredictable and inappropriate to use for taxi service. It has high fuel consumption, and he thinks the cost of fuel may have started to be greater than his earnings from the business. Therefore, he has decided to change his vehicle to a new one that does not have such high fuel consumption. 

He has saved some money toward this purpose, and the loan he is taking out will be dedicated to coverIng the remaining cost of purchasing the new car for his taxi business.

loans.use: to cover the remaining cost of purchasing a new car for his taxi business

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en: Meriam is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Meriam has a shop that sells rice per kilogram. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy sacks of rice for resale. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice for resale.

loans.name: Emmalinda

texts.en: Emmalinda is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Emmalinda has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 18,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for resale.

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en: Enriquita is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 9 children. Enriquita has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for resale.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella is married with 3 children. She is 42 years old and lives in Canicapan, Clarin Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Bella owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 3 years and earns approximately PHP 7,000 each month. 

She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase farm chemicals. She has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for 3 years. In the future, Bella's plan is to save her returns in order to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en: Andresa is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 2 children. Andresa has pigpen, and she sells grown & matured pigs. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of 16,000 PHP to buy animal feeds for the pigs. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 70 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 5 children. To earn a living, Leonila has a business selling barbecue and biko (rice cake with caramel topping) snacks. She earns about PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business. She has been a member of PMPC for 12 years.  In the future, Leonila would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Elenita has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She is also selling roasted pig or lechon per kilogram. 

She requested a loan for 11,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Elenita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for resale.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en: Josefa is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Josefa has a shop that sells coconuts for making copra. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy coconuts to sell for making copra. Josefa has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts to sell for making copra.

loans.name: Rechel

texts.en:
Rechel is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.
 
Rechel has a shop that sells dried fish and homemade sausage or longganisa. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy dried fish and raw ingredients for making sausage.

Rechel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rechel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish and raw ingredients for making homemade sausage.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a married woman who has four children. Cristina is 29 years old and resides at Calabayan, Ozamis City, Philippines. 

Cristina plants and harvests bananas for sale to earn a living and she's been five years in this business. Each month, she earns 2,000 PHP doing this  business. 

She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

In 2009, Cristina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Cristina wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Leah has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Leah has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Leah hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale.

loans.name: Mahouvivi 1 Group

texts.fr: MAHOUVIVI 1 est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Andréa Elise (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à un certain Franklin. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Andréa Elise a très peu fréquenté l’école. Andréa Elise vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de huit ans, Andréa Elise vend de produits cosmétiques de façon ambulante. Andréa Elise s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. C’est la cinquième fois que Andréa Elise et les autres membres du groupe MAHOUVIVI 1 sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Mahouvivi 1 is a group of four people who live in the same district. The representative of the group, Andréa Elise (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 35 years old and married to a man called Franklin. The couple has two children, who are both at school and in their care. Andréa Elise went to school very little. She lives with her children and husband and they cover the various household expenses between them. For almost eight years, Andréa Elise has been selling cosmetics on a door-to-door basis. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. It is the fifth time that Andréa Elise and the other members of the Mahouvivi 1 group have requested financial aid from Alidé, with a view to strengthening their working capital and businesses and responding to customer demand. The previous loans that they have been granted have been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Misaley

texts.en:
Misaley is 34 years old and lives in Bañadero, Ozamiz City. She is single and blessed with one child. Misaley has a heavy equipment hydraulic part business and earns approximately PHP 7,000 each month doing this type of business. She has requested a new loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase hydraulic parts for her store. 

She has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Misaley hopes to improve her living situation and to be able to support her family, especially in their daily basic needs and for the education of her child.

loans.use: To purchase hydraulic parts.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman who has a child. Teresita is 54 years old, and resides at Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She operates a farm producing coconuts and bananas, and has been 5 years in this business. Each month, she earns about 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. In 2008, Teresita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Lucina

texts.en:
Lucina is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child.
 
Lucina makes and sells rice cakes and cheese cakes. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making rice cakes and cheese cakes.

Lucina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lucina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making rice cakes and cheese cakes.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has eight children.
 
Marita has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. 

She requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Marita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is single. She is 46 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamiz City. 

Delia sells Avon products like perfume, lotion, beauty products and other cosmetics to earn a living and has had this business for almost 15 years. Each month, she earns PHP 15,000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy more Avon products and other cosmetics to sell. 

Delia has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Delia hopes to save money to open a new business.

loans.use: to buy more avon products and other cosmetics.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 53-year-old widow who has two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Teresita has been in coconut production for 10 years and earns 1,000 PHP doing this business. 

She requested a loan of 2,200 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. In 2007, Teresita joined GDMPC. In the future, Teresita hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Pablia

texts.en:
Pablia is married and has five children. Pablia is 50 years old and lives in Dimaluna, Ozamiz City.

To earn a living, Pablia buys and sells coconut shells for charcoal production. She has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 5,000.

She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more coconut shells to use for the making of charcoal. Pablia has been a member of PMPC for three years.

In the future, Pablia hopes to be succesful in her chosen business.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut shells use for the making of charcoal.

loans.name: Jhonna

texts.en:
Jhonna is 25 years old and is married with two children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past two years, Jhonna has run a shop where she sells clothing such as blouses, shirts, and jeans. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. 

Jhonna is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy stocks of clothing to sell. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Ma. Aries

texts.en:
Ma. Aries is 34 years old and is married with five children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past ten years, Ma. Aries has run a shop where she sells snacks like banana, sweet potato cues, and other food items. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. 

Ma. Aries is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan to buy raw ingredients to make snacks to sell. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make snacks to sell

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel es socia del Banco Comunal “las Mujeres de Santa Rosa de Arapa II”  ubicado en el distrito de Arapa, provincia  Azángaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 69 años de edad, de estado civil casada, con ocho hijos independientes, la señora no estudio.
 
Desde hace dos años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de animales.

Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles dinero con la que comprará cuatro chanchos y afrecho para los animales, estos los engorda por tres meses y así recibe mejores ganancias.  En el negocio le ayuda su esposo quien también venden quinua (cereal). 

Su sueño para el futuro  es seguir con el negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la alegría y las charlas.
texts.en:
Ysabel is a member of the Las Mujeres de Santa Rosa de Arapa II communal bank, located in the district of Arapa, province of Azángaro and department of Puno.  She is 69 years old and married, with eight independent children.  She did not study.

She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years.  Her first loan was for the sum of 500 nuevos soles (PEN), money she invested in her business selling animals.

Now she is requesting a new loan for the sum of 500 PEN, with which she will buy four pigs and bran for the animals.  She fattens the animals for three months and so gets better profits.  

Her dream for the future is to continue with the business.

What she likes most about her communal bank is the happiness and the talks.

loans.use: to buy four pigs and bran for the animals.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has four children.
 
Joseph has a shop that sells bananas and coconuts for copra (oil made from coconut meat). He has had this business for five years. 

He requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy stocks of coconuts and bananas for resale.

Joseph has been a member of HSPFI for since 2011. In the future, Joseph hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of coconuts and bananas for resale.

loans.name: Ildefonso

texts.en:
Ildefonso is married and has two school-age children. Ildefonso is 45 years old and lives in Malaubang, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. Ildefonso is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. He has been doing this for six years. 

He has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase piglets and feed. He has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Ildefonso hopes to start another business.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Loreto

texts.en:
Loreto  is 63 years old and married with eight children. He lives in Catadman, Ozamiz City. For the past 15 years, he has owned and operated a transportation business and he provides transportation to his local community. Loreto is a new PMPC member.

Loreto is requesting a 40,000 PHP loan to purchase equipment for a motorcycle repair business. In the future, he hopes to save money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for a motorcycle repair business

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita is 47 years old and is married with one child. She lives in the Philippines. For the past ten years, Sherlita has run a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.

Sherlita is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Jenesa

texts.en:
Jenesa is 30 years old and is married with three children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past five years, she has been growing and selling vegetables such as eggplant and string beans by the kilogram. Jenesa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.

Jenesa is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer for her vegetable garden. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en: Carmen, a 38-year-old married mother of four children, lives in Panay Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Carmen used her last loan to purchase more swine for her piggery, and her business has grown and become more successful as a result. She is now requesting a new loan  to purchase more vegetables for her vegetable-vending business which she hopes to expand as well.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 20 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Joy has a vegetable garden and he sells a variety of vegetables such as malunggay (herb) and beans. He has had this business for two years. He has requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy fertilizers for his vegetable garden.

Joy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Joy hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his vegetable garden.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 50 years old and lives in Bacolod, Ozamiz City. She is married and has five adult-aged children. 

Celia owns a motorcycle and uses it for her business. She earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase equipment for motorcycle repairs.

Celia has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Celia hopes that she will be a success and that she can purchase a lot of motorcycles within five years.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for motorcycle repairs.

loans.name: Ernita

texts.en:
Ernita is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child.
 
Ernita has a shop that sells a variety of dried fish per kilogram. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy dried fish to sell.

Ernita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Ernita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel is 33 years old and is married with an infant and a school-aged child. She  lives in Gala, Ozamiz City. For the past two years, Richel has run a general store. She has been a member of Paglaum for two years.

Richel is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to purchase grocery items. She hopes that her business will successfully grow in the future.

loans.use: to purchse grocery items

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel is 44 years old and lives in Guba, Clarin. She is married with three school-aged children. 

To earn a living, Ethel has a business selling foods such as banana cue (deep-fried bananas coated in caramelized brown sugar). She earns about PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. 

Ethel has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase bananas for her banana-cue business.

Ethel has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Ethel would like to establish a permanent food stall store in Ozamiz for her business.

loans.use: to purchase bananas for her food-sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed to make snacks and homemade sausage.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline, a 62-year-old married mother of one, is from Panta-on Ozamiz City where she makes her living planting and harvesting corn for sale. Engaged in her business for 15 years, Evangeline earns 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Evangeline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure for her farm.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 37 years old and married with a child. She lives in the Philippines. For the past two years, she has operated a transportation business and she provides transportation services to local community members. Maricel earns 5,000 PHP each month. She joined GDMPC in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.

Maricel is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to repair one of her transport vehicles. In the future, she hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a business vehicle

loans.name: Ma. Lani

texts.en:
Margaret Lani, age 48, operates a tailoring shop where she makes and sells school and office uniforms. She and her husband have three children. 

Margaret Lani has run this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan in the amount of 10,000 in order to buy materials needed for the tailoring shop. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  

In the future, she intends to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her tailoring shop

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 50 years old and is widowed with four children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past 15 years, Marcelina has sold vegetables such as string beans, and snacks such as rice and pan cakes. She as been a member of HSPFI since 2011.

Marcelina is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan to buy raw ingredients to make snacks and vegetables to sell. She hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 42 years old and married with four school-aged children. She lives in Malaubang, Ozamiz City. For the past two years, Alma has sold pork barbecue to earn a living. She has been a member of PMPC for three years.

Alma is requesting a loan to purchase the ingredients needed for her business. In the future, she hopes to have her own store and a permanent place for her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her barbecue business

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites, age 35, earns an income from planting and harvesting cassava, which she then offers for sale. She earns 3,000 PhP per month from her farming business and she has been engaged in this work for three years. She and her husband have four children and live in Kinuman, Ozamis City.

Marites has requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Marites joined GDMPC in 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. 

In the future, Marites wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and seedlings

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 34 years old and is married with six children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past five years, she has run a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Jovelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.

Jovelyn is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP loan to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Nahouri Group

texts.fr:
Mme WOUWOLO  est la responsable du groupe NAHOURI. Elle est mariée et mère  de 06 enfants. Le plus âgée a 37ans et le moins âgée a 17ans. 01 va à l’école  et  elle a 08 personnes à sa charge.

Mme vend des  objets plastiques depuis  05ans. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de ouaga. Ses clients sont les amis et voisins.

Mme veut  s’acheter  04sceaux ; 01 douzaine de plat et 12 gobelets etc. tous en plastique.

Elle épargne ses bénéfices. Mme ambitionne  ouvrir une grande boutique pour son activité.
texts.en:
Mme Wouwolo is the Nahouri group leader. She is a married mother of 6 children, the eldest of whom is 37, and the youngest 17 years old. One of her children goes to school, and Mme Wouwolo has eight other children in her care.  

She has sold plastic implements for five years. She sources her goods from the large Ouaga market, and her customer base consists of her friends and neighbours. She would like to purchase four buckets, and a dozen plates and cups. 
Mme Wouwolo puts aside her profits as savings, and hopes that one day she can open her own store.

loans.use: to purchase 4 buckets, a dozen plastic plates and cups

loans.name: Kpedetin Group

texts.fr: KPEDETIN est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Relique Hernice (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 30 ans et est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Elie. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Relique Hernice a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Relique Hernice vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de quinze ans, Relique Hernice vend des produits cosmétiques dans une ville du Benin. Relique Hernice s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. C’est la deuxième fois que Relique Hernice et les autres membres du groupe KPEDETIN sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Le premier crédit reçu a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: KPEDETIN is a group of three women, whose members live in the same city quarter. Relique Hernice (whose hand is raised in the photo) is the group leader; she is 30 years old and married to a mechanic called Elie. The couple has two children, both of whom are still in their care and attend school. Relique left school at secondary level, and now lives with her children and husband, with whom she shares the household chores. For nearly 15 years, Relique Henrice has sold cosmetics in a town in Benin, after sourcing them from a large town nearby. This is the second time that she and the other KPEDETIN group members have sought a loan from ALIDé in order to boost their working capital and to better respond to their customers' demands. Their first loan was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase hair pieces and cosmetics

loans.name: Che

texts.en:
This borrower is married with seven children and they all live in Nitop a quarter in Bamenda, Mezam, Division of the North West, Region of Cameroon. She has faced challenges in life such as the death of her mother, father and some other family members; the ill health of her child and her husband made her fall short of capital.

With the new loan requested she promises to buy seedlings and pay for clearing of farmland since she wishes to engage in farming and also buy and sell corn and groundnuts  around the food market which is not far from her house since she has been doing the business for a long time. She thinks her business will succeed because of longevity in the business and she has regular customers and says from this business the community will benefit from regular supply of food at low prices.

She says the profit from the loan will be used to educate her children, cater for the family's food and also pay for medications for the family and says she prefers GHAPE loans because of education before loan disbursement and low interest rates with convenient payment intervals.

loans.use: to purchase groundnuts, maize, and seedlings and pay for farming labour

loans.name: Sect 15 Tegwende Group

texts.fr:
Mme TOUNWENDYAM EMILIENNE  est la responsable du groupe SECT 15 TEGWENDE. Elle est mariée et mère  de 03 enfants. Le plus âgée a 09ans et le moins âgée a 03ans. Les 03  vont à l’école (le dernier fait la maternelle) et  elle a 03 personnes à sa charge

Mme vend des mèches  depuis 10 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de ouaga. Ses clients sont les gens  viennent de partout (particulièrement les femmes).

Mme veut  s’acheter  70sachets de mèches .

Elle utilise ses bénéfices  pour renforcer son activité. Mme ambitionne  voyager pour acheter ses marchandises en gros et ouvrir une grande boutique pour son activité.
texts.en:
Tounwendyam Emilienne is the leader of the SECT 15 TEGWENDE group. She is married and mother of three children. The eldest child is nine years old and the youngest is three years old. All three children attend school (the youngest one is in preschool) and she has three people in her care.

She has been selling hairpieces for the past ten years. She stocks up at the big market in Ouagadougou. Her customers come from all over the place (mainly women).

She wants to buy 70 packets of hairpieces.

She uses her profits to strengthen her business. Her ambition is to travel to buy her goods in bulk and open a large shop for her business.

loans.use: to buy 70 packets of hairpieces

loans.name: Dilrabokhon

texts.ru: Дилрабохон замужем и любящая мать троих детей. Она очень трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина, которая занимается продажей женских тканей. Она имеет широкий ассортимент женских тканей, имеет много постоянных клиентов. Начала свою деятельность в 1998 году и до сих пор успешно продолжает. Имеет хорошую репутацию среди продавцов рынка. Дилрабохон запрашивает займ для покупки женских тканей с целью расширения бизнеса. Она надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Dilrabokhon is married and a loving mother of three children. She sells women's fabrics and is a very hard-working and driven woman. Dilrabokhon offers a wide assortment of fabrics and has many regular customers. She began her business in 1998 and has continued it successfully since, establishing a favourable reputation among the market's sellers. Dilrabokhon is requesting a loan to purchase women's fabrics in order to expand her business. She hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy fabrics in order to expand her business

loans.name: Marhabohon

texts.ru: Мархабохон женщина в возрасте 36 лет, замужем, имеет двоих детей. Муж работает охранником продуктового рынка, а Мархабохон бухгалтером в пожарной части.Скоро у них большое торжество,ее сестра выходит замуж и Мархабохон хочет подарить своей сестре подарок.Она хочет купить комплект из ювелирных изделий. Ее заработная плата не позволяет купить сестре этот комплект.На приобретенный кредит она купит подарок сестре  и каждый месяц будет погашать из доходов семьи.
texts.en: Marhabohon is a 36-years-old woman who is married and has two children. Her husband works as a security guard at a food market, while Marhabohon is an accountant at a fire-fighting brigade. They are preparing for the great celebration of her sister's wedding, and Marhabohon would like to give her sister a gift - a set of jewelry. Marhabohon's salary does not allow her to buy this gift outright, and so she is taking this loan, which she will repay using her family's monthly earnings.

loans.use: to buy a gift for her sister's wedding

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa is 39 years old, single, and has one child.  She lives in the Philippines. Marisa has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, and  beverages, which she has been doing for 10 years. 

Marisa is requesting a loan for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.  Marisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Marisa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Hawa Issa

texts.fr:
Madame   HAWA ISSA est âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle vit avec plusieurs autres familles dans le quartier Médine  de Ségou
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales,  très vite, elle commença à faire les activités génératrices de revenus, notamment la tresse auprès de sa sœur qui faisait le métier de tresseuse de cheveux. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à ses côtés, elle  décida de s’installer à son propre comptant en menant la même activité en ouvrant un salon de coiffure. Elle  mène cette activité depuis 20 ans et jouit d’une grande expérience et clientèle. Sa force  est due à son génie de création.
Dans le souci d’être à la page et de faire plus de bénéfice, elle sollicite ce prêt. Elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 18 mois, après  3 prêts solidaires  bien remboursés. Elle   est à son 1er  prêt individuel qu’elle utilisera pour acheter, 1 machine séchoir  et 1 casque pour cheveux. Elle  s’approvisionnera sur place.
Madame  HAWA ISSA fait ses prestations  comptant et à crédit à des clients fidèles. Avec ce prêt elle  envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 120 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et de diversifier ses activités génératrices de revenus.
Son ambition est   de construire une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Hawa Issa is 40 years old, married, and mother of three children. She lives with several other families in the Médine neighborhood of Ségou.

Since she didn't go to school due to family reasons, she began performing revenue-generating activities from an early age. In particular, she began braiding hair with her sister, who braided hair for a living. After several years of learning by her sister's side, she decided to start her own business by opening up a hair salon for braiding hair. She has been running this business for the past 20 years and has a lot of experience and customers. Her greatest strength is her creativity.

She is seeking this loan in order to stay up to date and make more profit. She has been working with Soro Yiriwaso for 18 months now, after three group loans that were all correctly repaid. She is now on her first individual loan, which she will use to buy 1 hand-held hair-dryer and 1 freestanding hair-dryer. She stocks up in her town.

Hawa Issa provides her services for cash, or credit for her regular customers. With this loan, she plans to earn a monthly profit of 120,000 FCFA. These profits will allow her to pay back the interest on her loan and diversify her revenue-generating activities.

Her goal is to build a house to live in.

loans.use: to buy hairdressing equipment

loans.name: Mary Del Carmen

texts.es: Mary compró sandalias de baño, artesanías, suvenires, broches y salidas de baño que vendió y ganó dinero, con el cual está fortaleciendo su negocio de producción de galletas y comidas, en el que también invirtió una parte de su anterior credikiva. En la actualidad está muy entusiasmada con su negocio de comidas, porque le está yendo muy bien, por eso con un nuevo credikiva, al que en la actualidad está aplicando, comprará insumos para la preparación de sus alimentos y otra parte la destinará a la compra de mercancías variadas, con las cuales dará respuesta a los pedidos de sus clientes. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Gracias por el apoyo, por ayudarla a sacar adelante sus negocios, con los cuales estoy sacando adelante a mi familia
texts.en: Mary bought flip flops, artisanal goods, souvenirs, brooches and cover ups that she sold and from which she made money with which she is reinforcing her cookie and food production business in which she also invested part of her previous credikiva. She is currently very excited about her food business because it is running very well. That is why she will use part of the money from the new credikiva for which she is currently applying to buy ingredients and the rest to buy diverse goods that she will use to meet the orders of her clients. Her message for the Kiva lenders is “Thank you for your support, for your help to keep my businesses running. They enable me to get my family ahead in life”.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food with part of the money and diverse goods with the rest.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en: Cristita is 63 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. Cristita has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She is also into rice and corn farming. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Cristita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Cristita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for sale

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en: Eddie is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 3 children. Eddie has a shop that sells plastic ware and clothing, like blouses and shirts. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of clothing and plastic ware products for sale. Eddie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Eddie hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothing and plastic ware products for sale

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
La señora Rufina  es socia del Banco Comunal “Corazones Unidos”, del distrito de Desaguadero, provincia Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 44 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 1  hijo en estudio, la señora cuenta con estudios de educación secundaria.
Hace seis años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de chifleria (productos de uso personal/varios).
En la actualidad solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de  S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar candados, tubos para luz- agua, focos, pastas dentales, cepillos, escobas, etc, en el negocio le ayuda su hijo.
Su sueño para el futuro es mejorar su negocio.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad, el ahorro y su ganancia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rufina is a member of the “United Hearts” Community Bank, which is located in the Desaguadero District, in the Chucuito Provence, in the department of Puno. She is 44 years old, is married and has one child in secondary school.
She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past six years. Her first loan was for 3,000 new soles. This loan she used to support her business that sells various personal use products. She is asking for a new loan of 2,000 new soles, which she will use to buy padlocks, fluorescent bulbs, water, flashlights, toothpaste, toothbrushes, brooms, etc. for this business that helps her child.
Her dream for the future is to improve her business.
What she likes the most about the community bank is that they are punctual and that they provide savings and earnings.

loans.use: to buy padlocks, fluorescent bulbs, water, flashlights, toothpaste, toothbrushes, brooms, etc.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Judith has an electronics shop that provides repairs to home appliances and other electrical machines, where her husband is the main repairman. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the electricity for the services. Judith has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Judith hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the electricity for the services

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en: Marjorie is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Marjorie has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Marjorie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marjorie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for sale

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Ruth has a shop that sells chicken and pork barbecue. She is also buying and selling gasoline per liter. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making barbecue. Ruth has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ruth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making barbecue

loans.name: Margarita Delia

texts.es:
Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal “las Mujeres de Santa Rosa de Arapa II”  ubicado en el distrito de Arapa, provincia  Azángaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene un hijo, la señora realizó estudios de educación superior.
 	
Margarita recientemente se incorpora a trabajar con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, solicitará un préstamo por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertirá en su negocio de venta de comidas (restaurante), comprará mercaderías  como papa, arroz, verduras, carnes, etc, para la preparación de  los alimentos, en le negocio le ayuda su esposo.

Su sueño para el futuro  crecer en el negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la facilidad del préstamo y el ahorro
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of  “The Women of Santa Rosa of Arapa II” Community Bank. It is located in the Arapa District, in the Azángaro Province, in the department of Puno. She is thirty years old, married and has a child who is studying in a school of higher education.
Margarita recently began working with the Manuela Ramos Movement. She is asking for a loan of 500.00 new soles. This loan she will use for her restaurant business. She will buy merchandise such as potatoes, rice, vegetables, meats, etc. in order to prepare food in this business that she runs with the help of her husband. 
Her future goal is to grow her business.
What she like the best about the Community Bank is that it is easy to save and borrow money.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as potatoes, rice, vegetables, meats, etc.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn, a 58-year-old  widowed mother of four,  lives in the Philippines where for the past 20 years she has had a food shop at the school canteen, selling  snacks such as rice and pancakes. A member of HSPFI since 2011, Evelyn is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy more raw ingredients for making the snacks.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks to sell.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Ilusion Group

texts.es:
Maria Orbelina tiene 54 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos de 33 y 30 años los cuales ya son independientes y vive solo con su esposo en Cuyamel, Cortes.
Doña Maria, realiza una actividad desde hace 13 años, en la venta de comida. Inicio este negocio viéndose en la necesidad de generar otro ingreso extra que le ayudara a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Ella vende pollo frito con tajadas de banano, carne asada, chuletas frita, baleadas, tortilla con quesillo, almuerzo y refrescos. Manifiesta que es un negocio rentable y lo tiene establecido en un punto de venta del centro de Cuyamel.  Empezando a atender a los clientes desde las 8.00 am hasta 9.00 pm todos los días de la semana. 
Este es su cuarto préstamo con ODEF de 15,000 lempiras el cual invertirá en comprar insumos para la elaboración de comidas como ser carnes y refrescos, aprovechando la temporada alta de ventas de Semana Santa. Con los prestamos obtenidos ha surtir su negocio e incrementar sus ventas.
Su meta es ampliar más el negocio y vender mariscos, para incrementar sus ventas.
Doña Maria Orbelina pertenece a un Grupo Solidario llamado Ilusión que consta de cuatro miembros siendo ella la coordinadora del grupo. En la foto se identifica por su blusa color blanco es la  segunda de derecha a izquierda. Los otros tres miembros están solicitando su primer préstamo de 7,000 lempiras cada uno y son: Maria Issela, (camisa gris de izquierda a derecha), seguido Don Cristóbal, y al lado derecho blusa color rosado  Verónica Maria. Quienes se dedican a la compra y venta de mercadería, como ser: Ropa, zapatos, cosméticos etc.
texts.en:
Maria Orbelina, age 54, is married and has two children, ages 33 and 30.  They children are adults, so she lives only with her husband in Cuyamel, Cortes.

Maria has been selling food for 13 years.  She started this business when she saw the need to generate extra income to help her husband with the household expenses.  She sells fried chicken with sliced bananas, roasted meat, fried pork chops, "baleadas" (flour tortillas with beans, eggs, butter, cheese and meat), tortillas with soft cheese, lunch, and soft drinks.

She states that it is a profitable business, and she has it set up at a sales location in the center of Cuyamel.  She starts waiting on customers at 8:00 a.m., and she works until 9:00 p.m. every day of the week.

This loan for 15,000 lempiras is her fourth loan with ODEF.  She will use it to buy supplies to make food like meats and snacks.  She will take advantage of the high sales season of Holy Week.  With the loans she has received she has stocked her business and increased her sales.  Her goal is to expand her business and to sell seafood in order to increase her sales.

Maria Oberlina belongs to the Ilusión communal bank, which has four members.  She is the coordinator of the group.  She is the one in the photo wearing a white blouse, and she is the second one going from right to left.

The other three members are requesting their first loan for 7,000 lempiras each.  They are Maria Issela (gray shirt, from left to right), followed by Cristóbal, and on the right side is Verónica Maria in a pink blouse.  They buy and sell merchandise like clothes, shoes, and cosmetics, etc.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make food like meats and snacks.

loans.name: El Triunfo Group

texts.es: EL Banco Comuna El Triunfo está conformado por 9 emprendedores que son de las misma localidad donde habitan, cada uno de los emprendedores tiene sus negocios su objetivo de este grupo es bastecerse de productos para ofrecerle a sus clientes y brindar un mejor servicio. Maria  Jesús es una emprendedora que es parte de este grupo de emprendedores que día a día lucha por salir adelante con sus negocios, la actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de golosinas y refrescos el crédito que esta solicitando lo necesita para invertir más en el negocio, ella comprara variedad de golosinas, variedad de frutas para los frescos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "El Triunfo" [The Triumph] is made up of 9 entrepreneurs who live in the same area where they are from. Each one of the entrepreneurs has their own business. The group's objective is to supply products for their clients and provide a better service. 

Maria Jesús is an entrepreneur who is part of this enterprising group that strives on a daily basis to get ahead in their businesses. She sells snacks and fruit beverages. The loan will be used to invest more in her business. She will buy a variety of snacks and fruits for beverages.

loans.use: to buy snacks and a variety of fruits for beverages.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: Irene es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Luren, tiene 65 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de picarones, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace ya 6 años, pudo aprender a ser mas responsable, la puntualidad y lo que mas le gusta es que puede ahorrar, para ella eso tiene mucho valor se pone metas para poder usar ese dinero, trata de hacer las cosas correctas, esta muy feliz en Finca, ahora el préstamo lo invertirá una parte para su negocio y para la enfermedad de su hermano.
texts.en: Irene is a member of the “Mr. Luren” Community Bank. She is 65 years old. She sells fried bread. She has been a member of  “Property of Perú” for the past six years. She has learned how to be more responsible and punctual. What she likes the best about this organization is that she can save money. This is really important to her. She has goals for the use of this money. She tries to do the right thing. She is very happy with “Property of Peru”. She will invest the money from this loan in her business and also in the health of her child.

loans.use: to buy products for her business.

loans.name: Maria Emperatriz

texts.es: María es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Luren, tiene 20 años de edad, es madre de un niño, ella vende Salchipapas, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 1 año y medio y en este corto tiempo y la corta edad que tienen pudo aprender muchas cosas que le sirvieron para poder tener un negocio, María antes de entrar a Finca no trabajaba, aquí le enseñaron el valor que tiene el trabajo, y que tiene que ser autosuficiente, ahora es madre y trabaja mucho para darle lo necesario a su hijo y valora la oportunidad que le dieron cuando ella no tenia nada. Ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de papa, y para sus estudios.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Señor de Luren communal bank.  She is 20 years old, and she has one child.  She sells “salchipapas” (fried potatoes and fried sausages).  

She has been a member of Finca Perú for one and a half years.  During this short time, and at her young age, she was able to learn a lot of things that  helped her be able to have a business.

María did not work before she joined Finca.  Here they taught her the value of work and that she needs to be self-sufficient.  She is now a mother, and she works a lot in order to give her son the necessities.  She values the opportunity that she was given when she had nothing.

Now she will use the loan to buy potatoes and to pay for her education.

loans.use: to buy potatoes for her business.

loans.name: Norma Gladys

texts.es:
Norma es socia del Banco Comunal “las Mujeres de Santa Rosa de Arapa II”  ubicado en el distrito de Arapa, provincia  Azángaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 24 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos, la señora estudio educación secundaria.
 
Su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles dinero que invirtió en su negocio venta de animales como chanchos, ovejas, trabaja hace año y medio con Movimiento Manuela Ramos.

Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevo soles, utilizará para comprar tres ovejas, chanchos para su respectivo engorde  por dos meses, los animales lo compra y lo vende  de Taraco, la señora sola trabaja ya que su esposo trabaja en transporte. 

Su sueño para el futuro es tener una tienda de abarrotes bien implementada.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la responsabilidad y el compañerismo con las socias.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the “Women of Santa Rosa of Arapa II” Community Bank. It is located in the Arapa District, in the Azángaro Province, in the department of Puno. She is 24 years old, married and has two children who are in secondary school. Her first loan was for 500.00 new soles. This money she used to buy animals such as pigs and sheep. She has been working with the Manuel Ramos Movement for the past year and a half.
With this new loan of 1,000.00 new soles, she will buy three sheep. She will fatten them up for two months. She buys and sells animals in Taraco. Norma works alone as her husband works in the transportation business. Her dream for the future is to have a well-stocked grocery store. What she likes the best about the community bank is being responsible and the companionship of the other members.

loans.use: to buy three sheep that she will fatten up for two months.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en: Jessie is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. Jessie has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy more inventory of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Jessie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jessie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Necolasita

texts.en: Necolasita is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. Necolasita has a shop that sells clothing like blouses and t-shirts. She is also making and selling homemade sausage or longganisa. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy clothing for her shop and ingredients needed for making homemade sausage. Necolasita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Necolasita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing and ingredients needed for making homemade sausage

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has six children. Corazon has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy more canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell. Corazon has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Corazon hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Nancy Marisol

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Mujeres de Santa Rosa de Arapa II”  ubicado en el distrito de Arapa, provincia  Azángaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo, la señora realizo estudios de educación superior.
 
Desde hace 6 meses trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incrementó en su negocio de cabinas de internet, servicios de copias, juegos y venta de libros, cuadernos, etc.

Solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, con la que comprara útiles escolares para abastecer su negocio, ella recibe apoyo de su esposo.

Su sueño para el futuro  es prosperar en el negocio y crecer.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las charlas de capacitación.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the “Women of Santa Rosa of Arapa II” Community Bank. It is located in the Arapa District, in the Azángaro Province, in the department of Puno. She is 27 years old, single and has a child who is studying in higher education. For the past six months she has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement. Her first loan was for 500.00 new soles, money that she used to support her business that includes internet booths, a copier service and a bookstore where she buys and sells books and notebooks, etc. She is asking for a new loan of 500.00 new soles, which she will use to buy school supplies in order to grow her business. She has the support of her husband. Her dream for the future is to increase her business so it is prosperous.
What she likes the most about the communal bank is it’s capacity building talks.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Manilyn

texts.en: Manilyn is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. Manilyn has a bakeshop that sells breads, pastries, and cakes. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making breads and pastries. Manilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Manilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making breads and pastries

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. Maria has a barbecue shop that makes and sells chicken and pork barbecue. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making barbecue. Maria has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Maria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making barbecue

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. Flora has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, beverages, and firewood. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 12,000 PHP to buy more canned goods, snacks, and firewood to sell. Flora has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Flora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and firewood to sell

loans.name: Rosa Clotilde

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal Siempre Amigas, vive por la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca,  parroquia que es reconocida por la belleza de su naturaleza , su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura, comercio y muchos labora en la ciudad de Cuenca en varias actividades, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.

Doña Rosa tiene 41 años, es casada y ha concebido 3 hijos, dos son casados e independientes y su hija soltera trabaja y le ayuda económicamente. Su esposo es maestro carpintero y labora en un taller, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.

Doña Rosa nos comenta que se encuentra muy bien en su salud al igual que están todos los miembros de su familia. Ella labora como empleada domestica y en su casa se dedica a la cría de pollos negocio en el que le va bien, labora en estas actividades para aportar a la economía de su hogar y sacar adelante a su familia.
 
El dinero de su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de cerdos y su alimento y como le va bien en la crianza de estos animalitos está pidiendo un nuevo crédito el mismo que lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y cerdos para crecer más en este negocio. En el pago de su crédito anterior no tuvo ninguna dificultad realizando la cancelación a la fecha. La banca comunal le gusta por la facilidad de los créditos y la atención personalizada que les brindan los promotores de crédito.

Su meta es mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the "Siempre Amigas" communal bank. She lives in the El Valle parish in Cuenca. This parish is known for its beautiful natural surroundings.  Its inhabitants devote themselves to raising animals, farming, and commerce.  Many of them work at various business activities in Cuenca.  They maintain the culture and traditions of their ancestors. 

Rosa is 41, married, and has three children. Two are married and independent, and her unmarried daughter works and helps her financially. Her husband is a master carpenter, and he works in a workshop. They own the house where they live. 

Rosa tells us that she is in very good health, the same as all the rest of her family members.  She works as a domestic employee, and she raises chickens at her house.  The business is going well for her.  She works at these business activities in order to contribute to the household finances and to get her family ahead.

She used the previous loan to buy pigs and feed for them.  As raising these animals is going well for her, she is requesting a new loan.  She will use it to buy chickens and pigs in order for her business to grow.  She did not have any difficulty paying the previous loan on time.
