She likes the communal bank because of the easy terms of the loans and for the personalized attention the loan facilitators provide. 

Her goal is to fix her house.

loans.use: to buy chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Unidas es el grupo formado en la ciudad de Curuguaty, están actualmente en el segundo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Ellas han visto en estte programa una gran oportunidad en sus proyectos de vida, y desean poder mejorar las condiciones de sus hijos y familiares, y es por ello que siempre se esfuerzan.
Myrian trabaja todos los días en la lavandería que tiene en su casa. Nos comenta que empezó con unas cuantas maquinas, y que luego gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ha podido ir creciendo y de esa forma ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y de ser posible ayudar a sus vecinos con fuentes de trabajo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de jabón, enjuagues, suavizantes y demás insumos necesarios para poder seguir trabajando y ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mujeres Unidas (Women United) is a group that was formed in the city of Curuguaty and is currently in its second loan cycle with the program for female entrepreneurs from the Fundación Paraguaya.  They have seen in this program a great opportunity for their prospects in life, and they would like to be able to improve conditions for their children and relatives, and for this they are always striving.

Myrian works every day in the Laundromat that she has in her house.  She told us that she started with a few machines and later, thanks to her effort and dedication, she was able to improve on this by offering better accomodations to her customers.  Her goal is to continue to grow and to make it possible to provide her neighbors with sources of work.

She is asking for the credit to buy soap, rinses, softeners and other supplies necessary to continue working and offering good service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the laundromat.

loans.name: Menas Feliciana

texts.es:
Menas es socia del Banco Comunal “las Mujeres de Santa Rosa de Arapa II”  ubicado en el distrito de Arapa, provincia  Azángaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 63 años de edad, está casada y tiene doce hijos, todos independientes, la señora no tiene estudios.
 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace dos años, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio de venta de animales.

Solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 2,000.00 nuevo soles, con la que comprará toros para su respectivo engorde por tres meses, para luego venderlos a buen precio.  También se dedican a la venta de productos de la región, en el negocio le ayuda su esposo. 

Su sueño para el futuro  es seguir con el negocio y crecer dia a dia.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Menas is a member of the “las Mujeres de Santa Rosa de Arapa II” communal bank, located within the Arapa district, part of the Azángaro province and Puno department.  She’s 63 years old, married and has twelve children, all adults now.  She does not have a formal education.
 
She’s been working with “Movimiento Manuela Ramos” for two years.  Her first loan was for 500 PEN, which she used for her animal sales business.
 
She’s requesting a new loan in the amount of 2,000 PEN, which she will use to buy bulls to fatten up for three months and then sell for a good price.  She also sells regional products.  Her husband helps her with her business.

Her dream for the future is to continue with her business and growing it daily.
 
What she enjoys most about the communal bank is the ease of obtaining loans.

loans.use: to buy bulls to fatten up and sell.

loans.name: Esperanza Para El Futuro Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Esperanza Para El Futuro” es un grupo conformado por 11 socios, la cual llevan 08 meses trabajando con el Programa-Prosperidad siendo Favio el tesorero del grupo, cargo que ha llevado con responsabilidad. Favio tiene 31 años de edad es conviviente con 02 hijos aún dependientes. El Sr. Favio cuenta con una mototaxi la cual brinda servicio de transporte, lleva trabajando de esta manera hace mas de 10 años,  lo que pudo ahorrar con dicho  trabajo, y así cumplir una de sus metas, ya que hace poco tiempo se compro un carro la cual le brinda mayores ganancias. Gracias a su arduo trabajo y dedicación Favio ha podido sacar adelante a su familia, pues ellos  han sido su motivo para seguir progresando.  En esta oportunidad solicito el crédito para el mantenimiento de su  carro. El deseo de Favio es de comprarse otro carro, y así  alquilarlo como servicio de transporte.   La Alcancía Comunal “Esperanza Para El Futuro” están agradecidos y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Esperanza Para El Futuro” [Hope for the Future] has 11 members, who have been working with the Prosperity Program for 8 months. Favio is the group's treasurer, a position he has filled responsibly. Favio is 31 years old and lives with his 2 dependent children. Favio has a motorcycle taxi with which he offers transportation service. For more than 10 years, he has worked in this business, which allowed him to save and achieve one of his goals. Recently, he bought a car, which brings him higher profits. 

With hard work and dedication, Favio has been able to support his family, and they have been his motive to continue moving forward.  At this time, he has requested a loan to maintain his car.  Favio's wish is to buy another car, so that he can hire it out it for transportation service. The members of the communal bank “Esperanza Para El Futuro” are grateful and promise to continue working hard.

loans.use: to maintain his car.

loans.name: Oloitiefu

texts.en:
Oloitiefu is 54 years old and has 2 children. She owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She has 1 year of experience in this business.

Oloitiefu needs a loan of 1000 Samoan talas (WST) to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas, or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Oloitiefu joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Oloitiefu's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Selau

texts.en:
Selau is 39 years old and has 7 children. She owns and operates a business venture running bingo games. She has 2 years of experience in this business.

Selau needs a loan of 1000 Samoan talas (WST) to purchase game prizes such as boxes of noodles, mosquito coils (mosquito-repelling incense), boxes of chicken, and bags of rice. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas, or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Selau joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Selau's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase game prizes such as boxes of noodles, mosquito coils, boxes of chicken, and bags of rice.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ru:
Ахмад молодой мужчина, мастер по выпечки национального хлеба.Он работает на другого человека. Его хозяин платит ему, в день в среднем 50 сомони, в зависимости от количества испечённых лепёшек.Ахмад занимается этим делом уже 10 лет, поэтому у него вкусные лепёшки, которые пользуются хорошим спросом на рынке.Он хочет отремонтировать свою квартиру потому что его квартира  в очень плохом состоянии.Столько лет работая пекарем он не смог решить эту проблему.Поэтому он хочет приобрести кредит,сделать ремонт в своей квартире  и постепенно погашать займ.








о
texts.en: Ahmad is a young man and a master of baking traditional bread. He works in someone else's bakery, and his boss pays him 50 somoni per day, on average, depending on the number of baked flat-breads. Ahmad has been a baker for 10 years, which is why he makes tasty breads that always sell well at the market. He would like to repair his apartment, which is currently in a very bad state. After working as a baker for all these years, he has been unable to find a solution to this problem on his own. This is why he would like to obtain a loan, repair his apartment, and then gradually pay back the money.

loans.use: to repair his apartment

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan, trabaja como chofer asalariado en un sindicato de trasporte publico en la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para la construcción de una habitación para dar más comodidad a su familia.
Juan, es casado y tiene dos hijos con los cuales vive en la casa de sus suegros en la zona Kenanipata en la ciudad de El Alto.
Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Juan, works as a salaried driver for the public transporation union in the city of La Paz.  He needs the loan for the contruction of a room to give his family more comfort.  Juan is married and has two children with whom he lives in his in-law's home in the Kenanipata area of the city of El Alto.  This is the first time that he is working with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to build a room for the comfort of his family.

loans.name: Traice

texts.es:
Traice
600000 colones

Traice tiene 28 años de edad, en este momento su bebé tiene 4 meses y vive con su esposo Greivin, en la casa de sus padres. Es una joven emprendedora y con muchos deseos de superación, termino la carrera de Terapia Física en la Universidad, pero ante la dificultad de conseguir empleo, está trabajando en un oficio que aprendió hace mas de 10 años, el arreglo de uñas de pies y manos y actualmente se está especializando en la el arte de uñas artificiales.

Se enteró de Fundación Mujer por medio de una visita realizada a la Oficina de la Mujer en la Municipalidad de Puntarenas, vive en la zona de Carrizal de Puntarenas en la costa del Pacífico Central de Costa Rica, ella se ha estado capacitando en el arte de las uñas artificiales y desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de materiales para esta nueva labor, la cual le va a incrementar los ingresos y espera continuar ahorrando para apoyar a su familia y poner un local en el futuro.
Desea ofrecerle a su hijo la oportunidad de contar con una buena calidad de vida. Por la mañana atiende los oficios de la casa y en la tarde empiezan a llegar las clientas o va a visitarlas a domicilio. Con este préstamo, la solicitante va a adquirir materiales para su negocio y continuar capacitándose para mejorar el servicio a sus clientes
El impacto del crédito es de suma importancia, ya que les da la oportunidad de comprar materia prima y apoyar a su familia ahorrando para alquilar una casa, su moral de pago se muestra excelente, y las recomendaciones que presenta la acreditan como una persona horada y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Traice is 28 years old.  She now has a 4 month-old baby, and she lives with her husband, Greivin in her parents' home. She is an enterprising young woman who has a great desire to improve herself. She finished a university degree in physical therapy but, faced with difficulty finding work, she is now working in a trade that she learned more than 10 years ago, offering manicures and pedicures.  Now she is specializing in the art of artificial nails.

Tracie found out about Fundación Mujer through a visit to a Women's Office in the town of Puntarenas. Tracie lives in Carrizal district, in Puntarenas, on the Central Pacific coast of Costa Rica. She has been training in the art of doing artificial nails and she wants to invest this loan in the purchase of supplies for this new endeavor, which should increase her income.  She hopes to continue saving so that she can support her family and establish her own shop in the future.

She wants to provide her child with the opportunity to have a good quality life.  In the morning, she takes care of her housework and, in the afternoon, either her customers start to arrive or she goes to visit them at home. With this loan, she will buy supplies for her business and continue to undergo training so that she can improve her service to her customers. The impact of this loan is of utmost important since it will give Tracie the opportunity to buy supplies and to support her family, saving up so that she can rent a house. Her repayment behavior is excellent and the references she has provided show her to be an honest and hard-working person.

loans.use: to invest in supplies for her manicure/pedicure business, and to take training classes in this same line of work.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Elvira has a toy shop where she sells toy guns, cars, and mini-cartoon-character figures. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan of 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more stock (children's toys) for resale.

Elvira has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock (children's toys) for resale

loans.name: Madeleine Maria

texts.es: Madeleine de 43 años, es una mujer casada que tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 11 a 17 años.  Ella tiene un almacén de repuestos para motocicletas, actividad comercial que inició con un compadre de su esposo, con quien emprendió este negocio hace 9 años, cuando su compadre aportó la mayor parte del dinero y ella y su esposo el local y la administración del mismo. Desde hace 3 años su antiguo socio decidió invertir en otra actividad y le vendió su parte, para que su esposo y ella continuaran con el almacén. En la actualidad su negocio le produce lo necesario para el sostenimiento del hogar y se dedican también a ganar comisiones por la venta de motocicletas, actividad en la que está totalmente encargado su esposo. En su negocio lo mas representativo, son las buenas relaciones que tienen en su entorno, con sus clientes y proveedores, pero en la medida en que su clientela crece,  su capital de trabajo resulta insuficiente, esta es la razón por la cual acude  a su credikiva, primer crédito que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará, llantas, neumáticos , accesorios de lujos, pues son los productos de mayor rotación y que requiere tener un inventario adicional, para responder efectivamente a su clientela. La fortaleza de este negocio es su estratégica ubicación, lo que potencializa el incremento de su venta,   pues queda en la avenida principal del municipio de San Juan Nepomuceno, municipio del departamento de Bolívar.
texts.en:
Madeleine is 43 years old, married, and has three children with ages ranging from 11 to 17 years old. She has a motorcycle parts store, a business she started with her husband's friend nine years ago. At the time, her husband's friend contributed most of the funds while she and her husband provided the locale and administration of the business. Three years ago, their associate decided to invest in a different activity and sold his stake for them to continue with the store. 

At present, their business provides them with what they need to support their home. They also earn commissions from motorcycle sales, which her husband is responsible for. Their business is mostly known for their good relationship with their surroundings, customers, and suppliers. As their clientele has grown, they have found their working capital to be insufficient. This is the reason why they have requested a credit, their first with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. The loan will be used to buy tires, inner tubes of tires, and luxury accessories. She finds that these products have the highest turnover and she needs additional inventory to effectively meet her customers' demand.

The strength of this business lies in its strategic location, which can potentially increase their sales since it lies in principal avenue of the San Juan Nepomuceno municipality in the department of Bolivar.

loans.use: to buy tires, inner tubes of tires, and luxury accessories which are the products with highest turnover.

loans.name: Arcelie

texts.en:
Arcelie is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.

Arcelie has a shop where she sells charcoal made from coconut shells and wood by the sack. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy materials needed for charcoal-making.

Arcelie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for charcoal-making

loans.name: Faaloiloia

texts.en:
Faaloiloia is 30 years old and has three children.

Faaloiloia owns and operates a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community.  She has one year of experience in this business. Faaloiloia needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase sacks of flour, sugar and baking powder.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 340 talas or US $142 per week) to improve and expand her business.

In 2012, Faaloiloia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Faaloiloia's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of flour, sugar, and baking powder.

loans.name: Fala

texts.en:
Fala is 46 years old and has two children.

Fala owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale.  She has one year of experience in this business. Fala needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve and expand her business.

In 2012, Fala joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Fala's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Anara

texts.ru: Анаре 59 лет, замужем.  В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Анара занимается животноводством.  Начатое в еще в советский период с суммы в 20,000 сом хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Анара обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку двух бычков для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы Анара планирует вложить в дальнейшее  увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Anara is 59 years old and married. She raises livestock to provide a source of income for her family. Her farm, which she started during the Soviet period with 20,000 som, today earns around 20,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and dairy products. In order to continue developing her business, Anara has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to purchase two calves for fattening and subsequent resale. Anara plans to invest her profits into further livestock purchases.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: La Imaculada  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Inmaculada está conformado por 6 socias y 1 socio quienes desempeñan sus labores diarias en diferentes plazas de trabajo, las mismas que les permiten aportar a la economía de sus hogares y solventar sus gastos, se caracterizan por ser personas amables, gentiles y cordiales, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Viven por la parroquia de Santa Ana en Cuenca, en este lugar se goza de una excelente vista de la naturaleza, desde su centro parroquia se puede admirar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica a la agricultura, cría de animales y muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Rosa Cristina, tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera de 5 hijos que tienen 18, 16, 13, 11 y 9 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos están estudiando en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la localidad. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña Rosa Cristina hace 8 años labora como empleada domestica, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. En su casa se dedica a la cría de animales como cerdos, borregos, gallinas y cuyes a los que los vende en su comunidad, también se dedica a la agricultura y lo  que cosecha es solo para el consumo de su hogar.

En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 7 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos.

Su meta es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
The communal bank La Inmaculada comprises 1 male and 6 female members. They work daily at different jobs that allow them to economically support their households and pay their expenses. The members are friendly, kind, and cordial, in keeping with the culture and traditions of their towns. They live in Santa Ana parish in Cuenca. The area enjoys a beautiful view of nature. From the parish center, you can admire the view of a large part of the city of Cuenca. The people farm, raise animals, and do different activities in the city. 

Rosa Cristina is one of the group's members.She is 36 years old and the single mother of 5 children, who are 18, 16, 13, 11 y 9 years old. Her three oldest children are attending high school, and the two youngest study at a small neighborhood school. She owns the house in which she lives.

Rosa Cristina has been a maid for 8 years. She works Monday to Friday from 8 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon. At home, she raises animals such as pigs, sheep, chicken, and guinea pigs, which she sells in her community. She also farms, and what she harvests is only for consumption at home.

She has been a member of the communal bank for 7 years, and this new loan is to buy pigs. Her goal is to finish her house.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Progresar Al Futuro  (Paute) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Progresar al Futuro está formado por 4 socias y 3 socios, quienes diariamente laboran en diferentes actividades económicas las que les permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares. Viven en el cantón de Paute ubicado al noreste de la provincia del Azuay, su clima es sub-tropical-templado y sus paisajes se ha constituido en un lugar tradicionalmente turístico. Se encuentra bañada por los ríos Paute y Culticay, que hacen que sea un cantón próspero productor de frutas, flores y caña de azúcar. Su gente también mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Rosa María, tiene 28 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido un bebé de 10 meses de edad. Su esposo labora como albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora. Rosa María se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, a cuidar de su hijo y a criar cuyes a los mismos que los vende en su comunidad. 
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual  fue invitada  por una amiga, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para iniciar con la cría de estos animales.
 
Su meta es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The "Progresar al Futuro" ("Progress to the Future") community bank has four female and three male members, who work in different economic activities, which allow them to meet their living expenses.  They live in Paute, which is in the northeast of the province of Azuay in Ecuador.  The climate is sub-tropical-temperate, and the beautiful countryside is a traditional tourist destination.  The area is bathed by the Paute and Culticay rivers,  which make it a rich region for growing fruit, flowers, and sugar cane.  The people also maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.

Rosa María, 28, is one of the group's members.  She lives with her partner and has a 10-month-old baby.  Her partner works as a builder.  They do not have their own home but live in a rented premise.

Rosa María looks after the needs of their home, caring for their son and raising guinea pigs that she then sells within the community.

This is her second loan with the community bank, which a friend invited her to join.  She will use the funding to buy chickens so she can start to raise these animals.  Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Luna

texts.en:
Luna is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single.

Luna has a shop where she sells charcoal made from coco shells and wood by the sack. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy coco shells and wood for making charcoal.

Luna has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coco shells and wood for making charcoal.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has eight children. 

Jocelyn has a shop where she sells charcoal made from coco shells and wood charcoal by the sack. She had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy coco shells and wood for making charcoal.

Jocelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coco shells and wood for making charcoal.

loans.name: Domingga's Group

texts.en:
Domingga is married with 5 adult children. She is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Domingga is a farmer and specializes in rice production to earn a living. She has been doing this work for 20 years. She has requested a loan of 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase fertilizer.

Domingga has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she wants to have her own rice mill.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child.

Mila has a shop where she sells gasoline and kerosene by the liter. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more gallons of gasoline for resale.

Mila has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy gallons of gasoline for resale

loans.name: Antoney

texts.en: Antoney is 42 years old, married and has four children. He runs a cereals store to earn a living, has been in the business for one year and now employs six people. He describes his customers as low income earners who live in slums. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to educate his children and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for a loan for 100,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy cereals to sell.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: San Ramon Group

texts.es:
El comité  San Ramón se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, pero también actividades en grupo, para que de esa forma puedan fomentar su compañerismo y trabajo en equipo.
Fatima tiene una peluquería, y nos dice que gracias a la buena atención que da a sus clientes, puede seguir creciendo, pues son los mismos clientes los que le hacen publicidad. Ella se define como una persona muy trabajadora y por sobre todo muy emprendedora, que desea salir adelante por medio de su trabajo.
Ella solicita el crédito para abastecer su negocio con los insumos que mas vende día a día. Ella al igual que su grupo esta muy contentos por la oportunidad que la fundación y kiva le han dado.
texts.en:
The San Ramón committee is made up of a bunch of neighbors in the city of Santaní.  All the committee members work separately, but they also have group activities, so that they can build their solidarity and work together as a team. 

Fatima has a hair salon and tells us that, thanks to how well she treats her clients, her business should keep growing, since it is her own clients who advertise it for her.  She is a hardworking and enterprising person who wants to get ahead through her work.

She is seeking a loan to stock her business with the goods that she sells the most of every day. She, like the other members of her group, is very pleased with the opportunity that microfinance partner the Fundacíon Paraguaya and Kiva have given her.

loans.use: to buy stock for her business.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en: Mary Joy is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and three children. She earns a living by running a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years, and is requesting a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell to her customers. Mary Joy has been a member of HSPFI since 2010, and hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is married and has one child. She is 23 years old and lives in Caputol, Aloran. She earns a living as a farmer who grows vegetables. She has been doing this for one year, and has has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional fertilizer to use on her crops. Irene has been a member of PMPC for nine months and hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer to use on her crops.

loans.name: Maripeth

texts.en: Maripeth is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated and has four children. She earns a living by running a food shop (or carenderia) where she sells dishes such as pancit bihon and chicken pork adobo. Maripeth has been in this business for three years and is requesting a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy raw ingredients to make more dishes to sell. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010 and hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making food to sell.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr:
Madame MARIAMA est âgée de 45 ans, mariée  et mère de 5  enfants. Elle vit dans une famille traditionnelle au quartier Darsalam de Ségou.
MARIAMA n’a pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales, issue d’une famille ancrée dans les valeurs ancestrales. MARIAMA commença très vite à s’intéresser  aux activités génératrices de revenus tels l’achat vente des produits de l’aviculture : oeufs, poulets. 
Elle  mène cette activité depuis 15 ans et jouit d’une grande expérience et clientèle. 
Dans le souci d’augmenter son fonds de commerce et de faire plus de bénéfice, elle sollicite ce prêt. Elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 12 mois, après  1 prêt individuel bien remboursé, elle   est à son 2ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 286 alvéoles d'oeufs. Elle  s’approvisionne dans les fermes de son mari et autres et effectue ses ventes toujours  au comptant à une clientèle mixte. Avec ce prêt elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et subvenir aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariama is 45 years old, married, and the mother of five children.  She lives in a traditional family in the Darsalam district of Ségou. 

Mariama did not attend school because of social reasons; she comes from a family rooted in ancestor values.  At a very young age, Mariama became interested in profitable work like buying and selling poultry products such as eggs and chickens. 

She has been doing this type of work for 15 years, and she enjoys having a great deal of experience and a large clientele. 

In the hopes of building up her business and to make more profit, she is requesting a loan.  She has been involved with Soro Yiriwaso for 12 months.  After having paid back one individual loan, she is on her second individual loan which she plans to use to buy 286 egg cartons.  She gets her supplies from her husband's farm and makes her sales, always in cash, to a mixed clientele.  With this loan she foresees making a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA.  This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to meet family expenses.

loans.use: to buy eggs

loans.name: Santa Isabel Group

texts.es:
El comité santa Isabel  es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, esta integrado por 15 mujeres, todas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Ellas forman parte del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya, y han visto en ella una gran oportunidad de progreso para ellas y sus familias.
Unas de las miembros de este trabajador grupo es la señora Felicita, quien trabaja en la venta de helados, desde hace ya un tiempo. Ella comenta que empezó con un pequeña venta, pero que luego, con el correr del tiempo y gracias a su trabajo ha podido crecer y mejorar su local.
Su meta es poder seguir creciendo con su trabajo y en miras a ello es que solicita el crédito, para la compra de helados, con lo que abastecerá su stock, ya que es época de calor y tiene muchos clientes.
texts.en:
The Santa Isabel committee comes from the city of San Lorenzo.  Its membership consists of fifteen women, all of whom are friends and neighbors.  They are part of a program for working women conducted by microfinance partner the Fundacíon Paraguaya and see this program as a great opportunity for them and their families to make progress in life.

Felicita is one of the members of the group.  She has been selling ice cream for some time.  She notes that she started with a small stand, but over time and thanks to her hard work, she has succeeded in increasing and improving her premises.  Her dream is to keep her business growing, and for this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy ice cream so that she can increase her stock, since it is now the hot season, and she has lots of clients.

loans.use: to buy ice cream for resale.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en: Rufina is married and has two adult-aged children. She is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines, where she earns a living as a farmer. She supplements her income by processing charcoal. She has been in these lines of work for 20 years and has applied for a loan for PHP 35,000 to buy materials such as coconut shells, which she uses for charcoal processing. Rufina has been a member of PMPC for four years and wants to make her businesses more successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy coconut shells for charcoal processing.

loans.name: Utumalie

texts.en:
Utumalie is 35 years of age and married with 4 children. She owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has 3 years of experience in this business.

Utumalie needs a loan of 2000 Samoan talas (WST) to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas, or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Utumalie joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Utumalie's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: San Damian Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina San Damian  están en el Primer Ciclo con 12  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas solidarias  y responsable las unas con las otras. Ellas realizan actividades para la recaudación de fondos para el grupo, para que de esa forma tengan un fondo para afrontar cualquier inconveniente.
Marta es la presidenta del grupo, y nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo y que gracias a su arduo trabajo y sacrificio ha logrado salir adelante e ir progresando. Comenta que su sueño es poder tener un local grande donde pueda tener más variedad de ropas para poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, con las cuales quiere surtirse y de esa forma poder seguir teniendo los ingresos para mantener a su familia.  Ella, como el grupo agradecen a la fundación por la oportunidad recibida.
texts.en:
The communal bank San Damian is in its first loan cycle and has 12 members. The group stands out in the neighborhood for being united, caring,  and responsible for one another. They do activities to raise money for the group so that they have a fund to meet any problem. 

Marta is the group's president. She told us that she sells all types of garments. With hard work and sacrifice, she has supported herself and continues to make progress. She says her dream is to have a larger space, where she can offer a wider variety of clothing to her clients.

She requests the loan to buy garments, with which she will restock and in this way be able to maintain her income and support her family. She, like the rest of the group, is grateful to the foundation for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy garments to sell.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
El Comité " Virgen de Fátima " lo integran 11 mujeres, quienes se encuentran en el tercer ciclo. Todas son muy trabajadoras y de condición humilde, el comité está situado en el barrio Virgen de Fátima de la ciudad de Curuguaty.
Cecilia es una de las integrantes del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, como ser de vestir, de sport y demás. Comenta que empezó con muy poco, pero que gracias a su sacrificio hoy en día ya es una buena microempresaria que sobresale.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de vestirá, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y de esa forma estar preparada para los pedidos de sus clientes. El comité está muy agradecido por la oportunidad que está recibiendo por parte de fundación paraguaya y de Kiva.
texts.en:
The “Virgen de Fátima” committee is composed of eleven women who are in the third cycle.  They are all very hard working and of humble resources.  The committee is located in the city of Curuguaty’s Virgen de Fátima neighborhood.

Cecilia is one of the group members.  She sells all sorts of clothes; dress, sport and others.  She comments that she started out with very little but thanks to her sacrifice today she is a good micro businesswoman who stands out.

She requested the loan to buy clothes to stock up so that she can be prepared for customer orders.  The committee is very grateful for this opportunity they are receiving from Fundación Paraguaya and from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 
Josephine has a food shop that sells viands like chicken and pork adobo, pancit guisado, and vegetable saute. She has had this business for nine years. She requested a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy raw ingredients for making viands to sell.
Josephine has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Josephine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands

loans.name: Santos Danilo

texts.es: El señor Danilo tiene 40 años de edad, es casado, tiene dos hijas, su esposa es ama de casa, es una familia muy unida y responsable, desde hace 18 años don Danilo se dedica al cultivo de café, comenzó trabajando con su padre que le enseño desde muy pequeño a cultivar café. Las siembras las hacen por temporadas y cuando esta la cosecha el horario de trabajo es de todo el día  y parte de la noche. El préstamo lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de fertilizantes, seria una muy buena oportunidad ya que de lo contrario tendría que comprometer la cosecha con intermediarios que se aprovechan a comprar el producto a un bajo precio. Algunos de los problemas que enfrenta don Danilo son la escasa mano de obra y el difícil traslado del producto. Uno de sus sueños es mejorar la finca para tener una mejor producción de café. Este es el primer financiamiento que obtiene don Danilo en FAMA y espera cumplir puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Danilo is 40 years old, married, and has two daughters. His wife is a homemaker and they are a very close and responsible family. Danilo has been growing coffee for 18 years. He started working with his father who taught him from an early age how to cultivate coffee. The planting is done seasonally and when it's harvest time, their schedule is to work during the whole day and part of the night. 

The loan will be used to buy fertilizers. It would be a great opportunity for him. Otherwise, he would have to compromise the harvest with intermediaries who take advantage by buying the product at a low price. Some challenges that Danilo faces are the scarce manual labor and product transportation difficulties. 

One of his dreams is to improve the farm to get a better coffee production. This is Danilo's first credit with FAMA [MFI] and he hopes to promptly fulfill his payments.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for coffee cultivation.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
Renacer se llama el grupo formado en la ciudad de Asunción. Actualmente este comité  se encuentra en su 20 ciclo en donde se puede destacar el sentido de responsabilidad y los deseos de progresar que tienen de cada una de las que integrantes,  además de la responsabilidad en los pagos.
Alda trabaja de cocinera, y nos comenta que trabaja en esto hace ya un buen tiempo, por lo que ya tiene una clientela bien formada, pues su comida es siempre bien aceptada por sus clientes. Ella se esfuerza siempre al máximo para poder progresar y salir adelante por medio del duro trabajo que hace.
Alda acude a la fundación y a kiva para solicitar un crédito, el cual desea invertir en la compra de los insumos que necesita para hacer los alimentos que vende. Necesita comprar carne, hortalizas, aderezos, y demás.
texts.en:
The name of the group formed in the city of Asunción is “Renacer” (To Be Reborn).  The committee is currently in its 20th cycle and it stands out because of its sense of responsibility and the wish each member has to make progress and also because of the responsibility with payments.

Alda works as a cook and she comments that she’s done this work for a good time now so she has a well-established clientele because her food is always well received by her customers.  She strives to the maximum to be able to make progress and get ahead thanks to the hard work she does.

Alda is calling on the Fundación and on Kiva to request a loan that she wants to use to buy ingredients she needs to make the food she sells.  She needs to buy meat, vegetables, condiment, etc.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for meal preparation.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 44 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in Silongon, Tudela. Emma has a general store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for nine years. 

Emma is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.  Emma has been a member of PMPC for nine years.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase  products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents.

loans.name: Johndriel

texts.en:
Johndriel is 27 years old, married, and has two children.  He lives in the Philippines. Johndriel has a barber shop that provides hair cutting and shaving. He has had this business for six years. 

Johndriel is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which he will use to buy materials needed for his barber shop.  Johndriel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011  In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for his barber shop.

loans.name: Unidas Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres “Unidas” Empezó a trabajar con la Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 2010 mediante la promoción hecha a la señora Idalina quien invitó y organizo a sus amigas y vecinas del barrio. El grupo actualmente está integrado por 12 mujeres que trabajan en forma conjunta y coordinada. Ellas son señoras muy unidas, responsables y solidarias.
Sara vende chipas (Alimento típico paraguayo), y comenta que se dedica a esto hace ya un buen tiempo, por lo que ya tiene una clientela bien formada. Su producto es muy solicitado por sus clientes y es por ello que le va muy bien en esto. Día a día se esfuerza más y más para poder ir creciendo y ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de chipas, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y de esa forma cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.  Ellas están muy agradecidas por la ayuda que están recibiendo de kiva y fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
The “Unidas” (United) women’s committee started working with Fundación Paraguaya in 2010 thanks to a promotion conducted by Idalina who invited and organized her friends and neighbors in the neighborhood.  The group currently has 12 women members who work in a united, coordinated way.  The women are very united, responsible and mutually supportive.

Sara sells chipas (traditional Paraguayan food) and comments that she’s been doing this for some time now so she has a well-established clientele.  Her product is very sought after by her customers and this is why she does so well in this.  Day to day she strives more and more to grow and to help her family.

She is asking for the loan to buy chipas to stock up and meet customer demand.  They are very grateful for the help they are getting from Kiva and from Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy chipas [type of cornbread] to sell.

loans.name: Koreti

texts.en:
Koreti, a 53-year-old married mother of six, has been selling dried goods in the local community for five years. Koreti, who joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services, is requesting a loan of WST $2450 to purchase more raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This will be Koreti's fifth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 45 years old, married, and has six children.  She lives in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. Evelyn has a charcoal business, which she has had for 20 years. 

Evelyn is requesting a loan for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more materials, such as coconut shells, for her charcoal processing business. Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for three months.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials, such as coconut shells, for her charcoal processing business.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children. Betty has a food shop that sells local delicacies like chicken and pork adobo, pancit guisado, and vegetable saute. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 11,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making dishes to sell. Betty has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Betty hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
El Señor Martin, es de la ciudad de Villarrica, tiene 38 años de edad, es Propietario de un Taller de Chapería y Pintura en esa ciudad. Heredo la Profesión de su papá.
Con el transcurso del tiempo y con sacrificio pudo montar su propio Taller, hoy en día cuenta con clientela formada y presta servicios a varias Playas de vehículos, ya que el Señor es puntual y responsable con su trabajo. El se define como una persona muy trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante y progresar, para que de esa forma pueda ayudar a su familia.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de pinturas Sintéticos, barniz, tinner y aguarras, lo cual le ayudará a seguir trabajando y de esa forma poder tener un poco mas de ingresos.
texts.en:
Martin is from the city of Villarrica.  He’s 38 years old and owns a car detailing and painting shop in that city.  He inherited the business from his father.

In time and with great effort he was able to set up his own workshop and today has a well-established clientele.  He provides services to several car dealerships since he’s punctual and responsible with his work.  He defines himself as a very hardworking person who wants to get ahead and make progress in order to help his family this way.

The loan he’s requesting is to buy synthetic paint, varnish, thinner and turpentine which will help him continue working in order to earn a bit more income.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his shop.

loans.name: Paulo

texts.es:
El Sr Paulo es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, es Soltero, tiene 20 años, vive con padres. Hace dos años Habilito un negocio de ventas de celulares y además tiene ventas de Joyas de Plata. Tiene su local muy bien ubicado en el centro mismo de la ciudad por eso según Paulo tiene buena clientela.
Su sueño es tener un local propio y agrandar su negocio. Manifiesta que es joven, que tiene mucho por delante y que va seguir trabajando para lograr su objetivo.
El mismo agradece a la Fundación paraguaya por la confianza puesto en su persona y esta vez solicita el crédito para la compra de joyas, con las cuales podrá abastecer su negocio y de esa forma tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Paulo is from the city of Coronel Oviedo.  He’s single, 20 years old and living with his parents.  Two years ago he opened a mobile phone business and also sells silver jewelry.  His store is very well located in the very center of the city so Paulo has a good clientele because of this.  His dream is to have a locale of his own and to enlarge his business.  He states that he’s young and has a lot still before him and that he will continue working to reach his objective.

He thanks Fundación Paraguaya for the trust it’s placed in him and on this occasion he’s asking for a loan to buy jewelry to stock his store thus having more variety to offer his customers.

loans.use: to buy jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Atele

texts.en:
Atele is 47 years old, married, and has five children. Atele plants and harvests taro for sale. She has two years of experience in this business. Atele needs a loan of 1,500 WST to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 WST per week) to improve/expand her business.

In 2011, Atele joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Atele's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Philip

texts.en: Philip is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. Philip provides transportation services using a motorcycle with a sidecar. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy tools and gasoline for his motorcycle. Philip has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Philip hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools and gasoline

loans.name: Bolsa Negra Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BOLSA NEGRA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes y cuentan con una mesa directiva y a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  la señora Sabina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, macramé, venta de cuadros pintados, venta de arroz, venta de salteñas, venta de víveres a crédito.

La señora Sabina, indica que forma parte de una asociación comunal desde hace cinco años atrás y que en la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta comida, que viene trabajando hace años. El crédito de este ciclo es para ampliación de su negocio (compra de muebles, mismos que serán instalados en el espacio de venta) mismos que adquirirá de las ferias paceñas. Esta forma de trabajo le permite apoyar a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y aprender.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Bolsa Negra" will begin its first loan cycle at Pro Mujer, as part of the Cascada Regional Office. It is made up of eight members with a board of directors headed by Sabina. The members of the communal bank are involved in a variety of businesses, including: food sales, macrame, the sale of paintings, sale of rice, sale of meat pies and sales of provisions on credit. 

Sabina indicates that she has been part of a communal bank for five years and is currently involved in the business of food sales that has been ongoing for years.  The loan from this cycle is to enlarge her business (the purchase of furniture that will be installed in the sales space).  The furniture will be acquired  from markets in La Paz. This form of work allows her to support her family as she is married and has six children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training and to learn.

loans.use: to purchase furniture.

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
La señora Rosalba tiene 21 años de edad, está acompañada con el señor Alvaro, la pareja tiene un hijo de 8 meses. La Sra. Rosalba se dedica al macate desde hace 2 años, en los primeros tiempos vendía ropas para jóvenes como ser  pantalones y remeras, pero ahora está comercializando más perfumes por el gran margen que le deja esta mercadería. Le ayuda su pareja que cuenta con un vehículo y recorren ciudades aledañas y están consiguiendo aumentar su clientela.
 Solicita este préstamo para la compra de perfumes de diferentes marcas y tamaños, con esto le permitirá cubrir todos los pedidos que tiene y así aumentar  sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosalba, 21, lives with Alvaro and they have an 8 month old son.  Rosalba has been working in retail for two years.  When she started out she sold clothes for young adults like pants and t-shirts but now she’s selling perfume because it produces a higher profit margin.  Her spouse who owns a vehicle helps her and they travel to neighboring cities and are managing to increase their clientele.

She is asking for this loan to buy various brands and sizes of perfume so that she can fill all the orders she has and thus increase her income.

loans.use: to buy items to sell.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa de sus padres y nos comenta que desde muy joven empezó a trabajar primeramente como ayudante su tío en la venta.
Víctor al cumplir su  mayoría de edad se compro una moto para así realizar las ventas y él mismo luego cobrar las comisiones debido a que las mercaderías eran de su tío.
Realiza varios kilómetros en su recorrido pues la venta lo realiza en las despensas de la zona, y en distintas ciudades, y a la noche estudio en una facultad nacional en su ciudad. Hoy en día cuenta con clientela formada, necesita el crédito para la compra de especias, remedios yuyos, para que sea más lucrativo su negocio, pues conoce el rubro.
texts.en:
Víctor is 21 years old, single and living in his parents’ house.  He comments that he started working very young helping his uncle sell at the beginning.

When Víctor became an adult he bought a motorcycle to do sales with and to collect commissions since the merchandise belonged to his uncle.

He travels several kilometers in his route because he sells to stores in the zone and in different cities and at night studies in one of the state colleges in his city.  Today, he has a well-established clientele and needs a loan to buy spices and herbal remedies so that his business will be more lucrative since he knows this line of work.

loans.use: to buy spices and natural remedies to sell.

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es:
El Sr. Máximo tiene 29 años de edad, casado con la Sra. Angelina de 28 años de edad, tienen una hermosa hija de 4 años.
El Sr. Máximo, se dedica a la fabricación de muebles y también a la venta ambulante de carbón. Empezó como ayudante en la fabricación de muebles, hace 8 años aproximadamente, y con el transcurrir de los años fue adquiriendo los conocimientos para la fabricación de muebles. Máximo desea ver crecer a su hija y convertirse en alguien en la vida y ser útil para la sociedad y para consigo misma y también anhela de ir creciendo su negocio ya que es el sustento de su familia.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales para los muebles que hace, como ser maderas, clavos, pegamentos y demás. El esta contento por la ayuda que esta recibiendo por parte de la fundación y de kiva.
texts.en: Máximo is 29 years old and married to Angelina, who is 28 years old. They have a beautiful 4-year-old daughter. Máximo works making furniture and also goes around selling charcoal. He started as an assistant in furniture making, approximately 8 years ago, and as the years passed he kept on acquiring the know-how to make furniture. Máximo wishes to see his daughter grow up and become someone in life and be of use to society and to herself. He also longs to grow his business since it supports his family. He is asking for the loan to buy materials for the furniture he makes; being wood, nails, glue and such. He is happy for the help he is receiving from the foundation and from Kiva.

loans.use:
to buy materials to use in his workshop.

.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La Sra. Virginia tiene 52 años y está casada con el  sr. Rufino de 45 años. Tienen 2 hijos, uno de 20 años  y otro de 16 años que está cursando sus estudios secundarios.
El Sr. Rufino trabaja como chofer en una empresa de transporte Público desde hace 20 años por lo que aporta a la canasta familiar. La Sra. Virginia se dedica a la venta ambulante de prendas de vestir y calzados para damas, caballeros y niños desde el año 1983 por lo que cuenta con una clientela formada y fiel. Ella y su marido se ayudan mutuamente para mantener la casa, y fue gracias a estos trabajos que sus hijos tienen la educación que poseen.
La Sra., Virginia desea  solicitar un préstamo, el cual desea invertir en la compra de jeans, prendas de vestir para damas y caballeros y Uniformes para escuelas y colegios. Ella esta muy contenta por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo, pues le será de mucha ayuda el crédito.
texts.en:
Virginia, 52, is married to Rufino, 45, and they have two children one who is 20 and another who is 16 and attending secondary school.

Rufino has been working as a driver for a public transportation firm for 20 years and contributes to household expenses.  Virginia is an itinerant merchant; she’s been selling clothes and shoes for women, men and children since 1983 so she has a well-established, regular clientele.  She and her husband help each other support the home and it was thanks to these jobs that their children have the education they do.

Virginia wants to ask for a loan to buy jeans and articles of clothing for women and men and uniforms for elementary and secondary schools.  She is very happy for the opportunity she’s getting because the loan will be of much help to her.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.es:
La Sra. Miguela enviudo hace dos años y medio, tiene dos hijas que estudian en la facultad y la ayudan en su negocio donde vende de todo. La señora siempre trabajo en el mercado en las ventas y su marido era empleado público.
Con mucho esfuerzo lograron montar un negocio propio en su casa. Actualmente cuentan con varios clientes, generalmente empleados de los comercios vecinos, y nos comenta que le gustaría que sus hijas terminen la universidad y que administren su propio negocio, también quiere tener salones comerciales en su domicilio ya que es muy rentable el alquiler en esa zona.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de artículos de primera necesidad, como ser harina, arroz, fideos y demás insumos, con lo que podrá surtir su local.
texts.en:
Miguela was widowed two years and a half years ago. She has two daughters who study in university and they help her in her business where she sells everything. She has always worked selling in the marketplace and her husband was a civil servant.

With a lot of effort they were able to begin their own business from their home. Currently they have a number of customers, generally employees of neighboring businesses. She tells us that she would like to see her daughters finish university and run their own business. She also wants to have a salon business out of her home since renting is very profitable in this region.

She is asking for the loan to buy basic necessities such as flour, rice, noodles and other goods with which she will be able to supply her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La Esperanza se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá. Está integrado por 16 mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras que siempre se esfuerzan al máximo para poder dar a sus familias un mejor futuro.
Jacinta es una de las miembros del grupo, ella vende comidas de todo tipo, en lo cual le va muy bien, puesto que tiene muy buena sazón para la comida.  Sus clientes acuden a ella, y estos a la vez le promocionan con los demás y es por ello que le van muy bien. Ella se define como una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que lucha por su familia, pues quiere darles un estilo de vida mejor.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, hortalizas, condimentos y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo los alimentos que vende. Agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo por parte de la fundación y de kiva.
texts.en:
This excellent group of women from the city of Itá is called “La Esperanza” (Hope).  It’s composed of 16 very hard working, enterprising women who always strive to the maximum degree to provide their families with a better future.

Jacinta is one of the group members.  She sells all types of meals.  She does very well because her dishes are very tasty.  Customers come to her and they also recommend her to others and this is why she does so well.  She defines herself as a very hardworking, enterprising person who strives for her family because she wants to give them a better lifestyle.

She requests the loan to buy meat, vegetables, condiments and other ingredients to continue making the meals she sells.  They are grateful for the opportunity they are receiving from the Fundación and from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for meal preparation.

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la cuidad de Caacupé. Las señoras están muy satisfechas con el apoyo que les está brindando la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva. Actualmente  están en el ciclo Nº  2 con sus 12 integrantes.
Lidia es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, y nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de leche. Trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día, ya que siempre lleva su producto a la casa de sus clientes para el desayuno. Ella es muy sacrificada, y nos dice que todo es por su familia, ya que quiere darles una mejor vida.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de leche, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y de esa forma cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The women in this committee are from the city off Caacupé.  They are very satisfied with the support they’ve gotten from Fundación Paraguaya and from Kiva.  They are currently in cycle #2 and have 12 members.

Lidia is a very hardworking, enterprising woman who tells us that she sells milk.  She works starting very early in the day because she takes her product to her customers’ houses in time for breakfast.  She is very self-sacrificing and she tells us that everything is for her family because she wants to give them a better life.

She’s asking for the loan to buy milk to stock up with so that she can meet customer demand this way.

loans.use: to buy milk to resell.

loans.name: Djeneba

texts.fr:
DJENEBA est âgée de 39 ans est mariée  sans enfant. Elle   vit dans une famille nucléaire  au quartier Pelengana Sud  de Ségou
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle commença très tôt à s’intéresser aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa mère qui vendait des habits en cotonnade. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à ses côtés, elle  commença à évoluer seule  en menant la même activité du commerce d’habits en cotonnade et surtout de bazin. Elle  mène cette activité depuis 9 ans et jouit d’une grande expérience et clientèle. Sa force de vente est due à la maîtrise du rouage de ce secteur d’activité mais également, à son prix abordable et la qualité de sa marchandise.  
Dans le souci d’augmenter son fonds de commerce et de faire plus de bénéfice, elle sollicite ce prêt. Elle   est à son 1er  prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 2 pièces de bazins riches. Elle  s’approvisionne à Bamako et effectue ses ventes au comptant à une clientèle mixte très généralement elle fait de l’exportation surtout au Sénégal. Avec ce prêt elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 250 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et de mener autres activités génératrices de revenus.
Son ambition est   d’ouvrir une boutique de prêt à porter.
texts.en:
DJENEBA is 29 years old, married, and without children. She lives in a nuclear family in the Pelengana Sud district of Ségou. Not having attended school due to societal reasons, she soon started to become interested in revenue-generating work with her mother, who used to sell cotton clothing. After several years of apprenticeship at her side, she started to work by herself by running the same commercial business in cotton clothing, especially damask. 

DJENEBA has been in this business for nine years and benefits from good experience and a large customer base. Her selling power is due to her mastery of the ins and outs of this business sector but also to her affordable prices and the quality of her merchandise. 

Concerned with increasing her business capital and  making more profit, DJENEBA is requesting a loan. She is on her first individual loan that she intends to use to buy two lengths of <i>riche<i/> damask cloth. She gets her supplies from Bamako and accepts cash from a mixed customer base in general. She exports to Senegal in particular. 

With this loan, she envisions making a monthly profit of 250,000 francs CFA. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and to run other revenue-generating businesses. Her ambition is to open a store for ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.use: to buy damask cloth

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge Madrigal, tiene la edad de 52  años, está casado y vive con el nieto y la esposa. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de unos cerdos de cría y además ayudarse con el concentrado  para el mantenimiento de los mismos cerdos. El cuenta con las instalaciones y las parideras de los cerdos de cría y cuenta ya con dos chanchas de cría ya aumentadas. El quiere comprar dos más para  así producir más cerdos  para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y el de la familia y crecer con el proyecto de cría de cerdos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Jorge Madrigal is 52 years old, married, and lives with his grandson and his wife. With the loan he intends to purchase some pigs to raise and furthermore make use of it to buy feed for the sustenance of these same pigs. He counts on the housing and the birth of more pigs to raise, and he already has two sows who are already fattened up. He wants to buy two more in order to produce more pigs to later sell them in the local market or in the surrounding area. He wants to generate the greatest amount of earnings for his well-being and that of his family, and to grow with his project of raising pigs. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He hadn't had other loans from state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with greater ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Sumber Tanjung Group

texts.en:
To continue and to expand the business, the Sumber Tanjung group decided to take out a new loan. They asked for the same size loan. This loan will be used to purchase piglets and feed.

 Ni Ketut, 41, head of the group, has two adult children. She lives with her husband and one grandchild. Ni Ketut plans to use her new loan to purchase three piglets and feed. The price for local piglets is down now, so she decided to take out the same size loan. She hopes in the next six months, the price will go up again and she can earn a satisfactory price. Ni Ketut is wearing a pink shirt and holding her grandson.

loans.use: To purchase three piglets and feed

loans.name: Zuurabubu

texts.ru: Зуурабубу 54 года.  В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Зуурабубу занимается животноводством.  Начатое в 2006 году с суммы в 5,000 сом хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зуурабубу обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 32,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец и кормов. Доходы Зуурабубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее  увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Zuurabubu is 54 years old. To provide a source of income for her family, Zuurabubu raises livestock. Today her farm, started in 2006 with a sum of 5,000 som, earns around 5,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and dairy products. In order to continue developing her business, Zuurabubu has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 32,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep and animal feed. Zuurabubu plans to invest her profits into further livestock purchases.

loans.use: to buy sheep and animal feed

loans.name: Sumber Rahayu Group

texts.en:
Because they succeeded with the first loan, the Sumber Rahayu group has requested a bigger loan. Now per member they receive 1,5M IDR. The loan will be used to purchase piglets, feed and renovate the barn.

Ni Luh is using her loan to purchase superior piglets. The profit from last loan was used to buy local pigs and renovate the barn. Now she can increase the population of her pigs and she hopes she can be a success. Her husband supports her business because it’s increasing their family income.

loans.use: To purchase superior piglets

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married with one child. She is 38 years old and lives in Comunal, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Jocelyn has a sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living and had this business for three years. Each month, she earns 2000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5000 PHP for additional capital to buy groceries to sell.

Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell retail

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with two children. 

Edgar is providing motorcycle with sidecar transport services. He has had this business for 15 years. He requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

Edgar has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Edgar hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services

loans.name: Silvera

texts.en:
Silvera is 34 years old and is a married woman who lives in the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store business where she sells items like coffee, soap, soy sauce and canned goods. Silvera earns 2000 PHP per month with her business.

Silvera has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, snacks and soft drinks. Silvera plans to use her extra profit to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, snacks and soft drinks

loans.name: Gulzima

texts.ru: Гулзиме 22 года, воспитывает двух сыновей.  В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Гулзима занимается торговлей овощами и фруктами.  Начатый в 2010 году с суммы в 3,000 сом бизнес  на сегодня приносит около 6,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. На сегодняшний день ассортимент товара не представлен в изобилии, поэтому Гулзима обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товарных запасов.  Доходы Гулзима планирует вложить в дальнейшее  расширение своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Gulzima is 22 years old, she is raising two sons. To provide for her family, Gulzima sells fruits and vegetables. She started her business in 2010 with a sum of 3,000 som, and today earns roughly 6,000 som (KGS) per month. Currently, Gulzima does not have a wide variety of items for sale, and so she has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) in order to expand her product range. Gulzima plans to invest her profits into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to broaden the assortment of her products

loans.name: Selepa

texts.en:
Selepa, a 38-year-old married mother of four, owns and operates a business planting and harvesting taro for sale. With two years of experience in this business, she earns 350 talas or U.S. $146 per week.

In 2012, Selepa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services and is now requesting a loan of WST $1000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives. She plans to use the profit from her business to improve/expand her enterprise.

Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Selepa's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.

loans.name: Roland

texts.en:
Roland is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Roland is providing motorcycle with sidecar transport services. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

Roland has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Roland hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services

loans.name: Porferia

texts.en:
Porferia is married with five children. Porferia is 56 years old and lives in Baybay, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Porferia has a general store to earn a living and has had this business for 30 years. Each month, she earns 5000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

Porferia has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Porferia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a farmer in the Kitale area of Western Kenya where he lives with his family of six children, aged between 27 and 12 years. He has been in active farming for 12 years besides running a retail business within the local market.

Samuel has requested a first loan of 31,200 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says he wants to increase the number of his dairy cows in the years to come as well as expanding his entire farm.He is focusing on getting bigger subsequent loans to do better farming.

He says lack of capital and high cost of production are a real challenge to farmers.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mario Damian

texts.es:
Mario es un hombre de 33 años de edad, él tiene 2 pequeños uno de 6 y el otro de 2 años, el constantemente lucha para poder sacar adelante a su péquela familia y está dispuesto a muchas cosas por mejor su calidad de vida.

Actualmente el y su esposa tienen una pollería donde trabajan aproximadamente 6 horas diarias, el negocio básicamente consiste en la venta de pollo a la brasa, un plato muy conocido en el país, acompañado con papas fritas, ensalada y algunas cremas. Este plato es usualmente consumido los fines de semana por las familias. 
Mario considera que tiene afluencia de clientes debido a que tiene una buena sazón, fue su esposa la que lo entusiasmo en abrir este tipo de negocio y es desde entonces que laboran juntos. 

Actualmente necesitan que los prestatarios Kiva puedan ayudarlos y así ambientar algunas partes de su local, para que los clientes se sientan atraídos y estén decididos a continuar comprando en el mismo lugar. Con gran esfuerzo mejorar sus ingresos y desean que en algunos años su negocio pueda ser ampliado y desde luego ampliar su local.
texts.en:
Mario, age 33, has two little ones, ages six and two.  He constantly struggles to be able to get his small family ahead.  He is willing to do many things in order to improve his quality of life.

He and his wife currently have a business selling chicken, and they work approximately six hours a day at the business.  Basically, the business consists of selling rotisserie chicken, a well-known dish in the country.  It is accompanied by french fries, salad, and some sauces.  This dish is usually eaten by families on the week-ends.

Mario believes that he has a lot of customers because of his good seasoning.  It was his wife who encouraged him to open this type of business.  Ever since then they have worked together.

He now needs the Kiva lenders' help.  They want to liven up some parts of their place to attract and keep customers.  With great effort to improve their income, they want to expand their business in a few years.  Then, they want to expand their location.

loans.use: to improve the ambiance of his chicken business.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is married with four children. She is 41 years old and lives in Cabangcalan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Elsa has a sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living and had this business for one year. Each month, she earns 3000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5000 PHP for additional capital to buy groceries for resale.

Elsa has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Elsa hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell retail

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with two children. 

Domingo is providing motorcycle with sidecar transport services. He has had this business for 15 years. He requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

Domingo has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Domingo hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services

loans.name: Julio Moises

texts.es:
Julio Moises tiene 22 años de edad es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.
La VRC Emmanuel está conformada por 12 socios esta ventanilla queda a 40 minutos de la oficina ubicada en el recinto San Juan de Llullundongo perteneciente a Guaranda.
Julio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de papas, maíz, habas, además cría pollos, ganado.
Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, fertilizantes, abono orgánico, ranger para la maleza. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá salvar los cultivos.
